verses.name: Psalms 1:1
verses.text: Blessed is the man who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked or stand in the way of sinners or sit in the seat of mockers.

verses.name: Psalms 1:2
verses.text: But his delight is in the law of the LORD, and on his law he meditates day and night.

verses.name: Psalms 1:3
verses.text: He is like a tree planted by streams of water, which yields its fruit in season and whose leaf does not wither. Whatever he does prospers.

verses.name: Psalms 1:4
verses.text: Not so the wicked! They are like chaff that the wind blows away.

verses.name: Psalms 1:5
verses.text: Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 1:6
verses.text: For the LORD watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked will perish.

verses.name: Psalms 2:1
verses.text: Why do the nations conspire and the peoples plot in vain?

verses.name: Psalms 2:2
verses.text: The kings of the earth take their stand and the rulers gather together against the LORD and against his Anointed One.

verses.name: Psalms 2:3
verses.text: "Let us break their chains," they say, "and throw off their fetters."

verses.name: Psalms 2:4
verses.text: The One enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord scoffs at them.

verses.name: Psalms 2:5
verses.text: Then he rebukes them in his anger and terrifies them in his wrath, saying,

verses.name: Psalms 2:6
verses.text: "I have installed my King on Zion, my holy hill."

verses.name: Psalms 2:7
verses.text: I will proclaim the decree of the LORD: He said to me, "You are my Son; today I have become your Father.

verses.name: Psalms 2:8
verses.text: Ask of me, and I will make the nations your inheritance, the ends of the earth your possession.

verses.name: Psalms 2:9
verses.text: You will rule them with an iron scepter; you will dash them to pieces like pottery."

verses.name: Psalms 2:10
verses.text: Therefore, you kings, be wise; be warned, you rulers of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 2:11
verses.text: Serve the LORD with fear and rejoice with trembling.

verses.name: Psalms 2:12
verses.text: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry and you be destroyed in your way, for his wrath can flare up in a moment. Blessed are all who take refuge in him.

verses.name: Psalms 3:1
verses.text: O LORD, how many are my foes! How many rise up against me!

verses.name: Psalms 3:2
verses.text: Many are saying of me, "God will not deliver him." Selah

verses.name: Psalms 3:3
verses.text: But you are a shield around me, O LORD; you bestow glory on me and lift up my head.

verses.name: Psalms 3:4
verses.text: To the LORD I cry aloud, and he answers me from his holy hill. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 3:5
verses.text: I lie down and sleep; I wake again, because the LORD sustains me.

verses.name: Psalms 3:6
verses.text: I will not fear the tens of thousands drawn up against me on every side.

verses.name: Psalms 3:7
verses.text: Arise, O LORD! Deliver me, O my God! Strike all my enemies on the jaw; break the teeth of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 3:8
verses.text: From the LORD comes deliverance. May your blessing be on your people. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 4:1
verses.text: Answer me when I call to you, O my righteous God. Give me relief from my distress; be merciful to me and hear my prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 4:2
verses.text: How long, O men, will you turn my glory into shame? How long will you love delusions and seek false gods? Selah

verses.name: Psalms 4:3
verses.text: Know that the LORD has set apart the godly for himself; the LORD will hear when I call to him.

verses.name: Psalms 4:4
verses.text: In your anger do not sin; when you are on your beds, search your hearts and be silent. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 4:5
verses.text: Offer right sacrifices and trust in the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 4:6
verses.text: Many are asking, "Who can show us any good?" Let the light of your face shine upon us, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 4:7
verses.text: You have filled my heart with greater joy than when their grain and new wine abound.

verses.name: Psalms 4:8
verses.text: I will lie down and sleep in peace, for you alone, O LORD, make me dwell in safety.

verses.name: Psalms 5:1
verses.text: Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my sighing.

verses.name: Psalms 5:2
verses.text: Listen to my cry for help, my King and my God, for to you I pray.

verses.name: Psalms 5:3
verses.text: In the morning, O LORD, you hear my voice; in the morning I lay my requests before you and wait in expectation.

verses.name: Psalms 5:4
verses.text: You are not a God who takes pleasure in evil; with you the wicked cannot dwell.

verses.name: Psalms 5:5
verses.text: The arrogant cannot stand in your presence; you hate all who do wrong.

verses.name: Psalms 5:6
verses.text: You destroy those who tell lies; bloodthirsty and deceitful men the LORD abhors.

verses.name: Psalms 5:7
verses.text: But I, by your great mercy, will come into your house; in reverence will I bow down toward your holy temple.

verses.name: Psalms 5:8
verses.text: Lead me, O LORD, in your righteousness because of my enemies- make straight your way before me.

verses.name: Psalms 5:9
verses.text: Not a word from their mouth can be trusted; their heart is filled with destruction. Their throat is an open grave; with their tongue they speak deceit.

verses.name: Psalms 5:10
verses.text: Declare them guilty, O God! Let their intrigues be their downfall. Banish them for their many sins, for they have rebelled against you.

verses.name: Psalms 5:11
verses.text: But let all who take refuge in you be glad; let them ever sing for joy. Spread your protection over them, that those who love your name may rejoice in you.

verses.name: Psalms 5:12
verses.text: For surely, O LORD, you bless the righteous; you surround them with your favor as with a shield.

verses.name: Psalms 6:1
verses.text: O LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 6:2
verses.text: Be merciful to me, LORD, for I am faint; O LORD, heal me, for my bones are in agony.

verses.name: Psalms 6:3
verses.text: My soul is in anguish. How long, O LORD, how long?

verses.name: Psalms 6:4
verses.text: Turn, O LORD, and deliver me; save me because of your unfailing love.

verses.name: Psalms 6:5
verses.text: No one remembers you when he is dead. Who praises you from the grave?

verses.name: Psalms 6:6
verses.text: I am worn out from groaning; all night long I flood my bed with weeping and drench my couch with tears.

verses.name: Psalms 6:7
verses.text: My eyes grow weak with sorrow; they fail because of all my foes.

verses.name: Psalms 6:8
verses.text: Away from me, all you who do evil, for the LORD has heard my weeping.

verses.name: Psalms 6:9
verses.text: The LORD has heard my cry for mercy; the LORD accepts my prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 6:10
verses.text: All my enemies will be ashamed and dismayed; they will turn back in sudden disgrace.

verses.name: Psalms 7:1
verses.text: O LORD my God, I take refuge in you; save and deliver me from all who pursue me,

verses.name: Psalms 7:2
verses.text: or they will tear me like a lion and rip me to pieces with no one to rescue me.

verses.name: Psalms 7:3
verses.text: O LORD my God, if I have done this and there is guilt on my hands-

verses.name: Psalms 7:4
verses.text: if I have done evil to him who is at peace with me or without cause have robbed my foe-

verses.name: Psalms 7:5
verses.text: then let my enemy pursue and overtake me; let him trample my life to the ground and make me sleep in the dust. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 7:6
verses.text: Arise, O LORD, in your anger; rise up against the rage of my enemies. Awake, my God; decree justice.

verses.name: Psalms 7:7
verses.text: Let the assembled peoples gather around you. Rule over them from on high;

verses.name: Psalms 7:8
verses.text: let the LORD judge the peoples. Judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, according to my integrity, O Most High.

verses.name: Psalms 7:9
verses.text: O righteous God, who searches minds and hearts, bring to an end the violence of the wicked and make the righteous secure.

verses.name: Psalms 7:10
verses.text: My shield is God Most High, who saves the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 7:11
verses.text: God is a righteous judge, a God who expresses his wrath every day.

verses.name: Psalms 7:12
verses.text: If he does not relent, he will sharpen his sword; he will bend and string his bow.

verses.name: Psalms 7:13
verses.text: He has prepared his deadly weapons; he makes ready his flaming arrows.

verses.name: Psalms 7:14
verses.text: He who is pregnant with evil and conceives trouble gives birth to disillusionment.

verses.name: Psalms 7:15
verses.text: He who digs a hole and scoops it out falls into the pit he has made.

verses.name: Psalms 7:16
verses.text: The trouble he causes recoils on himself; his violence comes down on his own head.

verses.name: Psalms 7:17
verses.text: I will give thanks to the LORD because of his righteousness and will sing praise to the name of the LORD Most High.

verses.name: Psalms 8:1
verses.text: O LORD, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth! You have set your glory above the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 8:2
verses.text: From the lips of children and infants you have ordained praise because of your enemies, to silence the foe and the avenger.

verses.name: Psalms 8:3
verses.text: When I consider your heavens, the work of your fingers, the moon and the stars, which you have set in place,

verses.name: Psalms 8:4
verses.text: what is man that you are mindful of him, the son of man that you care for him?

verses.name: Psalms 8:5
verses.text: You made him a little lower than the heavenly beings and crowned him with glory and honor.

verses.name: Psalms 8:6
verses.text: You made him ruler over the works of your hands; you put everything under his feet:

verses.name: Psalms 8:7
verses.text: all flocks and herds, and the beasts of the field,

verses.name: Psalms 8:8
verses.text: the birds of the air, and the fish of the sea, all that swim the paths of the seas.

verses.name: Psalms 8:9
verses.text: O LORD, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth!

verses.name: Psalms 9:1
verses.text: I will praise you, O LORD, with all my heart; I will tell of all your wonders.

verses.name: Psalms 9:2
verses.text: I will be glad and rejoice in you; I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.

verses.name: Psalms 9:3
verses.text: My enemies turn back; they stumble and perish before you.

verses.name: Psalms 9:4
verses.text: For you have upheld my right and my cause; you have sat on your throne, judging righteously.

verses.name: Psalms 9:5
verses.text: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked; you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 9:6
verses.text: Endless ruin has overtaken the enemy, you have uprooted their cities; even the memory of them has perished.

verses.name: Psalms 9:7
verses.text: The LORD reigns forever; he has established his throne for judgment.

verses.name: Psalms 9:8
verses.text: He will judge the world in righteousness; he will govern the peoples with justice.

verses.name: Psalms 9:9
verses.text: The LORD is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 9:10
verses.text: Those who know your name will trust in you, for you, LORD, have never forsaken those who seek you.

verses.name: Psalms 9:11
verses.text: Sing praises to the LORD, enthroned in Zion; proclaim among the nations what he has done.

verses.name: Psalms 9:12
verses.text: For he who avenges blood remembers; he does not ignore the cry of the afflicted.

verses.name: Psalms 9:13
verses.text: O LORD, see how my enemies persecute me! Have mercy and lift me up from the gates of death,

verses.name: Psalms 9:14
verses.text: that I may declare your praises in the gates of the Daughter of Zion and there rejoice in your salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 9:15
verses.text: The nations have fallen into the pit they have dug; their feet are caught in the net they have hidden.

verses.name: Psalms 9:16
verses.text: The LORD is known by his justice; the wicked are ensnared by the work of their hands. Higgaion. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 9:17
verses.text: The wicked return to the grave, all the nations that forget God.

verses.name: Psalms 9:18
verses.text: But the needy will not always be forgotten, nor the hope of the afflicted ever perish.

verses.name: Psalms 9:19
verses.text: Arise, O LORD, let not man triumph; let the nations be judged in your presence.

verses.name: Psalms 9:20
verses.text: Strike them with terror, O LORD; let the nations know they are but men. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 10:1
verses.text: Why, O LORD, do you stand far off? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?

verses.name: Psalms 10:2
verses.text: In his arrogance the wicked man hunts down the weak, who are caught in the schemes he devises.

verses.name: Psalms 10:3
verses.text: He boasts of the cravings of his heart; he blesses the greedy and reviles the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 10:4
verses.text: In his pride the wicked does not seek him; in all his thoughts there is no room for God.

verses.name: Psalms 10:5
verses.text: His ways are always prosperous; he is haughty and your laws are far from him; he sneers at all his enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 10:6
verses.text: He says to himself, "Nothing will shake me; I'll always be happy and never have trouble."

verses.name: Psalms 10:7
verses.text: His mouth is full of curses and lies and threats; trouble and evil are under his tongue.

verses.name: Psalms 10:8
verses.text: He lies in wait near the villages; from ambush he murders the innocent, watching in secret for his victims.

verses.name: Psalms 10:9
verses.text: He lies in wait like a lion in cover; he lies in wait to catch the helpless; he catches the helpless and drags them off in his net.

verses.name: Psalms 10:10
verses.text: His victims are crushed, they collapse; they fall under his strength.

verses.name: Psalms 10:11
verses.text: He says to himself, "God has forgotten; he covers his face and never sees."

verses.name: Psalms 10:12
verses.text: Arise, LORD! Lift up your hand, O God. Do not forget the helpless.

verses.name: Psalms 10:13
verses.text: Why does the wicked man revile God? Why does he say to himself, "He won't call me to account"?

verses.name: Psalms 10:14
verses.text: But you, O God, do see trouble and grief; you consider it to take it in hand. The victim commits himself to you; you are the helper of the fatherless.

verses.name: Psalms 10:15
verses.text: Break the arm of the wicked and evil man; call him to account for his wickedness that would not be found out.

verses.name: Psalms 10:16
verses.text: The LORD is King for ever and ever; the nations will perish from his land.

verses.name: Psalms 10:17
verses.text: You hear, O LORD, the desire of the afflicted; you encourage them, and you listen to their cry,

verses.name: Psalms 10:18
verses.text: defending the fatherless and the oppressed, in order that man, who is of the earth, may terrify no more.

verses.name: Psalms 11:1
verses.text: In the LORD I take refuge. How then can you say to me: "Flee like a bird to your mountain.

verses.name: Psalms 11:2
verses.text: For look, the wicked bend their bows; they set their arrows against the strings to shoot from the shadows at the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 11:3
verses.text: When the foundations are being destroyed, what can the righteous do?"

verses.name: Psalms 11:4
verses.text: The LORD is in his holy temple; the LORD is on his heavenly throne. He observes the sons of men; his eyes examine them.

verses.name: Psalms 11:5
verses.text: The LORD examines the righteous, but the wicked and those who love violence his soul hates.

verses.name: Psalms 11:6
verses.text: On the wicked he will rain fiery coals and burning sulfur; a scorching wind will be their lot.

verses.name: Psalms 11:7
verses.text: For the LORD is righteous, he loves justice; upright men will see his face.

verses.name: Psalms 12:1
verses.text: Help, LORD, for the godly are no more; the faithful have vanished from among men.

verses.name: Psalms 12:2
verses.text: Everyone lies to his neighbor; their flattering lips speak with deception.

verses.name: Psalms 12:3
verses.text: May the LORD cut off all flattering lips and every boastful tongue

verses.name: Psalms 12:4
verses.text: that says, "We will triumph with our tongues; we own our lips -who is our master?"

verses.name: Psalms 12:5
verses.text: "Because of the oppression of the weak and the groaning of the needy, I will now arise," says the LORD. "I will protect them from those who malign them."

verses.name: Psalms 12:6
verses.text: And the words of the LORD are flawless, like silver refined in a furnace of clay, purified seven times.

verses.name: Psalms 12:7
verses.text: O LORD, you will keep us safe and protect us from such people forever.

verses.name: Psalms 12:8
verses.text: The wicked freely strut about when what is vile is honored among men.

verses.name: Psalms 13:1
verses.text: How long, O LORD? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?

verses.name: Psalms 13:2
verses.text: How long must I wrestle with my thoughts and every day have sorrow in my heart? How long will my enemy triumph over me?

verses.name: Psalms 13:3
verses.text: Look on me and answer, O LORD my God. Give light to my eyes, or I will sleep in death;

verses.name: Psalms 13:4
verses.text: my enemy will say, "I have overcome him," and my foes will rejoice when I fall.

verses.name: Psalms 13:5
verses.text: But I trust in your unfailing love; my heart rejoices in your salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 13:6
verses.text: I will sing to the LORD, for he has been good to me.

verses.name: Psalms 14:1
verses.text: The fool says in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt, their deeds are vile; there is no one who does good.

verses.name: Psalms 14:2
verses.text: The LORD looks down from heaven on the sons of men to see if there are any who understand, any who seek God.

verses.name: Psalms 14:3
verses.text: All have turned aside, they have together become corrupt; there is no one who does good, not even one.

verses.name: Psalms 14:4
verses.text: Will evildoers never learn- those who devour my people as men eat bread and who do not call on the LORD?

verses.name: Psalms 14:5
verses.text: There they are, overwhelmed with dread, for God is present in the company of the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 14:6
verses.text: You evildoers frustrate the plans of the poor, but the LORD is their refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 14:7
verses.text: Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When the LORD restores the fortunes of his people, let Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad!

verses.name: Psalms 15:1
verses.text: LORD, who may dwell in your sanctuary? Who may live on your holy hill?

verses.name: Psalms 15:2
verses.text: He whose walk is blameless and who does what is righteous, who speaks the truth from his heart

verses.name: Psalms 15:3
verses.text: and has no slander on his tongue, who does his neighbor no wrong and casts no slur on his fellowman,

verses.name: Psalms 15:4
verses.text: who despises a vile man but honors those who fear the LORD, who keeps his oath even when it hurts,

verses.name: Psalms 15:5
verses.text: who lends his money without usury and does not accept a bribe against the innocent. He who does these things will never be shaken.

verses.name: Psalms 16:1
verses.text: Keep me safe, O God, for in you I take refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 16:2
verses.text: I said to the LORD, "You are my Lord; apart from you I have no good thing."

verses.name: Psalms 16:3
verses.text: As for the saints who are in the land, they are the glorious ones in whom is all my delight.

verses.name: Psalms 16:4
verses.text: The sorrows of those will increase who run after other gods. I will not pour out their libations of blood or take up their names on my lips.

verses.name: Psalms 16:5
verses.text: LORD, you have assigned me my portion and my cup; you have made my lot secure.

verses.name: Psalms 16:6
verses.text: The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 16:7
verses.text: I will praise the LORD, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me.

verses.name: Psalms 16:8
verses.text: I have set the LORD always before me. Because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.

verses.name: Psalms 16:9
verses.text: Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices; my body also will rest secure,

verses.name: Psalms 16:10
verses.text: because you will not abandon me to the grave, nor will you let your Holy One see decay.

verses.name: Psalms 16:11
verses.text: You have made known to me the path of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence, with eternal pleasures at your right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 17:1
verses.text: Hear, O LORD, my righteous plea; listen to my cry. Give ear to my prayer- it does not rise from deceitful lips.

verses.name: Psalms 17:2
verses.text: May my vindication come from you; may your eyes see what is right.

verses.name: Psalms 17:3
verses.text: Though you probe my heart and examine me at night, though you test me, you will find nothing; I have resolved that my mouth will not sin.

verses.name: Psalms 17:4
verses.text: As for the deeds of men- by the word of your lips I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.

verses.name: Psalms 17:5
verses.text: My steps have held to your paths; my feet have not slipped.

verses.name: Psalms 17:6
verses.text: I call on you, O God, for you will answer me; give ear to me and hear my prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 17:7
verses.text: Show the wonder of your great love, you who save by your right hand those who take refuge in you from their foes.

verses.name: Psalms 17:8
verses.text: Keep me as the apple of your eye; hide me in the shadow of your wings

verses.name: Psalms 17:9
verses.text: from the wicked who assail me, from my mortal enemies who surround me.

verses.name: Psalms 17:10
verses.text: They close up their callous hearts, and their mouths speak with arrogance.

verses.name: Psalms 17:11
verses.text: They have tracked me down, they now surround me, with eyes alert, to throw me to the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 17:12
verses.text: They are like a lion hungry for prey, like a great lion crouching in cover.

verses.name: Psalms 17:13
verses.text: Rise up, O LORD, confront them, bring them down; rescue me from the wicked by your sword.

verses.name: Psalms 17:14
verses.text: O LORD, by your hand save me from such men, from men of this world whose reward is in this life. You still the hunger of those you cherish; their sons have plenty, and they store up wealth for their children.

verses.name: Psalms 17:15
verses.text: And I-in righteousness I will see your face; when I awake, I will be satisfied with seeing your likeness.

verses.name: Psalms 18:1
verses.text: I love you, O LORD, my strength.

verses.name: Psalms 18:2
verses.text: The LORD is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge. He is my shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold.

verses.name: Psalms 18:3
verses.text: I call to the LORD, who is worthy of praise, and I am saved from my enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 18:4
verses.text: The cords of death entangled me; the torrents of destruction overwhelmed me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:5
verses.text: The cords of the grave coiled around me; the snares of death confronted me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:6
verses.text: In my distress I called to the LORD; I cried to my God for help. From his temple he heard my voice; my cry came before him, into his ears.

verses.name: Psalms 18:7
verses.text: The earth trembled and quaked, and the foundations of the mountains shook; they trembled because he was angry.

verses.name: Psalms 18:8
verses.text: Smoke rose from his nostrils; consuming fire came from his mouth, burning coals blazed out of it.

verses.name: Psalms 18:9
verses.text: He parted the heavens and came down; dark clouds were under his feet.

verses.name: Psalms 18:10
verses.text: He mounted the cherubim and flew; he soared on the wings of the wind.

verses.name: Psalms 18:11
verses.text: He made darkness his covering, his canopy around him- the dark rain clouds of the sky.

verses.name: Psalms 18:12
verses.text: Out of the brightness of his presence clouds advanced, with hailstones and bolts of lightning.

verses.name: Psalms 18:13
verses.text: The LORD thundered from heaven; the voice of the Most High resounded.

verses.name: Psalms 18:14
verses.text: He shot his arrows and scattered the enemies, great bolts of lightning and routed them.

verses.name: Psalms 18:15
verses.text: The valleys of the sea were exposed and the foundations of the earth laid bare at your rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of breath from your nostrils.

verses.name: Psalms 18:16
verses.text: He reached down from on high and took hold of me; he drew me out of deep waters.

verses.name: Psalms 18:17
verses.text: He rescued me from my powerful enemy, from my foes, who were too strong for me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:18
verses.text: They confronted me in the day of my disaster, but the LORD was my support.

verses.name: Psalms 18:19
verses.text: He brought me out into a spacious place; he rescued me because he delighted in me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:20
verses.text: The LORD has dealt with me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands he has rewarded me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:21
verses.text: For I have kept the ways of the LORD; I have not done evil by turning from my God.

verses.name: Psalms 18:22
verses.text: All his laws are before me; I have not turned away from his decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 18:23
verses.text: I have been blameless before him and have kept myself from sin.

verses.name: Psalms 18:24
verses.text: The LORD has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.

verses.name: Psalms 18:25
verses.text: To the faithful you show yourself faithful, to the blameless you show yourself blameless,

verses.name: Psalms 18:26
verses.text: to the pure you show yourself pure, but to the crooked you show yourself shrewd.

verses.name: Psalms 18:27
verses.text: You save the humble but bring low those whose eyes are haughty.

verses.name: Psalms 18:28
verses.text: You, O LORD, keep my lamp burning; my God turns my darkness into light.

verses.name: Psalms 18:29
verses.text: With your help I can advance against a troop; with my God I can scale a wall.

verses.name: Psalms 18:30
verses.text: As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the LORD is flawless. He is a shield for all who take refuge in him.

verses.name: Psalms 18:31
verses.text: For who is God besides the LORD? And who is the Rock except our God?

verses.name: Psalms 18:32
verses.text: It is God who arms me with strength and makes my way perfect.

verses.name: Psalms 18:33
verses.text: He makes my feet like the feet of a deer; he enables me to stand on the heights.

verses.name: Psalms 18:34
verses.text: He trains my hands for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

verses.name: Psalms 18:35
verses.text: You give me your shield of victory, and your right hand sustains me; you stoop down to make me great.

verses.name: Psalms 18:36
verses.text: You broaden the path beneath me, so that my ankles do not turn.

verses.name: Psalms 18:37
verses.text: I pursued my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn back till they were destroyed.

verses.name: Psalms 18:38
verses.text: I crushed them so that they could not rise; they fell beneath my feet.

verses.name: Psalms 18:39
verses.text: You armed me with strength for battle; you made my adversaries bow at my feet.

verses.name: Psalms 18:40
verses.text: You made my enemies turn their backs in flight, and I destroyed my foes.

verses.name: Psalms 18:41
verses.text: They cried for help, but there was no one to save them- to the LORD, but he did not answer.

verses.name: Psalms 18:42
verses.text: I beat them as fine as dust borne on the wind; I poured them out like mud in the streets.

verses.name: Psalms 18:43
verses.text: You have delivered me from the attacks of the people; you have made me the head of nations; people I did not know are subject to me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:44
verses.text: As soon as they hear me, they obey me; foreigners cringe before me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:45
verses.text: They all lose heart; they come trembling from their strongholds.

verses.name: Psalms 18:46
verses.text: The LORD lives! Praise be to my Rock! Exalted be God my Savior!

verses.name: Psalms 18:47
verses.text: He is the God who avenges me, who subdues nations under me,

verses.name: Psalms 18:48
verses.text: who saves me from my enemies. You exalted me above my foes; from violent men you rescued me.

verses.name: Psalms 18:49
verses.text: Therefore I will praise you among the nations, O LORD; I will sing praises to your name.

verses.name: Psalms 18:50
verses.text: He gives his king great victories; he shows unfailing kindness to his anointed, to David and his descendants forever.

verses.name: Psalms 19:1
verses.text: The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands.

verses.name: Psalms 19:2
verses.text: Day after day they pour forth speech; night after night they display knowledge.

verses.name: Psalms 19:3
verses.text: There is no speech or language where their voice is not heard.

verses.name: Psalms 19:4
verses.text: Their voice goes out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world. In the heavens he has pitched a tent for the sun,

verses.name: Psalms 19:5
verses.text: which is like a bridegroom coming forth from his pavilion, like a champion rejoicing to run his course.

verses.name: Psalms 19:6
verses.text: It rises at one end of the heavens and makes its circuit to the other; nothing is hidden from its heat.

verses.name: Psalms 19:7
verses.text: The law of the LORD is perfect, reviving the soul. The statutes of the LORD are trustworthy, making wise the simple.

verses.name: Psalms 19:8
verses.text: The precepts of the LORD are right, giving joy to the heart. The commands of the LORD are radiant, giving light to the eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 19:9
verses.text: The fear of the LORD is pure, enduring forever. The ordinances of the LORD are sure and altogether righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 19:10
verses.text: They are more precious than gold, than much pure gold; they are sweeter than honey, than honey from the comb.

verses.name: Psalms 19:11
verses.text: By them is your servant warned; in keeping them there is great reward.

verses.name: Psalms 19:12
verses.text: Who can discern his errors? Forgive my hidden faults.

verses.name: Psalms 19:13
verses.text: Keep your servant also from willful sins; may they not rule over me. Then will I be blameless, innocent of great transgression.

verses.name: Psalms 19:14
verses.text: May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be pleasing in your sight, O Lord, my Rock and my Redeemer.

verses.name: Psalms 20:1
verses.text: May the LORD answer you when you are in distress; may the name of the God of Jacob protect you.

verses.name: Psalms 20:2
verses.text: May he send you help from the sanctuary and grant you support from Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 20:3
verses.text: May he remember all your sacrifices and accept your burnt offerings. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 20:4
verses.text: May he give you the desire of your heart and make all your plans succeed.

verses.name: Psalms 20:5
verses.text: We will shout for joy when you are victorious and will lift up our banners in the name of our God. May the LORD grant all your requests.

verses.name: Psalms 20:6
verses.text: Now I know that the LORD saves his anointed; he answers him from his holy heaven with the saving power of his right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 20:7
verses.text: Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the LORD our God.

verses.name: Psalms 20:8
verses.text: They are brought to their knees and fall, but we rise up and stand firm.

verses.name: Psalms 20:9
verses.text: O LORD, save the king! Answer us when we call!

verses.name: Psalms 21:1
verses.text: O LORD, the king rejoices in your strength. How great is his joy in the victories you give!

verses.name: Psalms 21:2
verses.text: You have granted him the desire of his heart and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 21:3
verses.text: You welcomed him with rich blessings and placed a crown of pure gold on his head.

verses.name: Psalms 21:4
verses.text: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him- length of days, for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 21:5
verses.text: Through the victories you gave, his glory is great; you have bestowed on him splendor and majesty.

verses.name: Psalms 21:6
verses.text: Surely you have granted him eternal blessings and made him glad with the joy of your presence.

verses.name: Psalms 21:7
verses.text: For the king trusts in the LORD; through the unfailing love of the Most High he will not be shaken.

verses.name: Psalms 21:8
verses.text: Your hand will lay hold on all your enemies; your right hand will seize your foes.

verses.name: Psalms 21:9
verses.text: At the time of your appearing you will make them like a fiery furnace. In his wrath the LORD will swallow them up, and his fire will consume them.

verses.name: Psalms 21:10
verses.text: You will destroy their descendants from the earth, their posterity from mankind.

verses.name: Psalms 21:11
verses.text: Though they plot evil against you and devise wicked schemes, they cannot succeed;

verses.name: Psalms 21:12
verses.text: for you will make them turn their backs when you aim at them with drawn bow.

verses.name: Psalms 21:13
verses.text: Be exalted, O LORD, in your strength; we will sing and praise your might.

verses.name: Psalms 22:1
verses.text: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, so far from the words of my groaning?

verses.name: Psalms 22:2
verses.text: O my God, I cry out by day, but you do not answer, by night, and am not silent.

verses.name: Psalms 22:3
verses.text: Yet you are enthroned as the Holy One; you are the praise of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 22:4
verses.text: In you our fathers put their trust; they trusted and you delivered them.

verses.name: Psalms 22:5
verses.text: They cried to you and were saved; in you they trusted and were not disappointed.

verses.name: Psalms 22:6
verses.text: But I am a worm and not a man, scorned by men and despised by the people.

verses.name: Psalms 22:7
verses.text: All who see me mock me; they hurl insults, shaking their heads:

verses.name: Psalms 22:8
verses.text: "He trusts in the LORD; let the LORD rescue him. Let him deliver him, since he delights in him."

verses.name: Psalms 22:9
verses.text: Yet you brought me out of the womb; you made me trust in you even at my mother's breast.

verses.name: Psalms 22:10
verses.text: From birth I was cast upon you; from my mother's womb you have been my God.

verses.name: Psalms 22:11
verses.text: Do not be far from me, for trouble is near and there is no one to help.

verses.name: Psalms 22:12
verses.text: Many bulls surround me; strong bulls of Bashan encircle me.

verses.name: Psalms 22:13
verses.text: Roaring lions tearing their prey open their mouths wide against me.

verses.name: Psalms 22:14
verses.text: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint. My heart has turned to wax; it has melted away within me.

verses.name: Psalms 22:15
verses.text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth; you lay me in the dust of death.

verses.name: Psalms 22:16
verses.text: Dogs have surrounded me; a band of evil men has encircled me, they have pierced my hands and my feet.

verses.name: Psalms 22:17
verses.text: I can count all my bones; people stare and gloat over me.

verses.name: Psalms 22:18
verses.text: They divide my garments among them and cast lots for my clothing.

verses.name: Psalms 22:19
verses.text: But you, O LORD, be not far off; O my Strength, come quickly to help me.

verses.name: Psalms 22:20
verses.text: Deliver my life from the sword, my precious life from the power of the dogs.

verses.name: Psalms 22:21
verses.text: Rescue me from the mouth of the lions; save me from the horns of the wild oxen.

verses.name: Psalms 22:22
verses.text: I will declare your name to my brothers; in the congregation I will praise you.

verses.name: Psalms 22:23
verses.text: You who fear the LORD, praise him! All you descendants of Jacob, honor him! Revere him, all you descendants of Israel!

verses.name: Psalms 22:24
verses.text: For he has not despised or disdained the suffering of the afflicted one; he has not hidden his face from him but has listened to his cry for help.

verses.name: Psalms 22:25
verses.text: From you comes the theme of my praise in the great assembly; before those who fear you will I fulfill my vows.

verses.name: Psalms 22:26
verses.text: The poor will eat and be satisfied; they who seek the LORD will praise him- may your hearts live forever!

verses.name: Psalms 22:27
verses.text: All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the LORD, and all the families of the nations will bow down before him,

verses.name: Psalms 22:28
verses.text: for dominion belongs to the LORD and he rules over the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 22:29
verses.text: All the rich of the earth will feast and worship; all who go down to the dust will kneel before him- those who cannot keep themselves alive.

verses.name: Psalms 22:30
verses.text: Posterity will serve him; future generations will be told about the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 22:31
verses.text: They will proclaim his righteousness to a people yet unborn- for he has done it.

verses.name: Psalms 23:1
verses.text: The LORD is my shepherd, I shall not be in want.

verses.name: Psalms 23:2
verses.text: He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters,

verses.name: Psalms 23:3
verses.text: he restores my soul. He guides me in paths of righteousness for his name's sake.

verses.name: Psalms 23:4
verses.text: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

verses.name: Psalms 23:5
verses.text: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows.

verses.name: Psalms 23:6
verses.text: Surely goodness and love will follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the LORD forever.

verses.name: Psalms 24:1
verses.text: The earth is the LORD's, and everything in it, the world, and all who live in it;

verses.name: Psalms 24:2
verses.text: for he founded it upon the seas and established it upon the waters.

verses.name: Psalms 24:3
verses.text: Who may ascend the hill of the LORD? Who may stand in his holy place?

verses.name: Psalms 24:4
verses.text: He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to an idol or swear by what is false.

verses.name: Psalms 24:5
verses.text: He will receive blessing from the LORD and vindication from God his Savior.

verses.name: Psalms 24:6
verses.text: Such is the generation of those who seek him, who seek your face, O God of Jacob. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 24:7
verses.text: Lift up your heads, O you gates; be lifted up, you ancient doors, that the King of glory may come in.

verses.name: Psalms 24:8
verses.text: Who is this King of glory? The LORD strong and mighty, the LORD mighty in battle.

verses.name: Psalms 24:9
verses.text: Lift up your heads, O you gates; lift them up, you ancient doors, that the King of glory may come in.

verses.name: Psalms 24:10
verses.text: Who is he, this King of glory? The LORD Almighty- he is the King of glory. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 25:1
verses.text: To you, O LORD, I lift up my soul;

verses.name: Psalms 25:2
verses.text: in you I trust, O my God. Do not let me be put to shame, nor let my enemies triumph over me.

verses.name: Psalms 25:3
verses.text: No one whose hope is in you will ever be put to shame, but they will be put to shame who are treacherous without excuse.

verses.name: Psalms 25:4
verses.text: Show me your ways, O LORD, teach me your paths;

verses.name: Psalms 25:5
verses.text: guide me in your truth and teach me, for you are God my Savior, and my hope is in you all day long.

verses.name: Psalms 25:6
verses.text: Remember, O LORD, your great mercy and love, for they are from of old.

verses.name: Psalms 25:7
verses.text: Remember not the sins of my youth and my rebellious ways; according to your love remember me, for you are good, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 25:8
verses.text: Good and upright is the LORD; therefore he instructs sinners in his ways.

verses.name: Psalms 25:9
verses.text: He guides the humble in what is right and teaches them his way.

verses.name: Psalms 25:10
verses.text: All the ways of the LORD are loving and faithful for those who keep the demands of his covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 25:11
verses.text: For the sake of your name, O LORD, forgive my iniquity, though it is great.

verses.name: Psalms 25:12
verses.text: Who, then, is the man that fears the LORD? He will instruct him in the way chosen for him.

verses.name: Psalms 25:13
verses.text: He will spend his days in prosperity, and his descendants will inherit the land.

verses.name: Psalms 25:14
verses.text: The LORD confides in those who fear him; he makes his covenant known to them.

verses.name: Psalms 25:15
verses.text: My eyes are ever on the LORD, for only he will release my feet from the snare.

verses.name: Psalms 25:16
verses.text: Turn to me and be gracious to me, for I am lonely and afflicted.

verses.name: Psalms 25:17
verses.text: The troubles of my heart have multiplied; free me from my anguish.

verses.name: Psalms 25:18
verses.text: Look upon my affliction and my distress and take away all my sins.

verses.name: Psalms 25:19
verses.text: See how my enemies have increased and how fiercely they hate me!

verses.name: Psalms 25:20
verses.text: Guard my life and rescue me; let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in you.

verses.name: Psalms 25:21
verses.text: May integrity and uprightness protect me, because my hope is in you.

verses.name: Psalms 25:22
verses.text: Redeem Israel, O God, from all their troubles!

verses.name: Psalms 26:1
verses.text: Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have led a blameless life; I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.

verses.name: Psalms 26:2
verses.text: Test me, O LORD, and try me, examine my heart and my mind;

verses.name: Psalms 26:3
verses.text: for your love is ever before me, and I walk continually in your truth.

verses.name: Psalms 26:4
verses.text: I do not sit with deceitful men, nor do I consort with hypocrites;

verses.name: Psalms 26:5
verses.text: I abhor the assembly of evildoers and refuse to sit with the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 26:6
verses.text: I wash my hands in innocence, and go about your altar, O LORD,

verses.name: Psalms 26:7
verses.text: proclaiming aloud your praise and telling of all your wonderful deeds.

verses.name: Psalms 26:8
verses.text: I love the house where you live, O LORD, the place where your glory dwells.

verses.name: Psalms 26:9
verses.text: Do not take away my soul along with sinners, my life with bloodthirsty men,

verses.name: Psalms 26:10
verses.text: in whose hands are wicked schemes, whose right hands are full of bribes.

verses.name: Psalms 26:11
verses.text: But I lead a blameless life; redeem me and be merciful to me.

verses.name: Psalms 26:12
verses.text: My feet stand on level ground; in the great assembly I will praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 27:1
verses.text: The LORD is my light and my salvation- whom shall I fear? The LORD is the stronghold of my life- of whom shall I be afraid?

verses.name: Psalms 27:2
verses.text: When evil men advance against me to devour my flesh, when my enemies and my foes attack me, they will stumble and fall.

verses.name: Psalms 27:3
verses.text: Though an army besiege me, my heart will not fear; though war break out against me, even then will I be confident.

verses.name: Psalms 27:4
verses.text: One thing I ask of the LORD, this is what I seek: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD and to seek him in his temple.

verses.name: Psalms 27:5
verses.text: For in the day of trouble he will keep me safe in his dwelling; he will hide me in the shelter of his tabernacle and set me high upon a rock.

verses.name: Psalms 27:6
verses.text: Then my head will be exalted above the enemies who surround me; at his tabernacle will I sacrifice with shouts of joy; I will sing and make music to the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 27:7
verses.text: Hear my voice when I call, O LORD; be merciful to me and answer me.

verses.name: Psalms 27:8
verses.text: My heart says of you, "Seek his face!" Your face, LORD, I will seek.

verses.name: Psalms 27:9
verses.text: Do not hide your face from me, do not turn your servant away in anger; you have been my helper. Do not reject me or forsake me, O God my Savior.

verses.name: Psalms 27:10
verses.text: Though my father and mother forsake me, the LORD will receive me.

verses.name: Psalms 27:11
verses.text: Teach me your way, O LORD; lead me in a straight path because of my oppressors.

verses.name: Psalms 27:12
verses.text: Do not turn me over to the desire of my foes, for false witnesses rise up against me, breathing out violence.

verses.name: Psalms 27:13
verses.text: I am still confident of this: I will see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.

verses.name: Psalms 27:14
verses.text: Wait for the LORD; be strong and take heart and wait for the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 28:1
verses.text: To you I call, O LORD my Rock; do not turn a deaf ear to me. For if you remain silent, I will be like those who have gone down to the pit.

verses.name: Psalms 28:2
verses.text: Hear my cry for mercy as I call to you for help, as I lift up my hands toward your Most Holy Place.

verses.name: Psalms 28:3
verses.text: Do not drag me away with the wicked, with those who do evil, who speak cordially with their neighbors but harbor malice in their hearts.

verses.name: Psalms 28:4
verses.text: Repay them for their deeds and for their evil work; repay them for what their hands have done and bring back upon them what they deserve.

verses.name: Psalms 28:5
verses.text: Since they show no regard for the works of the LORD and what his hands have done, he will tear them down and never build them up again.

verses.name: Psalms 28:6
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD, for he has heard my cry for mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 28:7
verses.text: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and I am helped. My heart leaps for joy and I will give thanks to him in song.

verses.name: Psalms 28:8
verses.text: The LORD is the strength of his people, a fortress of salvation for his anointed one.

verses.name: Psalms 28:9
verses.text: Save your people and bless your inheritance; be their shepherd and carry them forever.

verses.name: Psalms 29:1
verses.text: Ascribe to the LORD, O mighty ones, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

verses.name: Psalms 29:2
verses.text: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name; worship the LORD in the splendor of his holiness.

verses.name: Psalms 29:3
verses.text: The voice of the LORD is over the waters; the God of glory thunders, the LORD thunders over the mighty waters.

verses.name: Psalms 29:4
verses.text: The voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is majestic.

verses.name: Psalms 29:5
verses.text: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedars; the LORD breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon.

verses.name: Psalms 29:6
verses.text: He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, Sirion like a young wild ox.

verses.name: Psalms 29:7
verses.text: The voice of the LORD strikes with flashes of lightning.

verses.name: Psalms 29:8
verses.text: The voice of the LORD shakes the desert; the LORD shakes the Desert of Kadesh.

verses.name: Psalms 29:9
verses.text: The voice of the LORD twists the oaks and strips the forests bare. And in his temple all cry, "Glory!"

verses.name: Psalms 29:10
verses.text: The LORD sits enthroned over the flood; the LORD is enthroned as King forever.

verses.name: Psalms 29:11
verses.text: The LORD gives strength to his people; the LORD blesses his people with peace.

verses.name: Psalms 30:1
verses.text: I will exalt you, O LORD, for you lifted me out of the depths and did not let my enemies gloat over me.

verses.name: Psalms 30:2
verses.text: O LORD my God, I called to you for help and you healed me.

verses.name: Psalms 30:3
verses.text: O LORD, you brought me up from the grave; you spared me from going down into the pit.

verses.name: Psalms 30:4
verses.text: Sing to the LORD, you saints of his; praise his holy name.

verses.name: Psalms 30:5
verses.text: For his anger lasts only a moment, but his favor lasts a lifetime; weeping may remain for a night, but rejoicing comes in the morning.

verses.name: Psalms 30:6
verses.text: When I felt secure, I said, "I will never be shaken."

verses.name: Psalms 30:7
verses.text: O LORD, when you favored me, you made my mountain stand firm; but when you hid your face, I was dismayed.

verses.name: Psalms 30:8
verses.text: To you, O LORD, I called; to the Lord I cried for mercy:

verses.name: Psalms 30:9
verses.text: "What gain is there in my destruction, in my going down into the pit? Will the dust praise you? Will it proclaim your faithfulness?

verses.name: Psalms 30:10
verses.text: Hear, O LORD, and be merciful to me; O LORD, be my help."

verses.name: Psalms 30:11
verses.text: You turned my wailing into dancing; you removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,

verses.name: Psalms 30:12
verses.text: that my heart may sing to you and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give you thanks forever.

verses.name: Psalms 31:1
verses.text: In you, O LORD, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame; deliver me in your righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 31:2
verses.text: Turn your ear to me, come quickly to my rescue; be my rock of refuge, a strong fortress to save me.

verses.name: Psalms 31:3
verses.text: Since you are my rock and my fortress, for the sake of your name lead and guide me.

verses.name: Psalms 31:4
verses.text: Free me from the trap that is set for me, for you are my refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 31:5
verses.text: Into your hands I commit my spirit; redeem me, O LORD, the God of truth.

verses.name: Psalms 31:6
verses.text: I hate those who cling to worthless idols; I trust in the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 31:7
verses.text: I will be glad and rejoice in your love, for you saw my affliction and knew the anguish of my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 31:8
verses.text: You have not handed me over to the enemy but have set my feet in a spacious place.

verses.name: Psalms 31:9
verses.text: Be merciful to me, O LORD, for I am in distress; my eyes grow weak with sorrow, my soul and my body with grief.

verses.name: Psalms 31:10
verses.text: My life is consumed by anguish and my years by groaning; my strength fails because of my affliction, and my bones grow weak.

verses.name: Psalms 31:11
verses.text: Because of all my enemies, I am the utter contempt of my neighbors; I am a dread to my friends- those who see me on the street flee from me.

verses.name: Psalms 31:12
verses.text: I am forgotten by them as though I were dead; I have become like broken pottery.

verses.name: Psalms 31:13
verses.text: For I hear the slander of many; there is terror on every side; they conspire against me and plot to take my life.

verses.name: Psalms 31:14
verses.text: But I trust in you, O LORD; I say, "You are my God."

verses.name: Psalms 31:15
verses.text: My times are in your hands; deliver me from my enemies and from those who pursue me.

verses.name: Psalms 31:16
verses.text: Let your face shine on your servant; save me in your unfailing love.

verses.name: Psalms 31:17
verses.text: Let me not be put to shame, O LORD, for I have cried out to you; but let the wicked be put to shame and lie silent in the grave.

verses.name: Psalms 31:18
verses.text: Let their lying lips be silenced, for with pride and contempt they speak arrogantly against the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 31:19
verses.text: How great is your goodness, which you have stored up for those who fear you, which you bestow in the sight of men on those who take refuge in you.

verses.name: Psalms 31:20
verses.text: In the shelter of your presence you hide them from the intrigues of men; in your dwelling you keep them safe from accusing tongues.

verses.name: Psalms 31:21
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD, for he showed his wonderful love to me when I was in a besieged city.

verses.name: Psalms 31:22
verses.text: In my alarm I said, "I am cut off from your sight!" Yet you heard my cry for mercy when I called to you for help.

verses.name: Psalms 31:23
verses.text: Love the LORD, all his saints! The LORD preserves the faithful, but the proud he pays back in full.

verses.name: Psalms 31:24
verses.text: Be strong and take heart, all you who hope in the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 32:1
verses.text: Blessed is he whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.

verses.name: Psalms 32:2
verses.text: Blessed is the man whose sin the LORD does not count against him and in whose spirit is no deceit.

verses.name: Psalms 32:3
verses.text: When I kept silent, my bones wasted away through my groaning all day long.

verses.name: Psalms 32:4
verses.text: For day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was sapped as in the heat of summer. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 32:5
verses.text: Then I acknowledged my sin to you and did not cover up my iniquity. I said, "I will confess my transgressions to the LORD "- and you forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 32:6
verses.text: Therefore let everyone who is godly pray to you while you may be found; surely when the mighty waters rise, they will not reach him.

verses.name: Psalms 32:7
verses.text: You are my hiding place; you will protect me from trouble and surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 32:8
verses.text: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you and watch over you.

verses.name: Psalms 32:9
verses.text: Do not be like the horse or the mule, which have no understanding but must be controlled by bit and bridle or they will not come to you.

verses.name: Psalms 32:10
verses.text: Many are the woes of the wicked, but the LORD's unfailing love surrounds the man who trusts in him.

verses.name: Psalms 32:11
verses.text: Rejoice in the LORD and be glad, you righteous; sing, all you who are upright in heart!

verses.name: Psalms 33:1
verses.text: Sing joyfully to the LORD, you righteous; it is fitting for the upright to praise him.

verses.name: Psalms 33:2
verses.text: Praise the LORD with the harp; make music to him on the ten-stringed lyre.

verses.name: Psalms 33:3
verses.text: Sing to him a new song; play skillfully, and shout for joy.

verses.name: Psalms 33:4
verses.text: For the word of the LORD is right and true; he is faithful in all he does.

verses.name: Psalms 33:5
verses.text: The LORD loves righteousness and justice; the earth is full of his unfailing love.

verses.name: Psalms 33:6
verses.text: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made, their starry host by the breath of his mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 33:7
verses.text: He gathers the waters of the sea into jars; he puts the deep into storehouses.

verses.name: Psalms 33:8
verses.text: Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the people of the world revere him.

verses.name: Psalms 33:9
verses.text: For he spoke, and it came to be; he commanded, and it stood firm.

verses.name: Psalms 33:10
verses.text: The LORD foils the plans of the nations; he thwarts the purposes of the peoples.

verses.name: Psalms 33:11
verses.text: But the plans of the LORD stand firm forever, the purposes of his heart through all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 33:12
verses.text: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD, the people he chose for his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 33:13
verses.text: From heaven the LORD looks down and sees all mankind;

verses.name: Psalms 33:14
verses.text: from his dwelling place he watches all who live on earth-

verses.name: Psalms 33:15
verses.text: he who forms the hearts of all, who considers everything they do.

verses.name: Psalms 33:16
verses.text: No king is saved by the size of his army; no warrior escapes by his great strength.

verses.name: Psalms 33:17
verses.text: A horse is a vain hope for deliverance; despite all its great strength it cannot save.

verses.name: Psalms 33:18
verses.text: But the eyes of the LORD are on those who fear him, on those whose hope is in his unfailing love,

verses.name: Psalms 33:19
verses.text: to deliver them from death and keep them alive in famine.

verses.name: Psalms 33:20
verses.text: We wait in hope for the LORD; he is our help and our shield.

verses.name: Psalms 33:21
verses.text: In him our hearts rejoice, for we trust in his holy name.

verses.name: Psalms 33:22
verses.text: May your unfailing love rest upon us, O LORD, even as we put our hope in you.

verses.name: Psalms 34:1
verses.text: I will extol the LORD at all times; his praise will always be on my lips.

verses.name: Psalms 34:2
verses.text: My soul will boast in the LORD; let the afflicted hear and rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 34:3
verses.text: Glorify the LORD with me; let us exalt his name together.

verses.name: Psalms 34:4
verses.text: I sought the LORD, and he answered me; he delivered me from all my fears.

verses.name: Psalms 34:5
verses.text: Those who look to him are radiant; their faces are never covered with shame.

verses.name: Psalms 34:6
verses.text: This poor man called, and the LORD heard him; he saved him out of all his troubles.

verses.name: Psalms 34:7
verses.text: The angel of the LORD encamps around those who fear him, and he delivers them.

verses.name: Psalms 34:8
verses.text: Taste and see that the LORD is good; blessed is the man who takes refuge in him.

verses.name: Psalms 34:9
verses.text: Fear the LORD, you his saints, for those who fear him lack nothing.

verses.name: Psalms 34:10
verses.text: The lions may grow weak and hungry, but those who seek the LORD lack no good thing.

verses.name: Psalms 34:11
verses.text: Come, my children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 34:12
verses.text: Whoever of you loves life and desires to see many good days,

verses.name: Psalms 34:13
verses.text: keep your tongue from evil and your lips from speaking lies.

verses.name: Psalms 34:14
verses.text: Turn from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it.

verses.name: Psalms 34:15
verses.text: The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous and his ears are attentive to their cry;

verses.name: Psalms 34:16
verses.text: the face of the LORD is against those who do evil, to cut off the memory of them from the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 34:17
verses.text: The righteous cry out, and the LORD hears them; he delivers them from all their troubles.

verses.name: Psalms 34:18
verses.text: The LORD is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.

verses.name: Psalms 34:19
verses.text: A righteous man may have many troubles, but the LORD delivers him from them all;

verses.name: Psalms 34:20
verses.text: he protects all his bones, not one of them will be broken.

verses.name: Psalms 34:21
verses.text: Evil will slay the wicked; the foes of the righteous will be condemned.

verses.name: Psalms 34:22
verses.text: The LORD redeems his servants; no one will be condemned who takes refuge in him.

verses.name: Psalms 35:1
verses.text: Contend, O LORD, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me.

verses.name: Psalms 35:2
verses.text: Take up shield and buckler; arise and come to my aid.

verses.name: Psalms 35:3
verses.text: Brandish spear and javelin against those who pursue me. Say to my soul, "I am your salvation."

verses.name: Psalms 35:4
verses.text: May those who seek my life be disgraced and put to shame; may those who plot my ruin be turned back in dismay.

verses.name: Psalms 35:5
verses.text: May they be like chaff before the wind, with the angel of the LORD driving them away;

verses.name: Psalms 35:6
verses.text: may their path be dark and slippery, with the angel of the LORD pursuing them.

verses.name: Psalms 35:7
verses.text: Since they hid their net for me without cause and without cause dug a pit for me,

verses.name: Psalms 35:8
verses.text: may ruin overtake them by surprise- may the net they hid entangle them, may they fall into the pit, to their ruin.

verses.name: Psalms 35:9
verses.text: Then my soul will rejoice in the LORD and delight in his salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 35:10
verses.text: My whole being will exclaim, "Who is like you, O LORD? You rescue the poor from those too strong for them, the poor and needy from those who rob them."

verses.name: Psalms 35:11
verses.text: Ruthless witnesses come forward; they question me on things I know nothing about.

verses.name: Psalms 35:12
verses.text: They repay me evil for good and leave my soul forlorn.

verses.name: Psalms 35:13
verses.text: Yet when they were ill, I put on sackcloth and humbled myself with fasting. When my prayers returned to me unanswered,

verses.name: Psalms 35:14
verses.text: I went about mourning as though for my friend or brother. I bowed my head in grief as though weeping for my mother.

verses.name: Psalms 35:15
verses.text: But when I stumbled, they gathered in glee; attackers gathered against me when I was unaware. They slandered me without ceasing.

verses.name: Psalms 35:16
verses.text: Like the ungodly they maliciously mocked; they gnashed their teeth at me.

verses.name: Psalms 35:17
verses.text: O Lord, how long will you look on? Rescue my life from their ravages, my precious life from these lions.

verses.name: Psalms 35:18
verses.text: I will give you thanks in the great assembly; among throngs of people I will praise you.

verses.name: Psalms 35:19
verses.text: Let not those gloat over me who are my enemies without cause; let not those who hate me without reason maliciously wink the eye.

verses.name: Psalms 35:20
verses.text: They do not speak peaceably, but devise false accusations against those who live quietly in the land.

verses.name: Psalms 35:21
verses.text: They gape at me and say, "Aha! Aha! With our own eyes we have seen it."

verses.name: Psalms 35:22
verses.text: O LORD, you have seen this; be not silent. Do not be far from me, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 35:23
verses.text: Awake, and rise to my defense! Contend for me, my God and Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 35:24
verses.text: Vindicate me in your righteousness, O LORD my God; do not let them gloat over me.

verses.name: Psalms 35:25
verses.text: Do not let them think, "Aha, just what we wanted!" or say, "We have swallowed him up."

verses.name: Psalms 35:26
verses.text: May all who gloat over my distress be put to shame and confusion; may all who exalt themselves over me be clothed with shame and disgrace.

verses.name: Psalms 35:27
verses.text: May those who delight in my vindication shout for joy and gladness; may they always say, "The LORD be exalted, who delights in the well-being of his servant."

verses.name: Psalms 35:28
verses.text: My tongue will speak of your righteousness and of your praises all day long.

verses.name: Psalms 36:1
verses.text: An oracle is within my heart concerning the sinfulness of the wicked: There is no fear of God before his eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 36:2
verses.text: For in his own eyes he flatters himself too much to detect or hate his sin.

verses.name: Psalms 36:3
verses.text: The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful; he has ceased to be wise and to do good.

verses.name: Psalms 36:4
verses.text: Even on his bed he plots evil; he commits himself to a sinful course and does not reject what is wrong.

verses.name: Psalms 36:5
verses.text: Your love, O LORD, reaches to the heavens, your faithfulness to the skies.

verses.name: Psalms 36:6
verses.text: Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains, your justice like the great deep. O LORD, you preserve both man and beast.

verses.name: Psalms 36:7
verses.text: How priceless is your unfailing love! Both high and low among men find refuge in the shadow of your wings.

verses.name: Psalms 36:8
verses.text: They feast on the abundance of your house; you give them drink from your river of delights.

verses.name: Psalms 36:9
verses.text: For with you is the fountain of life; in your light we see light.

verses.name: Psalms 36:10
verses.text: Continue your love to those who know you, your righteousness to the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 36:11
verses.text: May the foot of the proud not come against me, nor the hand of the wicked drive me away.

verses.name: Psalms 36:12
verses.text: See how the evildoers lie fallen- thrown down, not able to rise!

verses.name: Psalms 37:1
verses.text: Do not fret because of evil men or be envious of those who do wrong;

verses.name: Psalms 37:2
verses.text: for like the grass they will soon wither, like green plants they will soon die away.

verses.name: Psalms 37:3
verses.text: Trust in the LORD and do good; dwell in the land and enjoy safe pasture.

verses.name: Psalms 37:4
verses.text: Delight yourself in the LORD and he will give you the desires of your heart.

verses.name: Psalms 37:5
verses.text: Commit your way to the LORD; trust in him and he will do this:

verses.name: Psalms 37:6
verses.text: He will make your righteousness shine like the dawn, the justice of your cause like the noonday sun.

verses.name: Psalms 37:7
verses.text: Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him; do not fret when men succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes.

verses.name: Psalms 37:8
verses.text: Refrain from anger and turn from wrath; do not fret-it leads only to evil.

verses.name: Psalms 37:9
verses.text: For evil men will be cut off, but those who hope in the LORD will inherit the land.

verses.name: Psalms 37:10
verses.text: A little while, and the wicked will be no more; though you look for them, they will not be found.

verses.name: Psalms 37:11
verses.text: But the meek will inherit the land and enjoy great peace.

verses.name: Psalms 37:12
verses.text: The wicked plot against the righteous and gnash their teeth at them;

verses.name: Psalms 37:13
verses.text: but the Lord laughs at the wicked, for he knows their day is coming.

verses.name: Psalms 37:14
verses.text: The wicked draw the sword and bend the bow to bring down the poor and needy, to slay those whose ways are upright.

verses.name: Psalms 37:15
verses.text: But their swords will pierce their own hearts, and their bows will be broken.

verses.name: Psalms 37:16
verses.text: Better the little that the righteous have than the wealth of many wicked;

verses.name: Psalms 37:17
verses.text: for the power of the wicked will be broken, but the LORD upholds the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 37:18
verses.text: The days of the blameless are known to the LORD, and their inheritance will endure forever.

verses.name: Psalms 37:19
verses.text: In times of disaster they will not wither; in days of famine they will enjoy plenty.

verses.name: Psalms 37:20
verses.text: But the wicked will perish: The LORD's enemies will be like the beauty of the fields, they will vanish-vanish like smoke.

verses.name: Psalms 37:21
verses.text: The wicked borrow and do not repay, but the righteous give generously;

verses.name: Psalms 37:22
verses.text: those the LORD blesses will inherit the land, but those he curses will be cut off.

verses.name: Psalms 37:23
verses.text: If the LORD delights in a man's way, he makes his steps firm;

verses.name: Psalms 37:24
verses.text: though he stumble, he will not fall, for the LORD upholds him with his hand.

verses.name: Psalms 37:25
verses.text: I was young and now I am old, yet I have never seen the righteous forsaken or their children begging bread.

verses.name: Psalms 37:26
verses.text: They are always generous and lend freely; their children will be blessed.

verses.name: Psalms 37:27
verses.text: Turn from evil and do good; then you will dwell in the land forever.

verses.name: Psalms 37:28
verses.text: For the LORD loves the just and will not forsake his faithful ones. They will be protected forever, but the offspring of the wicked will be cut off;

verses.name: Psalms 37:29
verses.text: the righteous will inherit the land and dwell in it forever.

verses.name: Psalms 37:30
verses.text: The mouth of the righteous man utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks what is just.

verses.name: Psalms 37:31
verses.text: The law of his God is in his heart; his feet do not slip.

verses.name: Psalms 37:32
verses.text: The wicked lie in wait for the righteous, seeking their very lives;

verses.name: Psalms 37:33
verses.text: but the LORD will not leave them in their power or let them be condemned when brought to trial.

verses.name: Psalms 37:34
verses.text: Wait for the LORD and keep his way. He will exalt you to inherit the land; when the wicked are cut off, you will see it.

verses.name: Psalms 37:35
verses.text: I have seen a wicked and ruthless man flourishing like a green tree in its native soil,

verses.name: Psalms 37:36
verses.text: but he soon passed away and was no more; though I looked for him, he could not be found.

verses.name: Psalms 37:37
verses.text: Consider the blameless, observe the upright; there is a future for the man of peace.

verses.name: Psalms 37:38
verses.text: But all sinners will be destroyed; the future of the wicked will be cut off.

verses.name: Psalms 37:39
verses.text: The salvation of the righteous comes from the LORD; he is their stronghold in time of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 37:40
verses.text: The LORD helps them and delivers them; he delivers them from the wicked and saves them, because they take refuge in him.

verses.name: Psalms 38:1
verses.text: O LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 38:2
verses.text: For your arrows have pierced me, and your hand has come down upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 38:3
verses.text: Because of your wrath there is no health in my body; my bones have no soundness because of my sin.

verses.name: Psalms 38:4
verses.text: My guilt has overwhelmed me like a burden too heavy to bear.

verses.name: Psalms 38:5
verses.text: My wounds fester and are loathsome because of my sinful folly.

verses.name: Psalms 38:6
verses.text: I am bowed down and brought very low; all day long I go about mourning.

verses.name: Psalms 38:7
verses.text: My back is filled with searing pain; there is no health in my body.

verses.name: Psalms 38:8
verses.text: I am feeble and utterly crushed; I groan in anguish of heart.

verses.name: Psalms 38:9
verses.text: All my longings lie open before you, O Lord; my sighing is not hidden from you.

verses.name: Psalms 38:10
verses.text: My heart pounds, my strength fails me; even the light has gone from my eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 38:11
verses.text: My friends and companions avoid me because of my wounds; my neighbors stay far away.

verses.name: Psalms 38:12
verses.text: Those who seek my life set their traps, those who would harm me talk of my ruin; all day long they plot deception.

verses.name: Psalms 38:13
verses.text: I am like a deaf man, who cannot hear, like a mute, who cannot open his mouth;

verses.name: Psalms 38:14
verses.text: I have become like a man who does not hear, whose mouth can offer no reply.

verses.name: Psalms 38:15
verses.text: I wait for you, O LORD; you will answer, O Lord my God.

verses.name: Psalms 38:16
verses.text: For I said, "Do not let them gloat or exalt themselves over me when my foot slips."

verses.name: Psalms 38:17
verses.text: For I am about to fall, and my pain is ever with me.

verses.name: Psalms 38:18
verses.text: I confess my iniquity; I am troubled by my sin.

verses.name: Psalms 38:19
verses.text: Many are those who are my vigorous enemies; those who hate me without reason are numerous.

verses.name: Psalms 38:20
verses.text: Those who repay my good with evil slander me when I pursue what is good.

verses.name: Psalms 38:21
verses.text: O LORD, do not forsake me; be not far from me, O my God.

verses.name: Psalms 38:22
verses.text: Come quickly to help me, O Lord my Savior.

verses.name: Psalms 39:1
verses.text: I said, "I will watch my ways and keep my tongue from sin; I will put a muzzle on my mouth as long as the wicked are in my presence."

verses.name: Psalms 39:2
verses.text: But when I was silent and still, not even saying anything good, my anguish increased.

verses.name: Psalms 39:3
verses.text: My heart grew hot within me, and as I meditated, the fire burned; then I spoke with my tongue:

verses.name: Psalms 39:4
verses.text: "Show me, O LORD, my life's end and the number of my days; let me know how fleeting is my life.

verses.name: Psalms 39:5
verses.text: You have made my days a mere handbreadth; the span of my years is as nothing before you. Each man's life is but a breath. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 39:6
verses.text: Man is a mere phantom as he goes to and fro: He bustles about, but only in vain; he heaps up wealth, not knowing who will get it.

verses.name: Psalms 39:7
verses.text: "But now, Lord, what do I look for? My hope is in you.

verses.name: Psalms 39:8
verses.text: Save me from all my transgressions; do not make me the scorn of fools.

verses.name: Psalms 39:9
verses.text: I was silent; I would not open my mouth, for you are the one who has done this.

verses.name: Psalms 39:10
verses.text: Remove your scourge from me; I am overcome by the blow of your hand.

verses.name: Psalms 39:11
verses.text: You rebuke and discipline men for their sin; you consume their wealth like a moth- each man is but a breath. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 39:12
verses.text: "Hear my prayer, O LORD, listen to my cry for help; be not deaf to my weeping. For I dwell with you as an alien, a stranger, as all my fathers were.

verses.name: Psalms 39:13
verses.text: Look away from me, that I may rejoice again before I depart and am no more."

verses.name: Psalms 40:1
verses.text: I waited patiently for the LORD; he turned to me and heard my cry.

verses.name: Psalms 40:2
verses.text: He lifted me out of the slimy pit, out of the mud and mire; he set my feet on a rock and gave me a firm place to stand.

verses.name: Psalms 40:3
verses.text: He put a new song in my mouth, a hymn of praise to our God. Many will see and fear and put their trust in the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 40:4
verses.text: Blessed is the man who makes the LORD his trust, who does not look to the proud, to those who turn aside to false gods.

verses.name: Psalms 40:5
verses.text: Many, O LORD my God, are the wonders you have done. The things you planned for us no one can recount to you; were I to speak and tell of them, they would be too many to declare.

verses.name: Psalms 40:6
verses.text: Sacrifice and offering you did not desire, but my ears you have pierced,; burnt offerings and sin offerings you did not require.

verses.name: Psalms 40:7
verses.text: Then I said, "Here I am, I have come- it is written about me in the scroll.

verses.name: Psalms 40:8
verses.text: I desire to do your will, O my God; your law is within my heart."

verses.name: Psalms 40:9
verses.text: I proclaim righteousness in the great assembly; I do not seal my lips, as you know, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 40:10
verses.text: I do not hide your righteousness in my heart; I speak of your faithfulness and salvation. I do not conceal your love and your truth from the great assembly.

verses.name: Psalms 40:11
verses.text: Do not withhold your mercy from me, O LORD; may your love and your truth always protect me.

verses.name: Psalms 40:12
verses.text: For troubles without number surround me; my sins have overtaken me, and I cannot see. They are more than the hairs of my head, and my heart fails within me.

verses.name: Psalms 40:13
verses.text: Be pleased, O LORD, to save me; O LORD, come quickly to help me.

verses.name: Psalms 40:14
verses.text: May all who seek to take my life be put to shame and confusion; may all who desire my ruin be turned back in disgrace.

verses.name: Psalms 40:15
verses.text: May those who say to me, "Aha! Aha!" be appalled at their own shame.

verses.name: Psalms 40:16
verses.text: But may all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; may those who love your salvation always say, "The LORD be exalted!"

verses.name: Psalms 40:17
verses.text: Yet I am poor and needy; may the Lord think of me. You are my help and my deliverer; O my God, do not delay.

verses.name: Psalms 41:1
verses.text: Blessed is he who has regard for the weak; the LORD delivers him in times of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 41:2
verses.text: The LORD will protect him and preserve his life; he will bless him in the land and not surrender him to the desire of his foes.

verses.name: Psalms 41:3
verses.text: The LORD will sustain him on his sickbed and restore him from his bed of illness.

verses.name: Psalms 41:4
verses.text: I said, "O LORD, have mercy on me; heal me, for I have sinned against you."

verses.name: Psalms 41:5
verses.text: My enemies say of me in malice, "When will he die and his name perish?"

verses.name: Psalms 41:6
verses.text: Whenever one comes to see me, he speaks falsely, while his heart gathers slander; then he goes out and spreads it abroad.

verses.name: Psalms 41:7
verses.text: All my enemies whisper together against me; they imagine the worst for me, saying,

verses.name: Psalms 41:8
verses.text: "A vile disease has beset him; he will never get up from the place where he lies."

verses.name: Psalms 41:9
verses.text: Even my close friend, whom I trusted, he who shared my bread, has lifted up his heel against me.

verses.name: Psalms 41:10
verses.text: But you, O LORD, have mercy on me; raise me up, that I may repay them.

verses.name: Psalms 41:11
verses.text: I know that you are pleased with me, for my enemy does not triumph over me.

verses.name: Psalms 41:12
verses.text: In my integrity you uphold me and set me in your presence forever.

verses.name: Psalms 41:13
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Amen and Amen.

verses.name: Psalms 42:1
verses.text: As the deer pants for streams of water, so my soul pants for you, O God.

verses.name: Psalms 42:2
verses.text: My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When can I go and meet with God?

verses.name: Psalms 42:3
verses.text: My tears have been my food day and night, while men say to me all day long, "Where is your God?"

verses.name: Psalms 42:4
verses.text: These things I remember as I pour out my soul: how I used to go with the multitude, leading the procession to the house of God, with shouts of joy and thanksgiving among the festive throng.

verses.name: Psalms 42:5
verses.text: Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why so disturbed within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise him, my Savior and

verses.name: Psalms 42:6
