verses.text: my God. My soul is downcast within me; therefore I will remember you from the land of the Jordan, the heights of Hermon-from Mount Mizar.

verses.name: Psalms 42:7
verses.text: Deep calls to deep in the roar of your waterfalls; all your waves and breakers have swept over me.

verses.name: Psalms 42:8
verses.text: By day the LORD directs his love, at night his song is with me- a prayer to the God of my life.

verses.name: Psalms 42:9
verses.text: I say to God my Rock, "Why have you forgotten me? Why must I go about mourning, oppressed by the enemy?"

verses.name: Psalms 42:10
verses.text: My bones suffer mortal agony as my foes taunt me, saying to me all day long, "Where is your God?"

verses.name: Psalms 42:11
verses.text: Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why so disturbed within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise him, my Savior and my God.

verses.name: Psalms 43:1
verses.text: Vindicate me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation; rescue me from deceitful and wicked men.

verses.name: Psalms 43:2
verses.text: You are God my stronghold. Why have you rejected me? Why must I go about mourning, oppressed by the enemy?

verses.name: Psalms 43:3
verses.text: Send forth your light and your truth, let them guide me; let them bring me to your holy mountain, to the place where you dwell.

verses.name: Psalms 43:4
verses.text: Then will I go to the altar of God, to God, my joy and my delight. I will praise you with the harp, O God, my God.

verses.name: Psalms 43:5
verses.text: Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why so disturbed within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise him, my Savior and my God.

verses.name: Psalms 44:1
verses.text: We have heard with our ears, O God; our fathers have told us what you did in their days, in days long ago.

verses.name: Psalms 44:2
verses.text: With your hand you drove out the nations and planted our fathers; you crushed the peoples and made our fathers flourish.

verses.name: Psalms 44:3
verses.text: It was not by their sword that they won the land, nor did their arm bring them victory; it was your right hand, your arm, and the light of your face, for you loved them.

verses.name: Psalms 44:4
verses.text: You are my King and my God, who decrees victories for Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 44:5
verses.text: Through you we push back our enemies; through your name we trample our foes.

verses.name: Psalms 44:6
verses.text: I do not trust in my bow, my sword does not bring me victory;

verses.name: Psalms 44:7
verses.text: but you give us victory over our enemies, you put our adversaries to shame.

verses.name: Psalms 44:8
verses.text: In God we make our boast all day long, and we will praise your name forever. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 44:9
verses.text: But now you have rejected and humbled us; you no longer go out with our armies.

verses.name: Psalms 44:10
verses.text: You made us retreat before the enemy, and our adversaries have plundered us.

verses.name: Psalms 44:11
verses.text: You gave us up to be devoured like sheep and have scattered us among the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 44:12
verses.text: You sold your people for a pittance, gaining nothing from their sale.

verses.name: Psalms 44:13
verses.text: You have made us a reproach to our neighbors, the scorn and derision of those around us.

verses.name: Psalms 44:14
verses.text: You have made us a byword among the nations; the peoples shake their heads at us.

verses.name: Psalms 44:15
verses.text: My disgrace is before me all day long, and my face is covered with shame

verses.name: Psalms 44:16
verses.text: at the taunts of those who reproach and revile me, because of the enemy, who is bent on revenge.

verses.name: Psalms 44:17
verses.text: All this happened to us, though we had not forgotten you or been false to your covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 44:18
verses.text: Our hearts had not turned back; our feet had not strayed from your path.

verses.name: Psalms 44:19
verses.text: But you crushed us and made us a haunt for jackals and covered us over with deep darkness.

verses.name: Psalms 44:20
verses.text: If we had forgotten the name of our God or spread out our hands to a foreign god,

verses.name: Psalms 44:21
verses.text: would not God have discovered it, since he knows the secrets of the heart?

verses.name: Psalms 44:22
verses.text: Yet for your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.

verses.name: Psalms 44:23
verses.text: Awake, O Lord! Why do you sleep? Rouse yourself! Do not reject us forever.

verses.name: Psalms 44:24
verses.text: Why do you hide your face and forget our misery and oppression?

verses.name: Psalms 44:25
verses.text: We are brought down to the dust; our bodies cling to the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 44:26
verses.text: Rise up and help us; redeem us because of your unfailing love.

verses.name: Psalms 45:1
verses.text: My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.

verses.name: Psalms 45:2
verses.text: You are the most excellent of men and your lips have been anointed with grace, since God has blessed you forever.

verses.name: Psalms 45:3
verses.text: Gird your sword upon your side, O mighty one; clothe yourself with splendor and majesty.

verses.name: Psalms 45:4
verses.text: In your majesty ride forth victoriously in behalf of truth, humility and righteousness; let your right hand display awesome deeds.

verses.name: Psalms 45:5
verses.text: Let your sharp arrows pierce the hearts of the king's enemies; let the nations fall beneath your feet.

verses.name: Psalms 45:6
verses.text: Your throne, O God, will last for ever and ever; a scepter of justice will be the scepter of your kingdom.

verses.name: Psalms 45:7
verses.text: You love righteousness and hate wickedness; therefore God, your God, has set you above your companions by anointing you with the oil of joy.

verses.name: Psalms 45:8
verses.text: All your robes are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia; from palaces adorned with ivory the music of the strings makes you glad.

verses.name: Psalms 45:9
verses.text: Daughters of kings are among your honored women; at your right hand is the royal bride in gold of Ophir.

verses.name: Psalms 45:10
verses.text: Listen, O daughter, consider and give ear: Forget your people and your father's house.

verses.name: Psalms 45:11
verses.text: The king is enthralled by your beauty; honor him, for he is your lord.

verses.name: Psalms 45:12
verses.text: The Daughter of Tyre will come with a gift, men of wealth will seek your favor.

verses.name: Psalms 45:13
verses.text: All glorious is the princess within her chamber; her gown is interwoven with gold.

verses.name: Psalms 45:14
verses.text: In embroidered garments she is led to the king; her virgin companions follow her and are brought to you.

verses.name: Psalms 45:15
verses.text: They are led in with joy and gladness; they enter the palace of the king.

verses.name: Psalms 45:16
verses.text: Your sons will take the place of your fathers; you will make them princes throughout the land.

verses.name: Psalms 45:17
verses.text: I will perpetuate your memory through all generations; therefore the nations will praise you for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 46:1
verses.text: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 46:2
verses.text: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth give way and the mountains fall into the heart of the sea,

verses.name: Psalms 46:3
verses.text: though its waters roar and foam and the mountains quake with their surging. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 46:4
verses.text: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, the holy place where the Most High dwells.

verses.name: Psalms 46:5
verses.text: God is within her, she will not fall; God will help her at break of day.

verses.name: Psalms 46:6
verses.text: Nations are in uproar, kingdoms fall; he lifts his voice, the earth melts.

verses.name: Psalms 46:7
verses.text: The LORD Almighty is with us; the God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 46:8
verses.text: Come and see the works of the LORD, the desolations he has brought on the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 46:9
verses.text: He makes wars cease to the ends of the earth; he breaks the bow and shatters the spear, he burns the shields with fire.

verses.name: Psalms 46:10
verses.text: "Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth."

verses.name: Psalms 46:11
verses.text: The LORD Almighty is with us; the God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 47:1
verses.text: Clap your hands, all you nations; shout to God with cries of joy.

verses.name: Psalms 47:2
verses.text: How awesome is the LORD Most High, the great King over all the earth!

verses.name: Psalms 47:3
verses.text: He subdued nations under us, peoples under our feet.

verses.name: Psalms 47:4
verses.text: He chose our inheritance for us, the pride of Jacob, whom he loved. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 47:5
verses.text: God has ascended amid shouts of joy, the LORD amid the sounding of trumpets.

verses.name: Psalms 47:6
verses.text: Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our King, sing praises.

verses.name: Psalms 47:7
verses.text: For God is the King of all the earth; sing to him a psalm of praise.

verses.name: Psalms 47:8
verses.text: God reigns over the nations; God is seated on his holy throne.

verses.name: Psalms 47:9
verses.text: The nobles of the nations assemble as the people of the God of Abraham, for the kings of the earth belong to God; he is greatly exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 48:1
verses.text: Great is the LORD, and most worthy of praise, in the city of our God, his holy mountain.

verses.name: Psalms 48:2
verses.text: It is beautiful in its loftiness, the joy of the whole earth. Like the utmost heights of Zaphon is Mount Zion, the city of the Great King.

verses.name: Psalms 48:3
verses.text: God is in her citadels; he has shown himself to be her fortress.

verses.name: Psalms 48:4
verses.text: When the kings joined forces, when they advanced together,

verses.name: Psalms 48:5
verses.text: they saw her and were astounded; they fled in terror.

verses.name: Psalms 48:6
verses.text: Trembling seized them there, pain like that of a woman in labor.

verses.name: Psalms 48:7
verses.text: You destroyed them like ships of Tarshish shattered by an east wind.

verses.name: Psalms 48:8
verses.text: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the LORD Almighty, in the city of our God: God makes her secure forever. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 48:9
verses.text: Within your temple, O God, we meditate on your unfailing love.

verses.name: Psalms 48:10
verses.text: Like your name, O God, your praise reaches to the ends of the earth; your right hand is filled with righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 48:11
verses.text: Mount Zion rejoices, the villages of Judah are glad because of your judgments.

verses.name: Psalms 48:12
verses.text: Walk about Zion, go around her, count her towers,

verses.name: Psalms 48:13
verses.text: consider well her ramparts, view her citadels, that you may tell of them to the next generation.

verses.name: Psalms 48:14
verses.text: For this God is our God for ever and ever; he will be our guide even to the end.

verses.name: Psalms 49:1
verses.text: Hear this, all you peoples; listen, all who live in this world,

verses.name: Psalms 49:2
verses.text: both low and high, rich and poor alike:

verses.name: Psalms 49:3
verses.text: My mouth will speak words of wisdom; the utterance from my heart will give understanding.

verses.name: Psalms 49:4
verses.text: I will turn my ear to a proverb; with the harp I will expound my riddle:

verses.name: Psalms 49:5
verses.text: Why should I fear when evil days come, when wicked deceivers surround me-

verses.name: Psalms 49:6
verses.text: those who trust in their wealth and boast of their great riches?

verses.name: Psalms 49:7
verses.text: No man can redeem the life of another or give to God a ransom for him-

verses.name: Psalms 49:8
verses.text: the ransom for a life is costly, no payment is ever enough-

verses.name: Psalms 49:9
verses.text: that he should live on forever and not see decay.

verses.name: Psalms 49:10
verses.text: For all can see that wise men die; the foolish and the senseless alike perish and leave their wealth to others.

verses.name: Psalms 49:11
verses.text: Their tombs will remain their houses forever, their dwellings for endless generations, though they had named lands after themselves.

verses.name: Psalms 49:12
verses.text: But man, despite his riches, does not endure; he is like the beasts that perish.

verses.name: Psalms 49:13
verses.text: This is the fate of those who trust in themselves, and of their followers, who approve their sayings. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 49:14
verses.text: Like sheep they are destined for the grave, and death will feed on them. The upright will rule over them in the morning; their forms will decay in the grave, far from their princely mansions.

verses.name: Psalms 49:15
verses.text: But God will redeem my life from the grave; he will surely take me to himself. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 49:16
verses.text: Do not be overawed when a man grows rich, when the splendor of his house increases;

verses.name: Psalms 49:17
verses.text: for he will take nothing with him when he dies, his splendor will not descend with him.

verses.name: Psalms 49:18
verses.text: Though while he lived he counted himself blessed- and men praise you when you prosper-

verses.name: Psalms 49:19
verses.text: he will join the generation of his fathers, who will never see the light of life.

verses.name: Psalms 49:20
verses.text: A man who has riches without understanding is like the beasts that perish.

verses.name: Psalms 50:1
verses.text: The Mighty One, God, the LORD, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to the place where it sets.

verses.name: Psalms 50:2
verses.text: From Zion, perfect in beauty, God shines forth.

verses.name: Psalms 50:3
verses.text: Our God comes and will not be silent; a fire devours before him, and around him a tempest rages.

verses.name: Psalms 50:4
verses.text: He summons the heavens above, and the earth, that he may judge his people:

verses.name: Psalms 50:5
verses.text: "Gather to me my consecrated ones, who made a covenant with me by sacrifice."

verses.name: Psalms 50:6
verses.text: And the heavens proclaim his righteousness, for God himself is judge. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 50:7
verses.text: "Hear, O my people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will testify against you: I am God, your God.

verses.name: Psalms 50:8
verses.text: I do not rebuke you for your sacrifices or your burnt offerings, which are ever before me.

verses.name: Psalms 50:9
verses.text: I have no need of a bull from your stall or of goats from your pens,

verses.name: Psalms 50:10
verses.text: for every animal of the forest is mine, and the cattle on a thousand hills.

verses.name: Psalms 50:11
verses.text: I know every bird in the mountains, and the creatures of the field are mine.

verses.name: Psalms 50:12
verses.text: If I were hungry I would not tell you, for the world is mine, and all that is in it.

verses.name: Psalms 50:13
verses.text: Do I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?

verses.name: Psalms 50:14
verses.text: Sacrifice thank offerings to God, fulfill your vows to the Most High,

verses.name: Psalms 50:15
verses.text: and call upon me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you will honor me."

verses.name: Psalms 50:16
verses.text: But to the wicked, God says: "What right have you to recite my laws or take my covenant on your lips?

verses.name: Psalms 50:17
verses.text: You hate my instruction and cast my words behind you.

verses.name: Psalms 50:18
verses.text: When you see a thief, you join with him; you throw in your lot with adulterers.

verses.name: Psalms 50:19
verses.text: You use your mouth for evil and harness your tongue to deceit.

verses.name: Psalms 50:20
verses.text: You speak continually against your brother and slander your own mother's son.

verses.name: Psalms 50:21
verses.text: These things you have done and I kept silent; you thought I was altogether like you. But I will rebuke you and accuse you to your face.

verses.name: Psalms 50:22
verses.text: "Consider this, you who forget God, or I will tear you to pieces, with none to rescue:

verses.name: Psalms 50:23
verses.text: He who sacrifices thank offerings honors me, and he prepares the way so that I may show him the salvation of God."

verses.name: Psalms 51:1
verses.text: Have mercy on me, O God, according to your unfailing love; according to your great compassion blot out my transgressions.

verses.name: Psalms 51:2
verses.text: Wash away all my iniquity and cleanse me from my sin.

verses.name: Psalms 51:3
verses.text: For I know my transgressions, and my sin is always before me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:4
verses.text: Against you, you only, have I sinned and done what is evil in your sight, so that you are proved right when you speak and justified when you judge.

verses.name: Psalms 51:5
verses.text: Surely I was sinful at birth, sinful from the time my mother conceived me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:6
verses.text: Surely you desire truth in the inner parts; you teach me wisdom in the inmost place.

verses.name: Psalms 51:7
verses.text: Cleanse me with hyssop, and I will be clean; wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

verses.name: Psalms 51:8
verses.text: Let me hear joy and gladness; let the bones you have crushed rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 51:9
verses.text: Hide your face from my sins and blot out all my iniquity.

verses.name: Psalms 51:10
verses.text: Create in me a pure heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:11
verses.text: Do not cast me from your presence or take your Holy Spirit from me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:12
verses.text: Restore to me the joy of your salvation and grant me a willing spirit, to sustain me.

verses.name: Psalms 51:13
verses.text: Then I will teach transgressors your ways, and sinners will turn back to you.

verses.name: Psalms 51:14
verses.text: Save me from bloodguilt, O God, the God who saves me, and my tongue will sing of your righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 51:15
verses.text: O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare your praise.

verses.name: Psalms 51:16
verses.text: You do not delight in sacrifice, or I would bring it; you do not take pleasure in burnt offerings.

verses.name: Psalms 51:17
verses.text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.

verses.name: Psalms 51:18
verses.text: In your good pleasure make Zion prosper; build up the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.name: Psalms 51:19
verses.text: Then there will be righteous sacrifices, whole burnt offerings to delight you; then bulls will be offered on your altar.

verses.name: Psalms 52:1
verses.text: Why do you boast of evil, you mighty man? Why do you boast all day long, you who are a disgrace in the eyes of God?

verses.name: Psalms 52:2
verses.text: Your tongue plots destruction; it is like a sharpened razor, you who practice deceit.

verses.name: Psalms 52:3
verses.text: You love evil rather than good, falsehood rather than speaking the truth. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 52:4
verses.text: You love every harmful word, O you deceitful tongue!

verses.name: Psalms 52:5
verses.text: Surely God will bring you down to everlasting ruin: He will snatch you up and tear you from your tent; he will uproot you from the land of the living. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 52:6
verses.text: The righteous will see and fear; they will laugh at him, saying,

verses.name: Psalms 52:7
verses.text: "Here now is the man who did not make God his stronghold but trusted in his great wealth and grew strong by destroying others!"

verses.name: Psalms 52:8
verses.text: But I am like an olive tree flourishing in the house of God; I trust in God's unfailing love for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 52:9
verses.text: I will praise you forever for what you have done; in your name I will hope, for your name is good. I will praise you in the presence of your saints.

verses.name: Psalms 53:1
verses.text: The fool says in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt, and their ways are vile; there is no one who does good.

verses.name: Psalms 53:2
verses.text: God looks down from heaven on the sons of men to see if there are any who understand, any who seek God.

verses.name: Psalms 53:3
verses.text: Everyone has turned away, they have together become corrupt; there is no one who does good, not even one.

verses.name: Psalms 53:4
verses.text: Will the evildoers never learn- those who devour my people as men eat bread and who do not call on God?

verses.name: Psalms 53:5
verses.text: There they were, overwhelmed with dread, where there was nothing to dread. God scattered the bones of those who attacked you; you put them to shame, for God despised them.

verses.name: Psalms 53:6
verses.text: Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of his people, let Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad!

verses.name: Psalms 54:1
verses.text: Save me, O God, by your name; vindicate me by your might.

verses.name: Psalms 54:2
verses.text: Hear my prayer, O God; listen to the words of my mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 54:3
verses.text: Strangers are attacking me; ruthless men seek my life- men without regard for God. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 54:4
verses.text: Surely God is my help; the Lord is the one who sustains me.

verses.name: Psalms 54:5
verses.text: Let evil recoil on those who slander me; in your faithfulness destroy them.

verses.name: Psalms 54:6
verses.text: I will sacrifice a freewill offering to you; I will praise your name, O LORD, for it is good.

verses.name: Psalms 54:7
verses.text: For he has delivered me from all my troubles, and my eyes have looked in triumph on my foes.

verses.name: Psalms 55:1
verses.text: Listen to my prayer, O God, do not ignore my plea;

verses.name: Psalms 55:2
verses.text: hear me and answer me. My thoughts trouble me and I am distraught

verses.name: Psalms 55:3
verses.text: at the voice of the enemy, at the stares of the wicked; for they bring down suffering upon me and revile me in their anger.

verses.name: Psalms 55:4
verses.text: My heart is in anguish within me; the terrors of death assail me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:5
verses.text: Fear and trembling have beset me; horror has overwhelmed me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:6
verses.text: I said, "Oh, that I had the wings of a dove! I would fly away and be at rest-

verses.name: Psalms 55:7
verses.text: I would flee far away and stay in the desert; Selah

verses.name: Psalms 55:8
verses.text: I would hurry to my place of shelter, far from the tempest and storm."

verses.name: Psalms 55:9
verses.text: Confuse the wicked, O Lord, confound their speech, for I see violence and strife in the city.

verses.name: Psalms 55:10
verses.text: Day and night they prowl about on its walls; malice and abuse are within it.

verses.name: Psalms 55:11
verses.text: Destructive forces are at work in the city; threats and lies never leave its streets.

verses.name: Psalms 55:12
verses.text: If an enemy were insulting me, I could endure it; if a foe were raising himself against me, I could hide from him.

verses.name: Psalms 55:13
verses.text: But it is you, a man like myself, my companion, my close friend,

verses.name: Psalms 55:14
verses.text: with whom I once enjoyed sweet fellowship as we walked with the throng at the house of God.

verses.name: Psalms 55:15
verses.text: Let death take my enemies by surprise; let them go down alive to the grave, for evil finds lodging among them.

verses.name: Psalms 55:16
verses.text: But I call to God, and the LORD saves me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:17
verses.text: Evening, morning and noon I cry out in distress, and he hears my voice.

verses.name: Psalms 55:18
verses.text: He ransoms me unharmed from the battle waged against me, even though many oppose me.

verses.name: Psalms 55:19
verses.text: God, who is enthroned forever, will hear them and afflict them- Selah men who never change their ways and have no fear of God.

verses.name: Psalms 55:20
verses.text: My companion attacks his friends; he violates his covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 55:21
verses.text: His speech is smooth as butter, yet war is in his heart; his words are more soothing than oil, yet they are drawn swords.

verses.name: Psalms 55:22
verses.text: Cast your cares on the LORD and he will sustain you; he will never let the righteous fall.

verses.name: Psalms 55:23
verses.text: But you, O God, will bring down the wicked into the pit of corruption; bloodthirsty and deceitful men will not live out half their days. But as for me, I trust in you.

verses.name: Psalms 56:1
verses.text: Be merciful to me, O God, for men hotly pursue me; all day long they press their attack.

verses.name: Psalms 56:2
verses.text: My slanderers pursue me all day long; many are attacking me in their pride.

verses.name: Psalms 56:3
verses.text: When I am afraid, I will trust in you.

verses.name: Psalms 56:4
verses.text: In God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I will not be afraid. What can mortal man do to me?

verses.name: Psalms 56:5
verses.text: All day long they twist my words; they are always plotting to harm me.

verses.name: Psalms 56:6
verses.text: They conspire, they lurk, they watch my steps, eager to take my life.

verses.name: Psalms 56:7
verses.text: On no account let them escape; in your anger, O God, bring down the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 56:8
verses.text: Record my lament; list my tears on your scroll - are they not in your record?

verses.name: Psalms 56:9
verses.text: Then my enemies will turn back when I call for help. By this I will know that God is for me.

verses.name: Psalms 56:10
verses.text: In God, whose word I praise, in the LORD, whose word I praise-

verses.name: Psalms 56:11
verses.text: in God I trust; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?

verses.name: Psalms 56:12
verses.text: I am under vows to you, O God; I will present my thank offerings to you.

verses.name: Psalms 56:13
verses.text: For you have delivered me from death and my feet from stumbling, that I may walk before God in the light of life.

verses.name: Psalms 57:1
verses.text: Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy on me, for in you my soul takes refuge. I will take refuge in the shadow of your wings until the disaster has passed.

verses.name: Psalms 57:2
verses.text: I cry out to God Most High, to God, who fulfills {his purpose} for me.

verses.name: Psalms 57:3
verses.text: He sends from heaven and saves me, rebuking those who hotly pursue me; Selah God sends his love and his faithfulness.

verses.name: Psalms 57:4
verses.text: I am in the midst of lions; I lie among ravenous beasts- men whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.

verses.name: Psalms 57:5
verses.text: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 57:6
verses.text: They spread a net for my feet- I was bowed down in distress. They dug a pit in my path- but they have fallen into it themselves. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 57:7
verses.text: My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast; I will sing and make music.

verses.name: Psalms 57:8
verses.text: Awake, my soul! Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.

verses.name: Psalms 57:9
verses.text: I will praise you, O Lord, among the nations; I will sing of you among the peoples.

verses.name: Psalms 57:10
verses.text: For great is your love, reaching to the heavens; your faithfulness reaches to the skies.

verses.name: Psalms 57:11
verses.text: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 58:1
verses.text: Do you rulers indeed speak justly? Do you judge uprightly among men?

verses.name: Psalms 58:2
verses.text: No, in your heart you devise injustice, and your hands mete out violence on the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 58:3
verses.text: Even from birth the wicked go astray; from the womb they are wayward and speak lies.

verses.name: Psalms 58:4
verses.text: Their venom is like the venom of a snake, like that of a cobra that has stopped its ears,

verses.name: Psalms 58:5
verses.text: that will not heed the tune of the charmer, however skillful the enchanter may be.

verses.name: Psalms 58:6
verses.text: Break the teeth in their mouths, O God; tear out, O LORD, the fangs of the lions!

verses.name: Psalms 58:7
verses.text: Let them vanish like water that flows away; when they draw the bow, let their arrows be blunted.

verses.name: Psalms 58:8
verses.text: Like a slug melting away as it moves along, like a stillborn child, may they not see the sun.

verses.name: Psalms 58:9
verses.text: Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns- whether they be green or dry-the wicked will be swept away.

verses.name: Psalms 58:10
verses.text: The righteous will be glad when they are avenged, when they bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 58:11
verses.text: Then men will say, "Surely the righteous still are rewarded; surely there is a God who judges the earth."

verses.name: Psalms 59:1
verses.text: Deliver me from my enemies, O God; protect me from those who rise up against me.

verses.name: Psalms 59:2
verses.text: Deliver me from evildoers and save me from bloodthirsty men.

verses.name: Psalms 59:3
verses.text: See how they lie in wait for me! Fierce men conspire against me for no offense or sin of mine, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 59:4
verses.text: I have done no wrong, yet they are ready to attack me. Arise to help me; look on my plight!

verses.name: Psalms 59:5
verses.text: O LORD God Almighty, the God of Israel, rouse yourself to punish all the nations; show no mercy to wicked traitors. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 59:6
verses.text: They return at evening, snarling like dogs, and prowl about the city.

verses.name: Psalms 59:7
verses.text: See what they spew from their mouths- they spew out swords from their lips, and they say, "Who can hear us?"

verses.name: Psalms 59:8
verses.text: But you, O LORD, laugh at them; you scoff at all those nations.

verses.name: Psalms 59:9
verses.text: O my Strength, I watch for you; you, O God, are my fortress,

verses.name: Psalms 59:10
verses.text: my loving God. God will go before me and will let me gloat over those who slander me.

verses.name: Psalms 59:11
verses.text: But do not kill them, O Lord our shield, or my people will forget. In your might make them wander about, and bring them down.

verses.name: Psalms 59:12
verses.text: For the sins of their mouths, for the words of their lips, let them be caught in their pride. For the curses and lies they utter,

verses.name: Psalms 59:13
verses.text: consume them in wrath, consume them till they are no more. Then it will be known to the ends of the earth that God rules over Jacob. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 59:14
verses.text: They return at evening, snarling like dogs, and prowl about the city.

verses.name: Psalms 59:15
verses.text: They wander about for food and howl if not satisfied.

verses.name: Psalms 59:16
verses.text: But I will sing of your strength, in the morning I will sing of your love; for you are my fortress, my refuge in times of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 59:17
verses.text: O my Strength, I sing praise to you; you, O God, are my fortress, my loving God.

verses.name: Psalms 60:1
verses.text: You have rejected us, O God, and burst forth upon us; you have been angry-now restore us!

verses.name: Psalms 60:2
verses.text: You have shaken the land and torn it open; mend its fractures, for it is quaking.

verses.name: Psalms 60:3
verses.text: You have shown your people desperate times; you have given us wine that makes us stagger.

verses.name: Psalms 60:4
verses.text: But for those who fear you, you have raised a banner to be unfurled against the bow. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 60:5
verses.text: Save us and help us with your right hand, that those you love may be delivered.

verses.name: Psalms 60:6
verses.text: God has spoken from his sanctuary: "In triumph I will parcel out Shechem and measure off the Valley of Succoth.

verses.name: Psalms 60:7
verses.text: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is my helmet, Judah my scepter.

verses.name: Psalms 60:8
verses.text: Moab is my washbasin, upon Edom I toss my sandal; over Philistia I shout in triumph."

verses.name: Psalms 60:9
verses.text: Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?

verses.name: Psalms 60:10
verses.text: Is it not you, O God, you who have rejected us and no longer go out with our armies?

verses.name: Psalms 60:11
verses.text: Give us aid against the enemy, for the help of man is worthless.

verses.name: Psalms 60:12
verses.text: With God we will gain the victory, and he will trample down our enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 61:1
verses.text: Hear my cry, O God; listen to my prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 61:2
verses.text: From the ends of the earth I call to you, I call as my heart grows faint; lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

verses.name: Psalms 61:3
verses.text: For you have been my refuge, a strong tower against the foe.

verses.name: Psalms 61:4
verses.text: I long to dwell in your tent forever and take refuge in the shelter of your wings. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 61:5
verses.text: For you have heard my vows, O God; you have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.

verses.name: Psalms 61:6
verses.text: Increase the days of the king's life, his years for many generations.

verses.name: Psalms 61:7
verses.text: May he be enthroned in God's presence forever; appoint your love and faithfulness to protect him.

verses.name: Psalms 61:8
verses.text: Then will I ever sing praise to your name and fulfill my vows day after day.

verses.name: Psalms 62:1
verses.text: My soul finds rest in God alone; my salvation comes from him.

verses.name: Psalms 62:2
verses.text: He alone is my rock and my salvation; he is my fortress, I will never be shaken.

verses.name: Psalms 62:3
verses.text: How long will you assault a man? Would all of you throw him down- this leaning wall, this tottering fence?

verses.name: Psalms 62:4
verses.text: They fully intend to topple him from his lofty place; they take delight in lies. With their mouths they bless, but in their hearts they curse. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 62:5
verses.text: Find rest, O my soul, in God alone; my hope comes from him.

verses.name: Psalms 62:6
verses.text: He alone is my rock and my salvation; he is my fortress, I will not be shaken.

verses.name: Psalms 62:7
verses.text: My salvation and my honor depend on God; he is my mighty rock, my refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 62:8
verses.text: Trust in him at all times, O people; pour out your hearts to him, for God is our refuge. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 62:9
verses.text: Lowborn men are but a breath, the highborn are but a lie; if weighed on a balance, they are nothing; together they are only a breath.

verses.name: Psalms 62:10
verses.text: Do not trust in extortion or take pride in stolen goods; though your riches increase, do not set your heart on them.

verses.name: Psalms 62:11
verses.text: One thing God has spoken, two things have I heard: that you, O God, are strong,

verses.name: Psalms 62:12
verses.text: and that you, O Lord, are loving. Surely you will reward each person according to what he has done.

verses.name: Psalms 63:1
verses.text: O God, you are my God, earnestly I seek you; my soul thirsts for you, my body longs for you, in a dry and weary land where there is no water.

verses.name: Psalms 63:2
verses.text: I have seen you in the sanctuary and beheld your power and your glory.

verses.name: Psalms 63:3
verses.text: Because your love is better than life, my lips will glorify you.

verses.name: Psalms 63:4
verses.text: I will praise you as long as I live, and in your name I will lift up my hands.

verses.name: Psalms 63:5
verses.text: My soul will be satisfied as with the richest of foods; with singing lips my mouth will praise you.

verses.name: Psalms 63:6
verses.text: On my bed I remember you; I think of you through the watches of the night.

verses.name: Psalms 63:7
verses.text: Because you are my help, I sing in the shadow of your wings.

verses.name: Psalms 63:8
verses.text: My soul clings to you; your right hand upholds me.

verses.name: Psalms 63:9
verses.text: They who seek my life will be destroyed; they will go down to the depths of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 63:10
verses.text: They will be given over to the sword and become food for jackals.

verses.name: Psalms 63:11
verses.text: But the king will rejoice in God; all who swear by God's name will praise him, while the mouths of liars will be silenced.

verses.name: Psalms 64:1
verses.text: Hear me, O God, as I voice my complaint; protect my life from the threat of the enemy.

verses.name: Psalms 64:2
verses.text: Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, from that noisy crowd of evildoers.

verses.name: Psalms 64:3
verses.text: They sharpen their tongues like swords and aim their words like deadly arrows.

verses.name: Psalms 64:4
verses.text: They shoot from ambush at the innocent man; they shoot at him suddenly, without fear.

verses.name: Psalms 64:5
verses.text: They encourage each other in evil plans, they talk about hiding their snares; they say, "Who will see them?"

verses.name: Psalms 64:6
verses.text: They plot injustice and say, "We have devised a perfect plan!" Surely the mind and heart of man are cunning.

verses.name: Psalms 64:7
verses.text: But God will shoot them with arrows; suddenly they will be struck down.

verses.name: Psalms 64:8
verses.text: He will turn their own tongues against them and bring them to ruin; all who see them will shake their heads in scorn.

verses.name: Psalms 64:9
verses.text: All mankind will fear; they will proclaim the works of God and ponder what he has done.

verses.name: Psalms 64:10
verses.text: Let the righteous rejoice in the LORD and take refuge in him; let all the upright in heart praise him!

verses.name: Psalms 65:1
verses.text: Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion; to you our vows will be fulfilled.

verses.name: Psalms 65:2
verses.text: O you who hear prayer, to you all men will come.

verses.name: Psalms 65:3
verses.text: When we were overwhelmed by sins, you forgave our transgressions.

verses.name: Psalms 65:4
verses.text: Blessed are those you choose and bring near to live in your courts! We are filled with the good things of your house, of your holy temple.

verses.name: Psalms 65:5
verses.text: You answer us with awesome deeds of righteousness, O God our Savior, the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest seas,

verses.name: Psalms 65:6
verses.text: who formed the mountains by your power, having armed yourself with strength,

verses.name: Psalms 65:7
verses.text: who stilled the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the turmoil of the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 65:8
verses.text: Those living far away fear your wonders; where morning dawns and evening fades you call forth songs of joy.

verses.name: Psalms 65:9
verses.text: You care for the land and water it; you enrich it abundantly. The streams of God are filled with water to provide the people with grain, for so you have ordained it.

verses.name: Psalms 65:10
verses.text: You drench its furrows and level its ridges; you soften it with showers and bless its crops.

verses.name: Psalms 65:11
verses.text: You crown the year with your bounty, and your carts overflow with abundance.

verses.name: Psalms 65:12
verses.text: The grasslands of the desert overflow; the hills are clothed with gladness.

verses.name: Psalms 65:13
verses.text: The meadows are covered with flocks and the valleys are mantled with grain; they shout for joy and sing.

verses.name: Psalms 66:1
verses.text: Shout with joy to God, all the earth!

verses.name: Psalms 66:2
verses.text: Sing the glory of his name; make his praise glorious!

verses.name: Psalms 66:3
verses.text: Say to God, "How awesome are your deeds! So great is your power that your enemies cringe before you.

verses.name: Psalms 66:4
verses.text: All the earth bows down to you; they sing praise to you, they sing praise to your name." Selah

verses.name: Psalms 66:5
verses.text: Come and see what God has done, how awesome his works in man's behalf!

verses.name: Psalms 66:6
verses.text: He turned the sea into dry land, they passed through the waters on foot- come, let us rejoice in him.

verses.name: Psalms 66:7
verses.text: He rules forever by his power, his eyes watch the nations- let not the rebellious rise up against him. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 66:8
verses.text: Praise our God, O peoples, let the sound of his praise be heard;

verses.name: Psalms 66:9
verses.text: he has preserved our lives and kept our feet from slipping.

verses.name: Psalms 66:10
verses.text: For you, O God, tested us; you refined us like silver.

verses.name: Psalms 66:11
verses.text: You brought us into prison and laid burdens on our backs.

verses.name: Psalms 66:12
verses.text: You let men ride over our heads; we went through fire and water, but you brought us to a place of abundance.

verses.name: Psalms 66:13
verses.text: I will come to your temple with burnt offerings and fulfill my vows to you-

verses.name: Psalms 66:14
verses.text: vows my lips promised and my mouth spoke when I was in trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 66:15
verses.text: I will sacrifice fat animals to you and an offering of rams; I will offer bulls and goats. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 66:16
verses.text: Come and listen, all you who fear God; let me tell you what he has done for me.

verses.name: Psalms 66:17
verses.text: I cried out to him with my mouth; his praise was on my tongue.

verses.name: Psalms 66:18
verses.text: If I had cherished sin in my heart, the Lord would not have listened;

verses.name: Psalms 66:19
verses.text: but God has surely listened and heard my voice in prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 66:20
verses.text: Praise be to God, who has not rejected my prayer or withheld his love from me!

verses.name: Psalms 67:1
verses.text: May God be gracious to us and bless us and make his face shine upon us, Selah

verses.name: Psalms 67:2
verses.text: that your ways may be known on earth, your salvation among all nations.

verses.name: Psalms 67:3
verses.text: May the peoples praise you, O God; may all the peoples praise you.

verses.name: Psalms 67:4
verses.text: May the nations be glad and sing for joy, for you rule the peoples justly and guide the nations of the earth. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 67:5
verses.text: May the peoples praise you, O God; may all the peoples praise you.

verses.name: Psalms 67:6
verses.text: Then the land will yield its harvest, and God, our God, will bless us.

verses.name: Psalms 67:7
verses.text: God will bless us, and all the ends of the earth will fear him.

verses.name: Psalms 68:1
verses.text: May God arise, may his enemies be scattered; may his foes flee before him.

verses.name: Psalms 68:2
verses.text: As smoke is blown away by the wind, may you blow them away; as wax melts before the fire, may the wicked perish before God.

verses.name: Psalms 68:3
verses.text: But may the righteous be glad and rejoice before God; may they be happy and joyful.

verses.name: Psalms 68:4
verses.text: Sing to God, sing praise to his name, extol him who rides on the clouds - his name is the LORD - and rejoice before him.

verses.name: Psalms 68:5
verses.text: A father to the fatherless, a defender of widows, is God in his holy dwelling.

verses.name: Psalms 68:6
verses.text: God sets the lonely in families, he leads forth the prisoners with singing; but the rebellious live in a sun-scorched land.

verses.name: Psalms 68:7
verses.text: When you went out before your people, O God, when you marched through the wasteland, Selah

verses.name: Psalms 68:8
verses.text: the earth shook, the heavens poured down rain, before God, the One of Sinai, before God, the God of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 68:9
verses.text: You gave abundant showers, O God; you refreshed your weary inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 68:10
verses.text: Your people settled in it, and from your bounty, O God, you provided for the poor.

verses.name: Psalms 68:11
verses.text: The Lord announced the word, and great was the company of those who proclaimed it:

verses.name: Psalms 68:12
verses.text: "Kings and armies flee in haste; in the camps men divide the plunder.

verses.name: Psalms 68:13
verses.text: Even while you sleep among the campfires, the wings of my dove are sheathed with silver, its feathers with shining gold."

verses.name: Psalms 68:14
verses.text: When the Almighty scattered the kings in the land, it was like snow fallen on Zalmon.

verses.name: Psalms 68:15
verses.text: The mountains of Bashan are majestic mountains; rugged are the mountains of Bashan.

verses.name: Psalms 68:16
verses.text: Why gaze in envy, O rugged mountains, at the mountain where God chooses to reign, where the LORD himself will dwell forever?

verses.name: Psalms 68:17
verses.text: The chariots of God are tens of thousands and thousands of thousands; the Lord has come from Sinai into his sanctuary.

verses.name: Psalms 68:18
verses.text: When you ascended on high, you led captives in your train; you received gifts from men, even from the rebellious- that you, O LORD God, might dwell there.

verses.name: Psalms 68:19
verses.text: Praise be to the Lord, to God our Savior, who daily bears our burdens. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 68:20
verses.text: Our God is a God who saves; from the Sovereign LORD comes escape from death.

verses.name: Psalms 68:21
verses.text: Surely God will crush the heads of his enemies, the hairy crowns of those who go on in their sins.

verses.name: Psalms 68:22
verses.text: The Lord says, "I will bring them from Bashan; I will bring them from the depths of the sea,

verses.name: Psalms 68:23
verses.text: that you may plunge your feet in the blood of your foes, while the tongues of your dogs have their share."

verses.name: Psalms 68:24
verses.text: Your procession has come into view, O God, the procession of my God and King into the sanctuary.

verses.name: Psalms 68:25
verses.text: In front are the singers, after them the musicians; with them are the maidens playing tambourines.

verses.name: Psalms 68:26
verses.text: Praise God in the great congregation; praise the LORD in the assembly of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 68:27
verses.text: There is the little tribe of Benjamin, leading them, there the great throng of Judah's princes, and there the princes of Zebulun and of Naphtali.

verses.name: Psalms 68:28
verses.text: Summon your power, O God; show us your strength, O God, as you have done before.

verses.name: Psalms 68:29
verses.text: Because of your temple at Jerusalem kings will bring you gifts.

verses.name: Psalms 68:30
verses.text: Rebuke the beast among the reeds, the herd of bulls among the calves of the nations. Humbled, may it bring bars of silver. Scatter the nations who delight in war.

verses.name: Psalms 68:31
verses.text: Envoys will come from Egypt; Cush will submit herself to God.

verses.name: Psalms 68:32
verses.text: Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth, sing praise to the Lord, Selah

verses.name: Psalms 68:33
verses.text: to him who rides the ancient skies above, who thunders with mighty voice.

verses.name: Psalms 68:34
verses.text: Proclaim the power of God, whose majesty is over Israel, whose power is in the skies.

verses.name: Psalms 68:35
verses.text: You are awesome, O God, in your sanctuary; the God of Israel gives power and strength to his people. Praise be to God!

verses.name: Psalms 69:1
verses.text: Save me, O God, for the waters have come up to my neck.

verses.name: Psalms 69:2
verses.text: I sink in the miry depths, where there is no foothold. I have come into the deep waters; the floods engulf me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:3
verses.text: I am worn out calling for help; my throat is parched. My eyes fail, looking for my God.

verses.name: Psalms 69:4
verses.text: Those who hate me without reason outnumber the hairs of my head; many are my enemies without cause, those who seek to destroy me. I am forced to restore what I did not steal.

verses.name: Psalms 69:5
verses.text: You know my folly, O God; my guilt is not hidden from you.

verses.name: Psalms 69:6
verses.text: May those who hope in you not be disgraced because of me, O Lord, the LORD Almighty; may those who seek you not be put to shame because of me, O God of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 69:7
verses.text: For I endure scorn for your sake, and shame covers my face.

verses.name: Psalms 69:8
verses.text: I am a stranger to my brothers, an alien to my own mother's sons;

verses.name: Psalms 69:9
verses.text: for zeal for your house consumes me, and the insults of those who insult you fall on me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:10
verses.text: When I weep and fast, I must endure scorn;

verses.name: Psalms 69:11
verses.text: when I put on sackcloth, people make sport of me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:12
verses.text: Those who sit at the gate mock me, and I am the song of the drunkards.

verses.name: Psalms 69:13
verses.text: But I pray to you, O LORD, in the time of your favor; in your great love, O God, answer me with your sure salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 69:14
verses.text: Rescue me from the mire, do not let me sink; deliver me from those who hate me, from the deep waters.

verses.name: Psalms 69:15
verses.text: Do not let the floodwaters engulf me or the depths swallow me up or the pit close its mouth over me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:16
verses.text: Answer me, O LORD, out of the goodness of your love; in your great mercy turn to me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:17
verses.text: Do not hide your face from your servant; answer me quickly, for I am in trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 69:18
verses.text: Come near and rescue me; redeem me because of my foes.

verses.name: Psalms 69:19
verses.text: You know how I am scorned, disgraced and shamed; all my enemies are before you.

verses.name: Psalms 69:20
verses.text: Scorn has broken my heart and has left me helpless; I looked for sympathy, but there was none, for comforters, but I found none.

verses.name: Psalms 69:21
verses.text: They put gall in my food and gave me vinegar for my thirst.

verses.name: Psalms 69:22
verses.text: May the table set before them become a snare; may it become retribution and a trap.

verses.name: Psalms 69:23
verses.text: May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see, and their backs be bent forever.

verses.name: Psalms 69:24
verses.text: Pour out your wrath on them; let your fierce anger overtake them.

verses.name: Psalms 69:25
verses.text: May their place be deserted; let there be no one to dwell in their tents.

verses.name: Psalms 69:26
verses.text: For they persecute those you wound and talk about the pain of those you hurt.

verses.name: Psalms 69:27
verses.text: Charge them with crime upon crime; do not let them share in your salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 69:28
verses.text: May they be blotted out of the book of life and not be listed with the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 69:29
verses.text: I am in pain and distress; may your salvation, O God, protect me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:30
verses.text: I will praise God's name in song and glorify him with thanksgiving.

verses.name: Psalms 69:31
verses.text: This will please the LORD more than an ox, more than a bull with its horns and hoofs.

verses.name: Psalms 69:32
verses.text: The poor will see and be glad- you who seek God, may your hearts live!

verses.name: Psalms 69:33
verses.text: The LORD hears the needy and does not despise his captive people.

verses.name: Psalms 69:34
verses.text: Let heaven and earth praise him, the seas and all that move in them,

verses.name: Psalms 69:35
verses.text: for God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah. Then people will settle there and possess it;

verses.name: Psalms 69:36
verses.text: the children of his servants will inherit it, and those who love his name will dwell there.

verses.name: Psalms 70:1
verses.text: Hasten, O God, to save me; O LORD, come quickly to help me.

verses.name: Psalms 70:2
verses.text: May those who seek my life be put to shame and confusion; may all who desire my ruin be turned back in disgrace.

verses.name: Psalms 70:3
verses.text: May those who say to me, "Aha! Aha!" turn back because of their shame.

verses.name: Psalms 70:4
verses.text: But may all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; may those who love your salvation always say, "Let God be exalted!"

verses.name: Psalms 70:5
verses.text: Yet I am poor and needy; come quickly to me, O God. You are my help and my deliverer; O LORD, do not delay.

verses.name: Psalms 71:1
verses.text: In you, O LORD, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame.

verses.name: Psalms 71:2
verses.text: Rescue me and deliver me in your righteousness; turn your ear to me and save me.

verses.name: Psalms 71:3
verses.text: Be my rock of refuge, to which I can always go; give the command to save me, for you are my rock and my fortress.

verses.name: Psalms 71:4
verses.text: Deliver me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of evil and cruel men.

verses.name: Psalms 71:5
verses.text: For you have been my hope, O Sovereign LORD, my confidence since my youth.

verses.name: Psalms 71:6
verses.text: From birth I have relied on you; you brought me forth from my mother's womb. I will ever praise you.

verses.name: Psalms 71:7
verses.text: I have become like a portent to many, but you are my strong refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 71:8
verses.text: My mouth is filled with your praise, declaring your splendor all day long.

verses.name: Psalms 71:9
verses.text: Do not cast me away when I am old; do not forsake me when my strength is gone.

verses.name: Psalms 71:10
verses.text: For my enemies speak against me; those who wait to kill me conspire together.

verses.name: Psalms 71:11
verses.text: They say, "God has forsaken him; pursue him and seize him, for no one will rescue him."

verses.name: Psalms 71:12
verses.text: Be not far from me, O God; come quickly, O my God, to help me.

verses.name: Psalms 71:13
verses.text: May my accusers perish in shame; may those who want to harm me be covered with scorn and disgrace.

verses.name: Psalms 71:14
verses.text: But as for me, I will always have hope; I will praise you more and more.

verses.name: Psalms 71:15
verses.text: My mouth will tell of your righteousness, of your salvation all day long, though I know not its measure.

verses.name: Psalms 71:16
verses.text: I will come and proclaim your mighty acts, O Sovereign LORD; I will proclaim your righteousness, yours alone.

verses.name: Psalms 71:17
verses.text: Since my youth, O God, you have taught me, and to this day I declare your marvelous deeds.

verses.name: Psalms 71:18
verses.text: Even when I am old and gray, do not forsake me, O God, till I declare your power to the next generation, your might to all who are to come.

verses.name: Psalms 71:19
verses.text: Your righteousness reaches to the skies, O God, you who have done great things. Who, O God, is like you?

verses.name: Psalms 71:20
verses.text: Though you have made me see troubles, many and bitter, you will restore my life again; from the depths of the earth you will again bring me up.

verses.name: Psalms 71:21
verses.text: You will increase my honor and comfort me once again.

verses.name: Psalms 71:22
verses.text: I will praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, O my God; I will sing praise to you with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 71:23
verses.text: My lips will shout for joy when I sing praise to you- I, whom you have redeemed.

verses.name: Psalms 71:24
verses.text: My tongue will tell of your righteous acts all day long, for those who wanted to harm me have been put to shame and confusion.

verses.name: Psalms 72:1
verses.text: Endow the king with your justice, O God, the royal son with your righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 72:2
verses.text: He will judge your people in righteousness, your afflicted ones with justice.

verses.name: Psalms 72:3
verses.text: The mountains will bring prosperity to the people, the hills the fruit of righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 72:4
verses.text: He will defend the afflicted among the people and save the children of the needy; he will crush the oppressor.

verses.name: Psalms 72:5
verses.text: He will endure as long as the sun, as long as the moon, through all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 72:6
verses.text: He will be like rain falling on a mown field, like showers watering the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 72:7
verses.text: In his days the righteous will flourish; prosperity will abound till the moon is no more.

verses.name: Psalms 72:8
verses.text: He will rule from sea to sea and from the River to the ends of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 72:9
verses.text: The desert tribes will bow before him and his enemies will lick the dust.

verses.name: Psalms 72:10
verses.text: The kings of Tarshish and of distant shores will bring tribute to him; the kings of Sheba and Seba will present him gifts.

verses.name: Psalms 72:11
verses.text: All kings will bow down to him and all nations will serve him.

verses.name: Psalms 72:12
verses.text: For he will deliver the needy who cry out, the afflicted who have no one to help.

verses.name: Psalms 72:13
verses.text: He will take pity on the weak and the needy and save the needy from death.

verses.name: Psalms 72:14
verses.text: He will rescue them from oppression and violence, for precious is their blood in his sight.

verses.name: Psalms 72:15
verses.text: Long may he live! May gold from Sheba be given him. May people ever pray for him and bless him all day long.

verses.name: Psalms 72:16
verses.text: Let grain abound throughout the land; on the tops of the hills may it sway. Let its fruit flourish like Lebanon; let it thrive like the grass of the field.

verses.name: Psalms 72:17
verses.text: May his name endure forever; may it continue as long as the sun. All nations will be blessed through him, and they will call him blessed.

verses.name: Psalms 72:18
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD God, the God of Israel, who alone does marvelous deeds.

verses.name: Psalms 72:19
verses.text: Praise be to his glorious name forever; may the whole earth be filled with his glory. Amen and Amen.

verses.name: Psalms 72:20
verses.text: This concludes the prayers of David son of Jesse.

verses.name: Psalms 73:1
verses.text: A psalm of Asaph. Surely God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 73:2
verses.text: But as for me, my feet had almost slipped; I had nearly lost my foothold.

verses.name: Psalms 73:3
verses.text: For I envied the arrogant when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 73:4
verses.text: They have no struggles; their bodies are healthy and strong.

verses.name: Psalms 73:5
verses.text: They are free from the burdens common to man; they are not plagued by human ills.

verses.name: Psalms 73:6
verses.text: Therefore pride is their necklace; they clothe themselves with violence.

verses.name: Psalms 73:7
verses.text: From their callous hearts comes iniquity; the evil conceits of their minds know no limits.

verses.name: Psalms 73:8
verses.text: They scoff, and speak with malice; in their arrogance they threaten oppression.

verses.name: Psalms 73:9
verses.text: Their mouths lay claim to heaven, and their tongues take possession of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 73:10
verses.text: Therefore their people turn to them and drink up waters in abundance.

verses.name: Psalms 73:11
verses.text: They say, "How can God know? Does the Most High have knowledge?"

verses.name: Psalms 73:12
verses.text: This is what the wicked are like- always carefree, they increase in wealth.

verses.name: Psalms 73:13
verses.text: Surely in vain have I kept my heart pure; in vain have I washed my hands in innocence.

verses.name: Psalms 73:14
verses.text: All day long I have been plagued; I have been punished every morning.

verses.name: Psalms 73:15
verses.text: If I had said, "I will speak thus," I would have betrayed your children.

verses.name: Psalms 73:16
verses.text: When I tried to understand all this, it was oppressive to me

verses.name: Psalms 73:17
verses.text: till I entered the sanctuary of God; then I understood their final destiny.

verses.name: Psalms 73:18
verses.text: Surely you place them on slippery ground; you cast them down to ruin.

verses.name: Psalms 73:19
verses.text: How suddenly are they destroyed, completely swept away by terrors!

verses.name: Psalms 73:20
verses.text: As a dream when one awakes, so when you arise, O Lord, you will despise them as fantasies.

verses.name: Psalms 73:21
verses.text: When my heart was grieved and my spirit embittered,

verses.name: Psalms 73:22
verses.text: I was senseless and ignorant; I was a brute beast before you.

verses.name: Psalms 73:23
verses.text: Yet I am always with you; you hold me by my right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 73:24
verses.text: You guide me with your counsel, and afterward you will take me into glory.

verses.name: Psalms 73:25
verses.text: Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you.

verses.name: Psalms 73:26
verses.text: My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.

verses.name: Psalms 73:27
verses.text: Those who are far from you will perish; you destroy all who are unfaithful to you.

verses.name: Psalms 73:28
verses.text: But as for me, it is good to be near God. I have made the Sovereign LORD my refuge; I will tell of all your deeds.

verses.name: Psalms 74:1
verses.text: Why have you rejected us forever, O God? Why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?

verses.name: Psalms 74:2
verses.text: Remember the people you purchased of old, the tribe of your inheritance, whom you redeemed- Mount Zion, where you dwelt.

verses.name: Psalms 74:3
verses.text: Turn your steps toward these everlasting ruins, all this destruction the enemy has brought on the sanctuary.

verses.name: Psalms 74:4
verses.text: Your foes roared in the place where you met with us; they set up their standards as signs.

verses.name: Psalms 74:5
verses.text: They behaved like men wielding axes to cut through a thicket of trees.

verses.name: Psalms 74:6
verses.text: They smashed all the carved paneling with their axes and hatchets.

verses.name: Psalms 74:7
verses.text: They burned your sanctuary to the ground; they defiled the dwelling place of your Name.

verses.name: Psalms 74:8
verses.text: They said in their hearts, "We will crush them completely!" They burned every place where God was worshiped in the land.

verses.name: Psalms 74:9
verses.text: We are given no miraculous signs; no prophets are left, and none of us knows how long this will be.

verses.name: Psalms 74:10
verses.text: How long will the enemy mock you, O God? Will the foe revile your name forever?

verses.name: Psalms 74:11
verses.text: Why do you hold back your hand, your right hand? Take it from the folds of your garment and destroy them!

verses.name: Psalms 74:12
verses.text: But you, O God, are my king from of old; you bring salvation upon the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 74:13
verses.text: It was you who split open the sea by your power; you broke the heads of the monster in the waters.

verses.name: Psalms 74:14
verses.text: It was you who crushed the heads of Leviathan and gave him as food to the creatures of the desert.

verses.name: Psalms 74:15
verses.text: It was you who opened up springs and streams; you dried up the ever flowing rivers.

verses.name: Psalms 74:16
verses.text: The day is yours, and yours also the night; you established the sun and moon.

verses.name: Psalms 74:17
verses.text: It was you who set all the boundaries of the earth; you made both summer and winter.

verses.name: Psalms 74:18
verses.text: Remember how the enemy has mocked you, O LORD, how foolish people have reviled your name.

verses.name: Psalms 74:19
verses.text: Do not hand over the life of your dove to wild beasts; do not forget the lives of your afflicted people forever.

verses.name: Psalms 74:20
verses.text: Have regard for your covenant, because haunts of violence fill the dark places of the land.

verses.name: Psalms 74:21
verses.text: Do not let the oppressed retreat in disgrace; may the poor and needy praise your name.

verses.name: Psalms 74:22
verses.text: Rise up, O God, and defend your cause; remember how fools mock you all day long.

verses.name: Psalms 74:23
verses.text: Do not ignore the clamor of your adversaries, the uproar of your enemies, which rises continually.

verses.name: Psalms 75:1
verses.text: We give thanks to you, O God, we give thanks, for your Name is near; men tell of your wonderful deeds.

verses.name: Psalms 75:2
verses.text: You say, "I choose the appointed time; it is I who judge uprightly.

verses.name: Psalms 75:3
verses.text: When the earth and all its people quake, it is I who hold its pillars firm. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 75:4
verses.text: To the arrogant I say, 'Boast no more,' and to the wicked, 'Do not lift up your horns.

verses.name: Psalms 75:5
verses.text: Do not lift your horns against heaven; do not speak with outstretched neck.'"

verses.name: Psalms 75:6
verses.text: No one from the east or the west or from the desert can exalt a man.

verses.name: Psalms 75:7
verses.text: But it is God who judges: He brings one down, he exalts another.

verses.name: Psalms 75:8
verses.text: In the hand of the LORD is a cup full of foaming wine mixed with spices; he pours it out, and all the wicked of the earth drink it down to its very dregs.

verses.name: Psalms 75:9
verses.text: As for me, I will declare this forever; I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 75:10
verses.text: I will cut off the horns of all the wicked, but the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.

verses.name: Psalms 76:1
verses.text: In Judah God is known; his name is great in Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 76:2
verses.text: His tent is in Salem, his dwelling place in Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 76:3
verses.text: There he broke the flashing arrows, the shields and the swords, the weapons of war. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 76:4
verses.text: You are resplendent with light, more majestic than mountains rich with game.

verses.name: Psalms 76:5
verses.text: Valiant men lie plundered, they sleep their last sleep; not one of the warriors can lift his hands.

verses.name: Psalms 76:6
verses.text: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both horse and chariot lie still.

verses.name: Psalms 76:7
verses.text: You alone are to be feared. Who can stand before you when you are angry?

verses.name: Psalms 76:8
verses.text: From heaven you pronounced judgment, and the land feared and was quiet-

verses.name: Psalms 76:9
verses.text: when you, O God, rose up to judge, to save all the afflicted of the land. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 76:10
verses.text: Surely your wrath against men brings you praise, and the survivors of your wrath are restrained.

verses.name: Psalms 76:11
verses.text: Make vows to the LORD your God and fulfill them; let all the neighboring lands bring gifts to the One to be feared.

verses.name: Psalms 76:12
verses.text: He breaks the spirit of rulers; he is feared by the kings of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 77:1
verses.text: I cried out to God for help; I cried out to God to hear me.

verses.name: Psalms 77:2
verses.text: When I was in distress, I sought the Lord; at night I stretched out untiring hands and my soul refused to be comforted.

verses.name: Psalms 77:3
verses.text: I remembered you, O God, and I groaned; I mused, and my spirit grew faint. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 77:4
verses.text: You kept my eyes from closing; I was too troubled to speak.

verses.name: Psalms 77:5
verses.text: I thought about the former days, the years of long ago;

verses.name: Psalms 77:6
verses.text: I remembered my songs in the night. My heart mused and my spirit inquired:

verses.name: Psalms 77:7
verses.text: "Will the Lord reject forever? Will he never show his favor again?

verses.name: Psalms 77:8
verses.text: Has his unfailing love vanished forever? Has his promise failed for all time?

verses.name: Psalms 77:9
verses.text: Has God forgotten to be merciful? Has he in anger withheld his compassion?" Selah

verses.name: Psalms 77:10
verses.text: Then I thought, "To this I will appeal: the years of the right hand of the Most High."

verses.name: Psalms 77:11
verses.text: I will remember the deeds of the LORD; yes, I will remember your miracles of long ago.

verses.name: Psalms 77:12
verses.text: I will meditate on all your works and consider all your mighty deeds.

verses.name: Psalms 77:13
verses.text: Your ways, O God, are holy. What god is so great as our God?

verses.name: Psalms 77:14
verses.text: You are the God who performs miracles; you display your power among the peoples.

verses.name: Psalms 77:15
verses.text: With your mighty arm you redeemed your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 77:16
verses.text: The waters saw you, O God, the waters saw you and writhed; the very depths were convulsed.

verses.name: Psalms 77:17
verses.text: The clouds poured down water, the skies resounded with thunder; your arrows flashed back and forth.

verses.name: Psalms 77:18
verses.text: Your thunder was heard in the whirlwind, your lightning lit up the world; the earth trembled and quaked.

verses.name: Psalms 77:19
verses.text: Your path led through the sea, your way through the mighty waters, though your footprints were not seen.

verses.name: Psalms 77:20
verses.text: You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

verses.name: Psalms 78:1
verses.text: O my people, hear my teaching; listen to the words of my mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 78:2
verses.text: I will open my mouth in parables, I will utter hidden things, things from of old-

verses.name: Psalms 78:3
verses.text: what we have heard and known, what our fathers have told us.

verses.name: Psalms 78:4
verses.text: We will not hide them from their children; we will tell the next generation the praiseworthy deeds of the LORD, his power, and the wonders he has done.

verses.name: Psalms 78:5
verses.text: He decreed statutes for Jacob and established the law in Israel, which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children,

verses.name: Psalms 78:6
verses.text: so the next generation would know them, even the children yet to be born, and they in turn would tell their children.

verses.name: Psalms 78:7
verses.text: Then they would put their trust in God and would not forget his deeds but would keep his commands.

verses.name: Psalms 78:8
verses.text: They would not be like their forefathers- a stubborn and rebellious generation, whose hearts were not loyal to God, whose spirits were not faithful to him.

verses.name: Psalms 78:9
verses.text: The men of Ephraim, though armed with bows, turned back on the day of battle;

verses.name: Psalms 78:10
verses.text: they did not keep God's covenant and refused to live by his law.

verses.name: Psalms 78:11
verses.text: They forgot what he had done, the wonders he had shown them.

verses.name: Psalms 78:12
verses.text: He did miracles in the sight of their fathers in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.

verses.name: Psalms 78:13
verses.text: He divided the sea and led them through; he made the water stand firm like a wall.

verses.name: Psalms 78:14
verses.text: He guided them with the cloud by day and with light from the fire all night.

verses.name: Psalms 78:15
verses.text: He split the rocks in the desert and gave them water as abundant as the seas;

verses.name: Psalms 78:16
verses.text: he brought streams out of a rocky crag and made water flow down like rivers.

verses.name: Psalms 78:17
verses.text: But they continued to sin against him, rebelling in the desert against the Most High.

verses.name: Psalms 78:18
verses.text: They willfully put God to the test by demanding the food they craved.

verses.name: Psalms 78:19
verses.text: They spoke against God, saying, "Can God spread a table in the desert?

verses.name: Psalms 78:20
verses.text: When he struck the rock, water gushed out, and streams flowed abundantly. But can he also give us food? Can he supply meat for his people?"

verses.name: Psalms 78:21
verses.text: When the LORD heard them, he was very angry; his fire broke out against Jacob, and his wrath rose against Israel,

verses.name: Psalms 78:22
verses.text: for they did not believe in God or trust in his deliverance.

verses.name: Psalms 78:23
verses.text: Yet he gave a command to the skies above and opened the doors of the heavens;

verses.name: Psalms 78:24
verses.text: he rained down manna for the people to eat, he gave them the grain of heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 78:25
verses.text: Men ate the bread of angels; he sent them all the food they could eat.

verses.name: Psalms 78:26
verses.text: He let loose the east wind from the heavens and led forth the south wind by his power.

verses.name: Psalms 78:27
verses.text: He rained meat down on them like dust, flying birds like sand on the seashore.

verses.name: Psalms 78:28
verses.text: He made them come down inside their camp, all around their tents.

verses.name: Psalms 78:29
verses.text: They ate till they had more than enough, for he had given them what they craved.

verses.name: Psalms 78:30
verses.text: But before they turned from the food they craved, even while it was still in their mouths,

verses.name: Psalms 78:31
verses.text: God's anger rose against them; he put to death the sturdiest among them, cutting down the young men of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 78:32
verses.text: In spite of all this, they kept on sinning; in spite of his wonders, they did not believe.

verses.name: Psalms 78:33
verses.text: So he ended their days in futility and their years in terror.

verses.name: Psalms 78:34
verses.text: Whenever God slew them, they would seek him; they eagerly turned to him again.

verses.name: Psalms 78:35
verses.text: They remembered that God was their Rock, that God Most High was their Redeemer.

verses.name: Psalms 78:36
verses.text: But then they would flatter him with their mouths, lying to him with their tongues;

verses.name: Psalms 78:37
verses.text: their hearts were not loyal to him, they were not faithful to his covenant.

verses.name: Psalms 78:38
verses.text: Yet he was merciful; he forgave their iniquities and did not destroy them. Time after time he restrained his anger and did not stir up his full wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 78:39
verses.text: He remembered that they were but flesh, a passing breeze that does not return.

verses.name: Psalms 78:40
verses.text: How often they rebelled against him in the desert and grieved him in the wasteland!

verses.name: Psalms 78:41
verses.text: Again and again they put God to the test; they vexed the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 78:42
verses.text: They did not remember his power- the day he redeemed them from the oppressor,

verses.name: Psalms 78:43
verses.text: the day he displayed his miraculous signs in Egypt, his wonders in the region of Zoan.

verses.name: Psalms 78:44
verses.text: He turned their rivers to blood; they could not drink from their streams.

verses.name: Psalms 78:45
verses.text: He sent swarms of flies that devoured them, and frogs that devastated them.

verses.name: Psalms 78:46
verses.text: He gave their crops to the grasshopper, their produce to the locust.

verses.name: Psalms 78:47
verses.text: He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore-figs with sleet.

verses.name: Psalms 78:48
verses.text: He gave over their cattle to the hail, their livestock to bolts of lightning.

verses.name: Psalms 78:49
verses.text: He unleashed against them his hot anger, his wrath, indignation and hostility- a band of destroying angels.

verses.name: Psalms 78:50
verses.text: He prepared a path for his anger; he did not spare them from death but gave them over to the plague.

verses.name: Psalms 78:51
verses.text: He struck down all the firstborn of Egypt, the firstfruits of manhood in the tents of Ham.

verses.name: Psalms 78:52
verses.text: But he brought his people out like a flock; he led them like sheep through the desert.

verses.name: Psalms 78:53
verses.text: He guided them safely, so they were unafraid; but the sea engulfed their enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 78:54
verses.text: Thus he brought them to the border of his holy land, to the hill country his right hand had taken.

verses.name: Psalms 78:55
verses.text: He drove out nations before them and allotted their lands to them as an inheritance; he settled the tribes of Israel in their homes.

verses.name: Psalms 78:56
verses.text: But they put God to the test and rebelled against the Most High; they did not keep his statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 78:57
verses.text: Like their fathers they were disloyal and faithless, as unreliable as a faulty bow.

verses.name: Psalms 78:58
verses.text: They angered him with their high places; they aroused his jealousy with their idols.

verses.name: Psalms 78:59
verses.text: When God heard them, he was very angry; he rejected Israel completely.

verses.name: Psalms 78:60
verses.text: He abandoned the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent he had set up among men.

verses.name: Psalms 78:61
verses.text: He sent the ark of his might into captivity, his splendor into the hands of the enemy.

verses.name: Psalms 78:62
verses.text: He gave his people over to the sword; he was very angry with his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 78:63
verses.text: Fire consumed their young men, and their maidens had no wedding songs;

verses.name: Psalms 78:64
verses.text: their priests were put to the sword, and their widows could not weep.

verses.name: Psalms 78:65
verses.text: Then the Lord awoke as from sleep, as a man wakes from the stupor of wine.

verses.name: Psalms 78:66
verses.text: He beat back his enemies; he put them to everlasting shame.

verses.name: Psalms 78:67
verses.text: Then he rejected the tents of Joseph, he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim;

verses.name: Psalms 78:68
verses.text: but he chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which he loved.

verses.name: Psalms 78:69
verses.text: He built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth that he established forever.

verses.name: Psalms 78:70
verses.text: He chose David his servant and took him from the sheep pens;

verses.name: Psalms 78:71
verses.text: from tending the sheep he brought him to be the shepherd of his people Jacob, of Israel his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 78:72
verses.text: And David shepherded them with integrity of heart; with skillful hands he led them.

verses.name: Psalms 79:1
verses.text: O God, the nations have invaded your inheritance; they have defiled your holy temple, they have reduced Jerusalem to rubble.

verses.name: Psalms 79:2
verses.text: They have given the dead bodies of your servants as food to the birds of the air, the flesh of your saints to the beasts of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 79:3
verses.text: They have poured out blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there is no one to bury the dead.

verses.name: Psalms 79:4
