verses.text: We are objects of reproach to our neighbors, of scorn and derision to those around us.

verses.name: Psalms 79:5
verses.text: How long, O LORD? Will you be angry forever? How long will your jealousy burn like fire?

verses.name: Psalms 79:6
verses.text: Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not acknowledge you, on the kingdoms that do not call on your name;

verses.name: Psalms 79:7
verses.text: for they have devoured Jacob and destroyed his homeland.

verses.name: Psalms 79:8
verses.text: Do not hold against us the sins of the fathers; may your mercy come quickly to meet us, for we are in desperate need.

verses.name: Psalms 79:9
verses.text: Help us, O God our Savior, for the glory of your name; deliver us and forgive our sins for your name's sake.

verses.name: Psalms 79:10
verses.text: Why should the nations say, "Where is their God?" Before our eyes, make known among the nations that you avenge the outpoured blood of your servants.

verses.name: Psalms 79:11
verses.text: May the groans of the prisoners come before you; by the strength of your arm preserve those condemned to die.

verses.name: Psalms 79:12
verses.text: Pay back into the laps of our neighbors seven times the reproach they have hurled at you, O Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 79:13
verses.text: Then we your people, the sheep of your pasture, will praise you forever; from generation to generation we will recount your praise.

verses.name: Psalms 80:1
verses.text: Hear us, O Shepherd of Israel, you who lead Joseph like a flock; you who sit enthroned between the cherubim, shine forth

verses.name: Psalms 80:2
verses.text: before Ephraim, Benjamin and Manasseh. Awaken your might; come and save us.

verses.name: Psalms 80:3
verses.text: Restore us, O God; make your face shine upon us, that we may be saved.

verses.name: Psalms 80:4
verses.text: O LORD God Almighty, how long will your anger smolder against the prayers of your people?

verses.name: Psalms 80:5
verses.text: You have fed them with the bread of tears; you have made them drink tears by the bowlful.

verses.name: Psalms 80:6
verses.text: You have made us a source of contention to our neighbors, and our enemies mock us.

verses.name: Psalms 80:7
verses.text: Restore us, O God Almighty; make your face shine upon us, that we may be saved.

verses.name: Psalms 80:8
verses.text: You brought a vine out of Egypt; you drove out the nations and planted it.

verses.name: Psalms 80:9
verses.text: You cleared the ground for it, and it took root and filled the land.

verses.name: Psalms 80:10
verses.text: The mountains were covered with its shade, the mighty cedars with its branches.

verses.name: Psalms 80:11
verses.text: It sent out its boughs to the Sea, its shoots as far as the River.

verses.name: Psalms 80:12
verses.text: Why have you broken down its walls so that all who pass by pick its grapes?

verses.name: Psalms 80:13
verses.text: Boars from the forest ravage it and the creatures of the field feed on it.

verses.name: Psalms 80:14
verses.text: Return to us, O God Almighty! Look down from heaven and see! Watch over this vine,

verses.name: Psalms 80:15
verses.text: the root your right hand has planted, the son you have raised up for yourself.

verses.name: Psalms 80:16
verses.text: Your vine is cut down, it is burned with fire; at your rebuke your people perish.

verses.name: Psalms 80:17
verses.text: Let your hand rest on the man at your right hand, the son of man you have raised up for yourself.

verses.name: Psalms 80:18
verses.text: Then we will not turn away from you; revive us, and we will call on your name.

verses.name: Psalms 80:19
verses.text: Restore us, O LORD God Almighty; make your face shine upon us, that we may be saved.

verses.name: Psalms 81:1
verses.text: Sing for joy to God our strength; shout aloud to the God of Jacob!

verses.name: Psalms 81:2
verses.text: Begin the music, strike the tambourine, play the melodious harp and lyre.

verses.name: Psalms 81:3
verses.text: Sound the ram's horn at the New Moon, and when the moon is full, on the day of our Feast;

verses.name: Psalms 81:4
verses.text: this is a decree for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 81:5
verses.text: He established it as a statute for Joseph when he went out against Egypt, where we heard a language we did not understand.

verses.name: Psalms 81:6
verses.text: He says, "I removed the burden from their shoulders; their hands were set free from the basket.

verses.name: Psalms 81:7
verses.text: In your distress you called and I rescued you, I answered you out of a thundercloud; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 81:8
verses.text: "Hear, O my people, and I will warn you- if you would but listen to me, O Israel!

verses.name: Psalms 81:9
verses.text: You shall have no foreign god among you; you shall not bow down to an alien god.

verses.name: Psalms 81:10
verses.text: I am the LORD your God, who brought you up out of Egypt. Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.

verses.name: Psalms 81:11
verses.text: "But my people would not listen to me; Israel would not submit to me.

verses.name: Psalms 81:12
verses.text: So I gave them over to their stubborn hearts to follow their own devices.

verses.name: Psalms 81:13
verses.text: "If my people would but listen to me, if Israel would follow my ways,

verses.name: Psalms 81:14
verses.text: how quickly would I subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their foes!

verses.name: Psalms 81:15
verses.text: Those who hate the LORD would cringe before him, and their punishment would last forever.

verses.name: Psalms 81:16
verses.text: But you would be fed with the finest of wheat; with honey from the rock I would satisfy you."

verses.name: Psalms 82:1
verses.text: God presides in the great assembly; he gives judgment among the "gods":

verses.name: Psalms 82:2
verses.text: "How long will you defend the unjust and show partiality to the wicked? Selah

verses.name: Psalms 82:3
verses.text: Defend the cause of the weak and fatherless; maintain the rights of the poor and oppressed.

verses.name: Psalms 82:4
verses.text: Rescue the weak and needy; deliver them from the hand of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 82:5
verses.text: "They know nothing, they understand nothing. They walk about in darkness; all the foundations of the earth are shaken.

verses.name: Psalms 82:6
verses.text: "I said, 'You are "gods"; you are all sons of the Most High.'

verses.name: Psalms 82:7
verses.text: But you will die like mere men; you will fall like every other ruler."

verses.name: Psalms 82:8
verses.text: Rise up, O God, judge the earth, for all the nations are your inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 83:1
verses.text: O God, do not keep silent; be not quiet, O God, be not still.

verses.name: Psalms 83:2
verses.text: See how your enemies are astir, how your foes rear their heads.

verses.name: Psalms 83:3
verses.text: With cunning they conspire against your people; they plot against those you cherish.

verses.name: Psalms 83:4
verses.text: "Come," they say, "let us destroy them as a nation, that the name of Israel be remembered no more."

verses.name: Psalms 83:5
verses.text: With one mind they plot together; they form an alliance against you-

verses.name: Psalms 83:6
verses.text: the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, of Moab and the Hagrites,

verses.name: Psalms 83:7
verses.text: Gebal, Ammon and Amalek, Philistia, with the people of Tyre.

verses.name: Psalms 83:8
verses.text: Even Assyria has joined them to lend strength to the descendants of Lot. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 83:9
verses.text: Do to them as you did to Midian, as you did to Sisera and Jabin at the river Kishon,

verses.name: Psalms 83:10
verses.text: who perished at Endor and became like refuse on the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 83:11
verses.text: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

verses.name: Psalms 83:12
verses.text: who said, "Let us take possession of the pasturelands of God."

verses.name: Psalms 83:13
verses.text: Make them like tumbleweed, O my God, like chaff before the wind.

verses.name: Psalms 83:14
verses.text: As fire consumes the forest or a flame sets the mountains ablaze,

verses.name: Psalms 83:15
verses.text: so pursue them with your tempest and terrify them with your storm.

verses.name: Psalms 83:16
verses.text: Cover their faces with shame so that men will seek your name, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 83:17
verses.text: May they ever be ashamed and dismayed; may they perish in disgrace.

verses.name: Psalms 83:18
verses.text: Let them know that you, whose name is the LORD - that you alone are the Most High over all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 84:1
verses.text: How lovely is your dwelling place, O LORD Almighty!

verses.name: Psalms 84:2
verses.text: My soul yearns, even faints, for the courts of the LORD; my heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.

verses.name: Psalms 84:3
verses.text: Even the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may have her young- a place near your altar, O LORD Almighty, my King and my God.

verses.name: Psalms 84:4
verses.text: Blessed are those who dwell in your house; they are ever praising you. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 84:5
verses.text: Blessed are those whose strength is in you, who have set their hearts on pilgrimage.

verses.name: Psalms 84:6
verses.text: As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they make it a place of springs; the autumn rains also cover it with pools.

verses.name: Psalms 84:7
verses.text: They go from strength to strength, till each appears before God in Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 84:8
verses.text: Hear my prayer, O LORD God Almighty; listen to me, O God of Jacob. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 84:9
verses.text: Look upon our shield, O God; look with favor on your anointed one.

verses.name: Psalms 84:10
verses.text: Better is one day in your courts than a thousand elsewhere; I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God than dwell in the tents of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 84:11
verses.text: For the LORD God is a sun and shield; the LORD bestows favor and honor; no good thing does he withhold from those whose walk is blameless.

verses.name: Psalms 84:12
verses.text: O LORD Almighty, blessed is the man who trusts in you.

verses.name: Psalms 85:1
verses.text: You showed favor to your land, O LORD; you restored the fortunes of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 85:2
verses.text: You forgave the iniquity of your people and covered all their sins. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 85:3
verses.text: You set aside all your wrath and turned from your fierce anger.

verses.name: Psalms 85:4
verses.text: Restore us again, O God our Savior, and put away your displeasure toward us.

verses.name: Psalms 85:5
verses.text: Will you be angry with us forever? Will you prolong your anger through all generations?

verses.name: Psalms 85:6
verses.text: Will you not revive us again, that your people may rejoice in you?

verses.name: Psalms 85:7
verses.text: Show us your unfailing love, O LORD, and grant us your salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 85:8
verses.text: I will listen to what God the LORD will say; he promises peace to his people, his saints- but let them not return to folly.

verses.name: Psalms 85:9
verses.text: Surely his salvation is near those who fear him, that his glory may dwell in our land.

verses.name: Psalms 85:10
verses.text: Love and faithfulness meet together; righteousness and peace kiss each other.

verses.name: Psalms 85:11
verses.text: Faithfulness springs forth from the earth, and righteousness looks down from heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 85:12
verses.text: The LORD will indeed give what is good, and our land will yield its harvest.

verses.name: Psalms 85:13
verses.text: Righteousness goes before him and prepares the way for his steps.

verses.name: Psalms 86:1
verses.text: Hear, O LORD, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.

verses.name: Psalms 86:2
verses.text: Guard my life, for I am devoted to you. You are my God; save your servant who trusts in you.

verses.name: Psalms 86:3
verses.text: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I call to you all day long.

verses.name: Psalms 86:4
verses.text: Bring joy to your servant, for to you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 86:5
verses.text: You are forgiving and good, O Lord, abounding in love to all who call to you.

verses.name: Psalms 86:6
verses.text: Hear my prayer, O LORD; listen to my cry for mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 86:7
verses.text: In the day of my trouble I will call to you, for you will answer me.

verses.name: Psalms 86:8
verses.text: Among the gods there is none like you, O Lord; no deeds can compare with yours.

verses.name: Psalms 86:9
verses.text: All the nations you have made will come and worship before you, O Lord; they will bring glory to your name.

verses.name: Psalms 86:10
verses.text: For you are great and do marvelous deeds; you alone are God.

verses.name: Psalms 86:11
verses.text: Teach me your way, O LORD, and I will walk in your truth; give me an undivided heart, that I may fear your name.

verses.name: Psalms 86:12
verses.text: I will praise you, O Lord my God, with all my heart; I will glorify your name forever.

verses.name: Psalms 86:13
verses.text: For great is your love toward me; you have delivered me from the depths of the grave.

verses.name: Psalms 86:14
verses.text: The arrogant are attacking me, O God; a band of ruthless men seeks my life- men without regard for you.

verses.name: Psalms 86:15
verses.text: But you, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger, abounding in love and faithfulness.

verses.name: Psalms 86:16
verses.text: Turn to me and have mercy on me; grant your strength to your servant and save the son of your maidservant.

verses.name: Psalms 86:17
verses.text: Give me a sign of your goodness, that my enemies may see it and be put to shame, for you, O LORD, have helped me and comforted me.

verses.name: Psalms 87:1
verses.text: He has set his foundation on the holy mountain;

verses.name: Psalms 87:2
verses.text: the LORD loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

verses.name: Psalms 87:3
verses.text: Glorious things are said of you, O city of God: Selah

verses.name: Psalms 87:4
verses.text: "I will record Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge me- Philistia too, and Tyre, along with Cush - and will say, 'This one was born in Zion.'"

verses.name: Psalms 87:5
verses.text: Indeed, of Zion it will be said, "This one and that one were born in her, and the Most High himself will establish her."

verses.name: Psalms 87:6
verses.text: The LORD will write in the register of the peoples: "This one was born in Zion." Selah

verses.name: Psalms 87:7
verses.text: As they make music they will sing, "All my fountains are in you."

verses.name: Psalms 88:1
verses.text: O LORD, the God who saves me, day and night I cry out before you.

verses.name: Psalms 88:2
verses.text: May my prayer come before you; turn your ear to my cry.

verses.name: Psalms 88:3
verses.text: For my soul is full of trouble and my life draws near the grave.

verses.name: Psalms 88:4
verses.text: I am counted among those who go down to the pit; I am like a man without strength.

verses.name: Psalms 88:5
verses.text: I am set apart with the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave, whom you remember no more, who are cut off from your care.

verses.name: Psalms 88:6
verses.text: You have put me in the lowest pit, in the darkest depths.

verses.name: Psalms 88:7
verses.text: Your wrath lies heavily upon me; you have overwhelmed me with all your waves. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 88:8
verses.text: You have taken from me my closest friends and have made me repulsive to them. I am confined and cannot escape;

verses.name: Psalms 88:9
verses.text: my eyes are dim with grief. I call to you, O LORD, every day; I spread out my hands to you.

verses.name: Psalms 88:10
verses.text: Do you show your wonders to the dead? Do those who are dead rise up and praise you? Selah

verses.name: Psalms 88:11
verses.text: Is your love declared in the grave, your faithfulness in Destruction?

verses.name: Psalms 88:12
verses.text: Are your wonders known in the place of darkness, or your righteous deeds in the land of oblivion?

verses.name: Psalms 88:13
verses.text: But I cry to you for help, O LORD; in the morning my prayer comes before you.

verses.name: Psalms 88:14
verses.text: Why, O LORD, do you reject me and hide your face from me?

verses.name: Psalms 88:15
verses.text: From my youth I have been afflicted and close to death; I have suffered your terrors and am in despair.

verses.name: Psalms 88:16
verses.text: Your wrath has swept over me; your terrors have destroyed me.

verses.name: Psalms 88:17
verses.text: All day long they surround me like a flood; they have completely engulfed me.

verses.name: Psalms 88:18
verses.text: You have taken my companions and loved ones from me; the darkness is my closest friend.

verses.name: Psalms 89:1
verses.text: I will sing of the LORD's great love forever; with my mouth I will make your faithfulness known through all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 89:2
verses.text: I will declare that your love stands firm forever, that you established your faithfulness in heaven itself.

verses.name: Psalms 89:3
verses.text: You said, "I have made a covenant with my chosen one, I have sworn to David my servant,

verses.name: Psalms 89:4
verses.text: 'I will establish your line forever and make your throne firm through all generations.'" Selah

verses.name: Psalms 89:5
verses.text: The heavens praise your wonders, O LORD, your faithfulness too, in the assembly of the holy ones.

verses.name: Psalms 89:6
verses.text: For who in the skies above can compare with the LORD? Who is like the LORD among the heavenly beings?

verses.name: Psalms 89:7
verses.text: In the council of the holy ones God is greatly feared; he is more awesome than all who surround him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:8
verses.text: O LORD God Almighty, who is like you? You are mighty, O LORD, and your faithfulness surrounds you.

verses.name: Psalms 89:9
verses.text: You rule over the surging sea; when its waves mount up, you still them.

verses.name: Psalms 89:10
verses.text: You crushed Rahab like one of the slain; with your strong arm you scattered your enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 89:11
verses.text: The heavens are yours, and yours also the earth; you founded the world and all that is in it.

verses.name: Psalms 89:12
verses.text: You created the north and the south; Tabor and Hermon sing for joy at your name.

verses.name: Psalms 89:13
verses.text: Your arm is endued with power; your hand is strong, your right hand exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 89:14
verses.text: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; love and faithfulness go before you.

verses.name: Psalms 89:15
verses.text: Blessed are those who have learned to acclaim you, who walk in the light of your presence, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 89:16
verses.text: They rejoice in your name all day long; they exult in your righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 89:17
verses.text: For you are their glory and strength, and by your favor you exalt our horn.

verses.name: Psalms 89:18
verses.text: Indeed, our shield belongs to the LORD, our king to the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 89:19
verses.text: Once you spoke in a vision, to your faithful people you said: "I have bestowed strength on a warrior; I have exalted a young man from among the people.

verses.name: Psalms 89:20
verses.text: I have found David my servant; with my sacred oil I have anointed him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:21
verses.text: My hand will sustain him; surely my arm will strengthen him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:22
verses.text: No enemy will subject him to tribute; no wicked man will oppress him.

verses.name: Psalms 89:23
verses.text: I will crush his foes before him and strike down his adversaries.

verses.name: Psalms 89:24
verses.text: My faithful love will be with him, and through my name his horn will be exalted.

verses.name: Psalms 89:25
verses.text: I will set his hand over the sea, his right hand over the rivers.

verses.name: Psalms 89:26
verses.text: He will call out to me, 'You are my Father, my God, the Rock my Savior.'

verses.name: Psalms 89:27
verses.text: I will also appoint him my firstborn, the most exalted of the kings of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 89:28
verses.text: I will maintain my love to him forever, and my covenant with him will never fail.

verses.name: Psalms 89:29
verses.text: I will establish his line forever, his throne as long as the heavens endure.

verses.name: Psalms 89:30
verses.text: "If his sons forsake my law and do not follow my statutes,

verses.name: Psalms 89:31
verses.text: if they violate my decrees and fail to keep my commands,

verses.name: Psalms 89:32
verses.text: I will punish their sin with the rod, their iniquity with flogging;

verses.name: Psalms 89:33
verses.text: but I will not take my love from him, nor will I ever betray my faithfulness.

verses.name: Psalms 89:34
verses.text: I will not violate my covenant or alter what my lips have uttered.

verses.name: Psalms 89:35
verses.text: Once for all, I have sworn by my holiness- and I will not lie to David-

verses.name: Psalms 89:36
verses.text: that his line will continue forever and his throne endure before me like the sun;

verses.name: Psalms 89:37
verses.text: it will be established forever like the moon, the faithful witness in the sky." Selah

verses.name: Psalms 89:38
verses.text: But you have rejected, you have spurned, you have been very angry with your anointed one.

verses.name: Psalms 89:39
verses.text: You have renounced the covenant with your servant and have defiled his crown in the dust.

verses.name: Psalms 89:40
verses.text: You have broken through all his walls and reduced his strongholds to ruins.

verses.name: Psalms 89:41
verses.text: All who pass by have plundered him; he has become the scorn of his neighbors.

verses.name: Psalms 89:42
verses.text: You have exalted the right hand of his foes; you have made all his enemies rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 89:43
verses.text: You have turned back the edge of his sword and have not supported him in battle.

verses.name: Psalms 89:44
verses.text: You have put an end to his splendor and cast his throne to the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 89:45
verses.text: You have cut short the days of his youth; you have covered him with a mantle of shame. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 89:46
verses.text: How long, O LORD? Will you hide yourself forever? How long will your wrath burn like fire?

verses.name: Psalms 89:47
verses.text: Remember how fleeting is my life. For what futility you have created all men!

verses.name: Psalms 89:48
verses.text: What man can live and not see death, or save himself from the power of the grave? Selah

verses.name: Psalms 89:49
verses.text: O Lord, where is your former great love, which in your faithfulness you swore to David?

verses.name: Psalms 89:50
verses.text: Remember, Lord, how your servant has been mocked, how I bear in my heart the taunts of all the nations,

verses.name: Psalms 89:51
verses.text: the taunts with which your enemies have mocked, O LORD, with which they have mocked every step of your anointed one.

verses.name: Psalms 89:52
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD forever! Amen and Amen. BOOK IV Psalms 90-106

verses.name: Psalms 90:1
verses.text: Lord, you have been our dwelling place throughout all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 90:2
verses.text: Before the mountains were born or you brought forth the earth and the world, from everlasting to everlasting you are God.

verses.name: Psalms 90:3
verses.text: You turn men back to dust, saying, "Return to dust, O sons of men."

verses.name: Psalms 90:4
verses.text: For a thousand years in your sight are like a day that has just gone by, or like a watch in the night.

verses.name: Psalms 90:5
verses.text: You sweep men away in the sleep of death; they are like the new grass of the morning-

verses.name: Psalms 90:6
verses.text: though in the morning it springs up new, by evening it is dry and withered.

verses.name: Psalms 90:7
verses.text: We are consumed by your anger and terrified by your indignation.

verses.name: Psalms 90:8
verses.text: You have set our iniquities before you, our secret sins in the light of your presence.

verses.name: Psalms 90:9
verses.text: All our days pass away under your wrath; we finish our years with a moan.

verses.name: Psalms 90:10
verses.text: The length of our days is seventy years- or eighty, if we have the strength; yet their span is but trouble and sorrow, for they quickly pass, and we fly away.

verses.name: Psalms 90:11
verses.text: Who knows the power of your anger? For your wrath is as great as the fear that is due you.

verses.name: Psalms 90:12
verses.text: Teach us to number our days aright, that we may gain a heart of wisdom.

verses.name: Psalms 90:13
verses.text: Relent, O LORD! How long will it be? Have compassion on your servants.

verses.name: Psalms 90:14
verses.text: Satisfy us in the morning with your unfailing love, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.

verses.name: Psalms 90:15
verses.text: Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 90:16
verses.text: May your deeds be shown to your servants, your splendor to their children.

verses.name: Psalms 90:17
verses.text: May the favor of the Lord our God rest upon us; establish the work of our hands for us- yes, establish the work of our hands.

verses.name: Psalms 91:1
verses.text: He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.

verses.name: Psalms 91:2
verses.text: I will say of the LORD, "He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust."

verses.name: Psalms 91:3
verses.text: Surely he will save you from the fowler's snare and from the deadly pestilence.

verses.name: Psalms 91:4
verses.text: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.

verses.name: Psalms 91:5
verses.text: You will not fear the terror of night, nor the arrow that flies by day,

verses.name: Psalms 91:6
verses.text: nor the pestilence that stalks in the darkness, nor the plague that destroys at midday.

verses.name: Psalms 91:7
verses.text: A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.

verses.name: Psalms 91:8
verses.text: You will only observe with your eyes and see the punishment of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 91:9
verses.text: If you make the Most High your dwelling- even the LORD, who is my refuge-

verses.name: Psalms 91:10
verses.text: then no harm will befall you, no disaster will come near your tent.

verses.name: Psalms 91:11
verses.text: For he will command his angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways;

verses.name: Psalms 91:12
verses.text: they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.

verses.name: Psalms 91:13
verses.text: You will tread upon the lion and the cobra; you will trample the great lion and the serpent.

verses.name: Psalms 91:14
verses.text: "Because he loves me," says the LORD, "I will rescue him; I will protect him, for he acknowledges my name.

verses.name: Psalms 91:15
verses.text: He will call upon me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.

verses.name: Psalms 91:16
verses.text: With long life will I satisfy him and show him my salvation."

verses.name: Psalms 92:1
verses.text: It is good to praise the LORD and make music to your name, O Most High,

verses.name: Psalms 92:2
verses.text: to proclaim your love in the morning and your faithfulness at night,

verses.name: Psalms 92:3
verses.text: to the music of the ten-stringed lyre and the melody of the harp.

verses.name: Psalms 92:4
verses.text: For you make me glad by your deeds, O LORD; I sing for joy at the works of your hands.

verses.name: Psalms 92:5
verses.text: How great are your works, O LORD, how profound your thoughts!

verses.name: Psalms 92:6
verses.text: The senseless man does not know, fools do not understand,

verses.name: Psalms 92:7
verses.text: that though the wicked spring up like grass and all evildoers flourish, they will be forever destroyed.

verses.name: Psalms 92:8
verses.text: But you, O LORD, are exalted forever.

verses.name: Psalms 92:9
verses.text: For surely your enemies, O LORD, surely your enemies will perish; all evildoers will be scattered.

verses.name: Psalms 92:10
verses.text: You have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox; fine oils have been poured upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 92:11
verses.text: My eyes have seen the defeat of my adversaries; my ears have heard the rout of my wicked foes.

verses.name: Psalms 92:12
verses.text: The righteous will flourish like a palm tree, they will grow like a cedar of Lebanon;

verses.name: Psalms 92:13
verses.text: planted in the house of the LORD, they will flourish in the courts of our God.

verses.name: Psalms 92:14
verses.text: They will still bear fruit in old age, they will stay fresh and green,

verses.name: Psalms 92:15
verses.text: proclaiming, "The LORD is upright; he is my Rock, and there is no wickedness in him."

verses.name: Psalms 93:1
verses.text: The LORD reigns, he is robed in majesty; the LORD is robed in majesty and is armed with strength. The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 93:2
verses.text: Your throne was established long ago; you are from all eternity.

verses.name: Psalms 93:3
verses.text: The seas have lifted up, O LORD, the seas have lifted up their voice; the seas have lifted up their pounding waves.

verses.name: Psalms 93:4
verses.text: Mightier than the thunder of the great waters, mightier than the breakers of the sea- the LORD on high is mighty.

verses.name: Psalms 93:5
verses.text: Your statutes stand firm; holiness adorns your house for endless days, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 94:1
verses.text: O LORD, the God who avenges, O God who avenges, shine forth.

verses.name: Psalms 94:2
verses.text: Rise up, O Judge of the earth; pay back to the proud what they deserve.

verses.name: Psalms 94:3
verses.text: How long will the wicked, O LORD, how long will the wicked be jubilant?

verses.name: Psalms 94:4
verses.text: They pour out arrogant words; all the evildoers are full of boasting.

verses.name: Psalms 94:5
verses.text: They crush your people, O LORD; they oppress your inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 94:6
verses.text: They slay the widow and the alien; they murder the fatherless.

verses.name: Psalms 94:7
verses.text: They say, "The LORD does not see; the God of Jacob pays no heed."

verses.name: Psalms 94:8
verses.text: Take heed, you senseless ones among the people; you fools, when will you become wise?

verses.name: Psalms 94:9
verses.text: Does he who implanted the ear not hear? Does he who formed the eye not see?

verses.name: Psalms 94:10
verses.text: Does he who disciplines nations not punish? Does he who teaches man lack knowledge?

verses.name: Psalms 94:11
verses.text: The LORD knows the thoughts of man; he knows that they are futile.

verses.name: Psalms 94:12
verses.text: Blessed is the man you discipline, O LORD, the man you teach from your law;

verses.name: Psalms 94:13
verses.text: you grant him relief from days of trouble, till a pit is dug for the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 94:14
verses.text: For the LORD will not reject his people; he will never forsake his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 94:15
verses.text: Judgment will again be founded on righteousness, and all the upright in heart will follow it.

verses.name: Psalms 94:16
verses.text: Who will rise up for me against the wicked? Who will take a stand for me against evildoers?

verses.name: Psalms 94:17
verses.text: Unless the LORD had given me help, I would soon have dwelt in the silence of death.

verses.name: Psalms 94:18
verses.text: When I said, "My foot is slipping," your love, O LORD, supported me.

verses.name: Psalms 94:19
verses.text: When anxiety was great within me, your consolation brought joy to my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 94:20
verses.text: Can a corrupt throne be allied with you- one that brings on misery by its decrees?

verses.name: Psalms 94:21
verses.text: They band together against the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.

verses.name: Psalms 94:22
verses.text: But the LORD has become my fortress, and my God the rock in whom I take refuge.

verses.name: Psalms 94:23
verses.text: He will repay them for their sins and destroy them for their wickedness; the LORD our God will destroy them.

verses.name: Psalms 95:1
verses.text: Come, let us sing for joy to the LORD; let us shout aloud to the Rock of our salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 95:2
verses.text: Let us come before him with thanksgiving and extol him with music and song.

verses.name: Psalms 95:3
verses.text: For the LORD is the great God, the great King above all gods.

verses.name: Psalms 95:4
verses.text: In his hand are the depths of the earth, and the mountain peaks belong to him.

verses.name: Psalms 95:5
verses.text: The sea is his, for he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.

verses.name: Psalms 95:6
verses.text: Come, let us bow down in worship, let us kneel before the LORD our Maker;

verses.name: Psalms 95:7
verses.text: for he is our God and we are the people of his pasture, the flock under his care. Today, if you hear his voice,

verses.name: Psalms 95:8
verses.text: do not harden your hearts as you did at Meribah, as you did that day at Massah in the desert,

verses.name: Psalms 95:9
verses.text: where your fathers tested and tried me, though they had seen what I did.

verses.name: Psalms 95:10
verses.text: For forty years I was angry with that generation; I said, "They are a people whose hearts go astray, and they have not known my ways."

verses.name: Psalms 95:11
verses.text: So I declared on oath in my anger, "They shall never enter my rest."

verses.name: Psalms 96:1
verses.text: Sing to the LORD a new song; sing to the LORD, all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 96:2
verses.text: Sing to the LORD, praise his name; proclaim his salvation day after day.

verses.name: Psalms 96:3
verses.text: Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.

verses.name: Psalms 96:4
verses.text: For great is the LORD and most worthy of praise; he is to be feared above all gods.

verses.name: Psalms 96:5
verses.text: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 96:6
verses.text: Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and glory are in his sanctuary.

verses.name: Psalms 96:7
verses.text: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of nations, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

verses.name: Psalms 96:8
verses.text: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name; bring an offering and come into his courts.

verses.name: Psalms 96:9
verses.text: Worship the LORD in the splendor of his holiness; tremble before him, all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 96:10
verses.text: Say among the nations, "The LORD reigns." The world is firmly established, it cannot be moved; he will judge the peoples with equity.

verses.name: Psalms 96:11
verses.text: Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad; let the sea resound, and all that is in it;

verses.name: Psalms 96:12
verses.text: let the fields be jubilant, and everything in them. Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy;

verses.name: Psalms 96:13
verses.text: they will sing before the LORD, for he comes, he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world in righteousness and the peoples in his truth.

verses.name: Psalms 97:1
verses.text: The LORD reigns, let the earth be glad; let the distant shores rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 97:2
verses.text: Clouds and thick darkness surround him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

verses.name: Psalms 97:3
verses.text: Fire goes before him and consumes his foes on every side.

verses.name: Psalms 97:4
verses.text: His lightning lights up the world; the earth sees and trembles.

verses.name: Psalms 97:5
verses.text: The mountains melt like wax before the LORD, before the Lord of all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 97:6
verses.text: The heavens proclaim his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.

verses.name: Psalms 97:7
verses.text: All who worship images are put to shame, those who boast in idols- worship him, all you gods!

verses.name: Psalms 97:8
verses.text: Zion hears and rejoices and the villages of Judah are glad because of your judgments, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 97:9
verses.text: For you, O LORD, are the Most High over all the earth; you are exalted far above all gods.

verses.name: Psalms 97:10
verses.text: Let those who love the LORD hate evil, for he guards the lives of his faithful ones and delivers them from the hand of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 97:11
verses.text: Light is shed upon the righteous and joy on the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 97:12
verses.text: Rejoice in the LORD, you who are righteous, and praise his holy name.

verses.name: Psalms 98:1
verses.text: Sing to the LORD a new song, for he has done marvelous things; his right hand and his holy arm have worked salvation for him.

verses.name: Psalms 98:2
verses.text: The LORD has made his salvation known and revealed his righteousness to the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 98:3
verses.text: He has remembered his love and his faithfulness to the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

verses.name: Psalms 98:4
verses.text: Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth, burst into jubilant song with music;

verses.name: Psalms 98:5
verses.text: make music to the LORD with the harp, with the harp and the sound of singing,

verses.name: Psalms 98:6
verses.text: with trumpets and the blast of the ram's horn- shout for joy before the LORD, the King.

verses.name: Psalms 98:7
verses.text: Let the sea resound, and everything in it, the world, and all who live in it.

verses.name: Psalms 98:8
verses.text: Let the rivers clap their hands, Let the mountains sing together for joy;

verses.name: Psalms 98:9
verses.text: let them sing before the LORD, for he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world in righteousness and the peoples with equity.

verses.name: Psalms 99:1
verses.text: The LORD reigns, let the nations tremble; he sits enthroned between the cherubim, let the earth shake.

verses.name: Psalms 99:2
verses.text: Great is the LORD in Zion; he is exalted over all the nations.

verses.name: Psalms 99:3
verses.text: Let them praise your great and awesome name- he is holy.

verses.name: Psalms 99:4
verses.text: The King is mighty, he loves justice- you have established equity; in Jacob you have done what is just and right.

verses.name: Psalms 99:5
verses.text: Exalt the LORD our God and worship at his footstool; he is holy.

verses.name: Psalms 99:6
verses.text: Moses and Aaron were among his priests, Samuel was among those who called on his name; they called on the LORD and he answered them.

verses.name: Psalms 99:7
verses.text: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud; they kept his statutes and the decrees he gave them.

verses.name: Psalms 99:8
verses.text: O LORD our God, you answered them; you were to Israel a forgiving God, though you punished their misdeeds.

verses.name: Psalms 99:9
verses.text: Exalt the LORD our God and worship at his holy mountain, for the LORD our God is holy.

verses.name: Psalms 100:1
verses.text: Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 100:2
verses.text: Worship the LORD with gladness; come before him with joyful songs.

verses.name: Psalms 100:3
verses.text: Know that the LORD is God. It is he who made us, and we are his; we are his people, the sheep of his pasture.

verses.name: Psalms 100:4
verses.text: Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise; give thanks to him and praise his name.

verses.name: Psalms 100:5
verses.text: For the LORD is good and his love endures forever; his faithfulness continues through all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 101:1
verses.text: I will sing of your love and justice; to you, O LORD, I will sing praise.

verses.name: Psalms 101:2
verses.text: I will be careful to lead a blameless life- when will you come to me? I will walk in my house with blameless heart.

verses.name: Psalms 101:3
verses.text: I will set before my eyes no vile thing. The deeds of faithless men I hate; they will not cling to me.

verses.name: Psalms 101:4
verses.text: Men of perverse heart shall be far from me; I will have nothing to do with evil.

verses.name: Psalms 101:5
verses.text: Whoever slanders his neighbor in secret, him will I put to silence; whoever has haughty eyes and a proud heart, him will I not endure.

verses.name: Psalms 101:6
verses.text: My eyes will be on the faithful in the land, that they may dwell with me; he whose walk is blameless will minister to me.

verses.name: Psalms 101:7
verses.text: No one who practices deceit will dwell in my house; no one who speaks falsely will stand in my presence.

verses.name: Psalms 101:8
verses.text: Every morning I will put to silence all the wicked in the land; I will cut off every evildoer from the city of the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 102:1
verses.text: Hear my prayer, O LORD; let my cry for help come to you.

verses.name: Psalms 102:2
verses.text: Do not hide your face from me when I am in distress. Turn your ear to me; when I call, answer me quickly.

verses.name: Psalms 102:3
verses.text: For my days vanish like smoke; my bones burn like glowing embers.

verses.name: Psalms 102:4
verses.text: My heart is blighted and withered like grass; I forget to eat my food.

verses.name: Psalms 102:5
verses.text: Because of my loud groaning I am reduced to skin and bones.

verses.name: Psalms 102:6
verses.text: I am like a desert owl, like an owl among the ruins.

verses.name: Psalms 102:7
verses.text: I lie awake; I have become like a bird alone on a roof.

verses.name: Psalms 102:8
verses.text: All day long my enemies taunt me; those who rail against me use my name as a curse.

verses.name: Psalms 102:9
verses.text: For I eat ashes as my food and mingle my drink with tears

verses.name: Psalms 102:10
verses.text: because of your great wrath, for you have taken me up and thrown me aside.

verses.name: Psalms 102:11
verses.text: My days are like the evening shadow; I wither away like grass.

verses.name: Psalms 102:12
verses.text: But you, O LORD, sit enthroned forever; your renown endures through all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 102:13
verses.text: You will arise and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to show favor to her; the appointed time has come.

verses.name: Psalms 102:14
verses.text: For her stones are dear to your servants; her very dust moves them to pity.

verses.name: Psalms 102:15
verses.text: The nations will fear the name of the LORD, all the kings of the earth will revere your glory.

verses.name: Psalms 102:16
verses.text: For the LORD will rebuild Zion and appear in his glory.

verses.name: Psalms 102:17
verses.text: He will respond to the prayer of the destitute; he will not despise their plea.

verses.name: Psalms 102:18
verses.text: Let this be written for a future generation, that a people not yet created may praise the LORD:

verses.name: Psalms 102:19
verses.text: "The LORD looked down from his sanctuary on high, from heaven he viewed the earth,

verses.name: Psalms 102:20
verses.text: to hear the groans of the prisoners and release those condemned to death."

verses.name: Psalms 102:21
verses.text: So the name of the LORD will be declared in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem

verses.name: Psalms 102:22
verses.text: when the peoples and the kingdoms assemble to worship the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 102:23
verses.text: In the course of my life he broke my strength; he cut short my days.

verses.name: Psalms 102:24
verses.text: So I said: "Do not take me away, O my God, in the midst of my days; your years go on through all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 102:25
verses.text: In the beginning you laid the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.

verses.name: Psalms 102:26
verses.text: They will perish, but you remain; they will all wear out like a garment. Like clothing you will change them and they will be discarded.

verses.name: Psalms 102:27
verses.text: But you remain the same, and your years will never end.

verses.name: Psalms 102:28
verses.text: The children of your servants will live in your presence; their descendants will be established before you."

verses.name: Psalms 103:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD, O my soul; all my inmost being, praise his holy name.

verses.name: Psalms 103:2
verses.text: Praise the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits-

verses.name: Psalms 103:3
verses.text: who forgives all your sins and heals all your diseases,

verses.name: Psalms 103:4
verses.text: who redeems your life from the pit and crowns you with love and compassion,

verses.name: Psalms 103:5
verses.text: who satisfies your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle's.

verses.name: Psalms 103:6
verses.text: The LORD works righteousness and justice for all the oppressed.

verses.name: Psalms 103:7
verses.text: He made known his ways to Moses, his deeds to the people of Israel:

verses.name: Psalms 103:8
verses.text: The LORD is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in love.

verses.name: Psalms 103:9
verses.text: He will not always accuse, nor will he harbor his anger forever;

verses.name: Psalms 103:10
verses.text: he does not treat us as our sins deserve or repay us according to our iniquities.

verses.name: Psalms 103:11
verses.text: For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is his love for those who fear him;

verses.name: Psalms 103:12
verses.text: as far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.

verses.name: Psalms 103:13
verses.text: As a father has compassion on his children, so the LORD has compassion on those who fear him;

verses.name: Psalms 103:14
verses.text: for he knows how we are formed, he remembers that we are dust.

verses.name: Psalms 103:15
verses.text: As for man, his days are like grass, he flourishes like a flower of the field;

verses.name: Psalms 103:16
verses.text: the wind blows over it and it is gone, and its place remembers it no more.

verses.name: Psalms 103:17
verses.text: But from everlasting to everlasting the LORD's love is with those who fear him, and his righteousness with their children's children-

verses.name: Psalms 103:18
verses.text: with those who keep his covenant and remember to obey his precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 103:19
verses.text: The LORD has established his throne in heaven, and his kingdom rules over all.

verses.name: Psalms 103:20
verses.text: Praise the LORD, you his angels, you mighty ones who do his bidding, who obey his word.

verses.name: Psalms 103:21
verses.text: Praise the LORD, all his heavenly hosts, you his servants who do his will.

verses.name: Psalms 103:22
verses.text: Praise the LORD, all his works everywhere in his dominion. Praise the LORD, O my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 104:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, you are very great; you are clothed with splendor and majesty.

verses.name: Psalms 104:2
verses.text: He wraps himself in light as with a garment; he stretches out the heavens like a tent

verses.name: Psalms 104:3
verses.text: and lays the beams of his upper chambers on their waters. He makes the clouds his chariot and rides on the wings of the wind.

verses.name: Psalms 104:4
verses.text: He makes winds his messengers, flames of fire his servants.

verses.name: Psalms 104:5
verses.text: He set the earth on its foundations; it can never be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 104:6
verses.text: You covered it with the deep as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.

verses.name: Psalms 104:7
verses.text: But at your rebuke the waters fled, at the sound of your thunder they took to flight;

verses.name: Psalms 104:8
verses.text: they flowed over the mountains, they went down into the valleys, to the place you assigned for them.

verses.name: Psalms 104:9
verses.text: You set a boundary they cannot cross; never again will they cover the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 104:10
verses.text: He makes springs pour water into the ravines; it flows between the mountains.

verses.name: Psalms 104:11
verses.text: They give water to all the beasts of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.

verses.name: Psalms 104:12
verses.text: The birds of the air nest by the waters; they sing among the branches.

verses.name: Psalms 104:13
verses.text: He waters the mountains from his upper chambers; the earth is satisfied by the fruit of his work.

verses.name: Psalms 104:14
verses.text: He makes grass grow for the cattle, and plants for man to cultivate- bringing forth food from the earth:

verses.name: Psalms 104:15
verses.text: wine that gladdens the heart of man, oil to make his face shine, and bread that sustains his heart.

verses.name: Psalms 104:16
verses.text: The trees of the LORD are well watered, the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.

verses.name: Psalms 104:17
verses.text: There the birds make their nests; the stork has its home in the pine trees.

verses.name: Psalms 104:18
verses.text: The high mountains belong to the wild goats; the crags are a refuge for the coneys.

verses.name: Psalms 104:19
verses.text: The moon marks off the seasons, and the sun knows when to go down.

verses.name: Psalms 104:20
verses.text: You bring darkness, it becomes night, and all the beasts of the forest prowl.

verses.name: Psalms 104:21
verses.text: The lions roar for their prey and seek their food from God.

verses.name: Psalms 104:22
verses.text: The sun rises, and they steal away; they return and lie down in their dens.

verses.name: Psalms 104:23
verses.text: Then man goes out to his work, to his labor until evening.

verses.name: Psalms 104:24
verses.text: How many are your works, O LORD! In wisdom you made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.

verses.name: Psalms 104:25
verses.text: There is the sea, vast and spacious, teeming with creatures beyond number- living things both large and small.

verses.name: Psalms 104:26
verses.text: There the ships go to and fro, and the leviathan, which you formed to frolic there.

verses.name: Psalms 104:27
verses.text: These all look to you to give them their food at the proper time.

verses.name: Psalms 104:28
verses.text: When you give it to them, they gather it up; when you open your hand, they are satisfied with good things.

verses.name: Psalms 104:29
verses.text: When you hide your face, they are terrified; when you take away their breath, they die and return to the dust.

verses.name: Psalms 104:30
verses.text: When you send your Spirit, they are created, and you renew the face of the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 104:31
verses.text: May the glory of the LORD endure forever; may the LORD rejoice in his works-

verses.name: Psalms 104:32
verses.text: he who looks at the earth, and it trembles, who touches the mountains, and they smoke.

verses.name: Psalms 104:33
verses.text: I will sing to the LORD all my life; I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.

verses.name: Psalms 104:34
verses.text: May my meditation be pleasing to him, as I rejoice in the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 104:35
verses.text: But may sinners vanish from the earth and the wicked be no more. Praise the LORD, O my soul. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 105:1
verses.text: Give thanks to the LORD, call on his name; make known among the nations what he has done.

verses.name: Psalms 105:2
verses.text: Sing to him, sing praise to him; tell of all his wonderful acts.

verses.name: Psalms 105:3
verses.text: Glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 105:4
verses.text: Look to the LORD and his strength; seek his face always.

verses.name: Psalms 105:5
verses.text: Remember the wonders he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,

verses.name: Psalms 105:6
verses.text: O descendants of Abraham his servant, O sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.

verses.name: Psalms 105:7
verses.text: He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 105:8
verses.text: He remembers his covenant forever, the word he commanded, for a thousand generations,

verses.name: Psalms 105:9
verses.text: the covenant he made with Abraham, the oath he swore to Isaac.

verses.name: Psalms 105:10
verses.text: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:

verses.name: Psalms 105:11
verses.text: "To you I will give the land of Canaan as the portion you will inherit."

verses.name: Psalms 105:12
verses.text: When they were but few in number, few indeed, and strangers in it,

verses.name: Psalms 105:13
verses.text: they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.

verses.name: Psalms 105:14
verses.text: He allowed no one to oppress them; for their sake he rebuked kings:

verses.name: Psalms 105:15
verses.text: "Do not touch my anointed ones; do my prophets no harm."

verses.name: Psalms 105:16
verses.text: He called down famine on the land and destroyed all their supplies of food;

verses.name: Psalms 105:17
verses.text: and he sent a man before them- Joseph, sold as a slave.

verses.name: Psalms 105:18
verses.text: They bruised his feet with shackles, his neck was put in irons,

verses.name: Psalms 105:19
verses.text: till what he foretold came to pass, till the word of the LORD proved him true.

verses.name: Psalms 105:20
verses.text: The king sent and released him, the ruler of peoples set him free.

verses.name: Psalms 105:21
verses.text: He made him master of his household, ruler over all he possessed,

verses.name: Psalms 105:22
verses.text: to instruct his princes as he pleased and teach his elders wisdom.

verses.name: Psalms 105:23
verses.text: Then Israel entered Egypt; Jacob lived as an alien in the land of Ham.

verses.name: Psalms 105:24
verses.text: The LORD made his people very fruitful; he made them too numerous for their foes,

verses.name: Psalms 105:25
verses.text: whose hearts he turned to hate his people, to conspire against his servants.

verses.name: Psalms 105:26
verses.text: He sent Moses his servant, and Aaron, whom he had chosen.

verses.name: Psalms 105:27
verses.text: They performed his miraculous signs among them, his wonders in the land of Ham.

verses.name: Psalms 105:28
verses.text: He sent darkness and made the land dark- for had they not rebelled against his words?

verses.name: Psalms 105:29
verses.text: He turned their waters into blood, causing their fish to die.

verses.name: Psalms 105:30
verses.text: Their land teemed with frogs, which went up into the bedrooms of their rulers.

verses.name: Psalms 105:31
verses.text: He spoke, and there came swarms of flies, and gnats throughout their country.

verses.name: Psalms 105:32
verses.text: He turned their rain into hail, with lightning throughout their land;

verses.name: Psalms 105:33
verses.text: he struck down their vines and fig trees and shattered the trees of their country.

verses.name: Psalms 105:34
verses.text: He spoke, and the locusts came, grasshoppers without number;

verses.name: Psalms 105:35
verses.text: they ate up every green thing in their land, ate up the produce of their soil.

verses.name: Psalms 105:36
verses.text: Then he struck down all the firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their manhood.

verses.name: Psalms 105:37
verses.text: He brought out Israel, laden with silver and gold, and from among their tribes no one faltered.

verses.name: Psalms 105:38
verses.text: Egypt was glad when they left, because dread of Israel had fallen on them.

verses.name: Psalms 105:39
verses.text: He spread out a cloud as a covering, and a fire to give light at night.

verses.name: Psalms 105:40
verses.text: They asked, and he brought them quail and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 105:41
verses.text: He opened the rock, and water gushed out; like a river it flowed in the desert.

verses.name: Psalms 105:42
verses.text: For he remembered his holy promise given to his servant Abraham.

verses.name: Psalms 105:43
verses.text: He brought out his people with rejoicing, his chosen ones with shouts of joy;

verses.name: Psalms 105:44
verses.text: he gave them the lands of the nations, and they fell heir to what others had toiled for-

verses.name: Psalms 105:45
verses.text: that they might keep his precepts and observe his laws. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 106:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 106:2
verses.text: Who can proclaim the mighty acts of the LORD or fully declare his praise?

verses.name: Psalms 106:3
verses.text: Blessed are they who maintain justice, who constantly do what is right.

verses.name: Psalms 106:4
verses.text: Remember me, O LORD, when you show favor to your people, come to my aid when you save them,

verses.name: Psalms 106:5
verses.text: that I may enjoy the prosperity of your chosen ones, that I may share in the joy of your nation and join your inheritance in giving praise.

verses.name: Psalms 106:6
verses.text: We have sinned, even as our fathers did; we have done wrong and acted wickedly.

verses.name: Psalms 106:7
verses.text: When our fathers were in Egypt, they gave no thought to your miracles; they did not remember your many kindnesses, and they rebelled by the sea, the Red Sea.

verses.name: Psalms 106:8
verses.text: Yet he saved them for his name's sake, to make his mighty power known.

verses.name: Psalms 106:9
verses.text: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; he led them through the depths as through a desert.

verses.name: Psalms 106:10
verses.text: He saved them from the hand of the foe; from the hand of the enemy he redeemed them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:11
verses.text: The waters covered their adversaries; not one of them survived.

verses.name: Psalms 106:12
verses.text: Then they believed his promises and sang his praise.

verses.name: Psalms 106:13
verses.text: But they soon forgot what he had done and did not wait for his counsel.

verses.name: Psalms 106:14
verses.text: In the desert they gave in to their craving; in the wasteland they put God to the test.

verses.name: Psalms 106:15
verses.text: So he gave them what they asked for, but sent a wasting disease upon them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:16
verses.text: In the camp they grew envious of Moses and of Aaron, who was consecrated to the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 106:17
verses.text: The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan; it buried the company of Abiram.

verses.name: Psalms 106:18
verses.text: Fire blazed among their followers; a flame consumed the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 106:19
verses.text: At Horeb they made a calf and worshiped an idol cast from metal.

verses.name: Psalms 106:20
verses.text: They exchanged their Glory for an image of a bull, which eats grass.

verses.name: Psalms 106:21
verses.text: They forgot the God who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt,

verses.name: Psalms 106:22
verses.text: miracles in the land of Ham and awesome deeds by the Red Sea.

verses.name: Psalms 106:23
verses.text: So he said he would destroy them- had not Moses, his chosen one, stood in the breach before him to keep his wrath from destroying them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:24
verses.text: Then they despised the pleasant land; they did not believe his promise.

verses.name: Psalms 106:25
verses.text: They grumbled in their tents and did not obey the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 106:26
verses.text: So he swore to them with uplifted hand that he would make them fall in the desert,

verses.name: Psalms 106:27
verses.text: make their descendants fall among the nations and scatter them throughout the lands.

verses.name: Psalms 106:28
verses.text: They yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods;

verses.name: Psalms 106:29
verses.text: they provoked the LORD to anger by their wicked deeds, and a plague broke out among them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:30
verses.text: But Phinehas stood up and intervened, and the plague was checked.

verses.name: Psalms 106:31
verses.text: This was credited to him as righteousness for endless generations to come.

verses.name: Psalms 106:32
verses.text: By the waters of Meribah they angered the LORD, and trouble came to Moses because of them;

verses.name: Psalms 106:33
verses.text: for they rebelled against the Spirit of God, and rash words came from Moses' lips.

verses.name: Psalms 106:34
verses.text: They did not destroy the peoples as the LORD had commanded them,

verses.name: Psalms 106:35
verses.text: but they mingled with the nations and adopted their customs.

verses.name: Psalms 106:36
verses.text: They worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:37
verses.text: They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.

verses.name: Psalms 106:38
verses.text: They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and the land was desecrated by their blood.

verses.name: Psalms 106:39
verses.text: They defiled themselves by what they did; by their deeds they prostituted themselves.

verses.name: Psalms 106:40
verses.text: Therefore the LORD was angry with his people and abhorred his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 106:41
verses.text: He handed them over to the nations, and their foes ruled over them.

verses.name: Psalms 106:42
verses.text: Their enemies oppressed them and subjected them to their power.

verses.name: Psalms 106:43
verses.text: Many times he delivered them, but they were bent on rebellion and they wasted away in their sin.

verses.name: Psalms 106:44
verses.text: But he took note of their distress when he heard their cry;

verses.name: Psalms 106:45
verses.text: for their sake he remembered his covenant and out of his great love he relented.

verses.name: Psalms 106:46
verses.text: He caused them to be pitied by all who held them captive.

verses.name: Psalms 106:47
verses.text: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name and glory in your praise.

verses.name: Psalms 106:48
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Let all the people say, "Amen!" Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 107:1
verses.text: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 107:2
verses.text: Let the redeemed of the LORD say this- those he redeemed from the hand of the foe,

verses.name: Psalms 107:3
verses.text: those he gathered from the lands, from east and west, from north and south.

verses.name: Psalms 107:4
verses.text: Some wandered in desert wastelands, finding no way to a city where they could settle.

verses.name: Psalms 107:5
verses.text: They were hungry and thirsty, and their lives ebbed away.

verses.name: Psalms 107:6
verses.text: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress.

verses.name: Psalms 107:7
verses.text: He led them by a straight way to a city where they could settle.

verses.name: Psalms 107:8
verses.text: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for men,

verses.name: Psalms 107:9
verses.text: for he satisfies the thirsty and fills the hungry with good things.

verses.name: Psalms 107:10
verses.text: Some sat in darkness and the deepest gloom, prisoners suffering in iron chains,

verses.name: Psalms 107:11
verses.text: for they had rebelled against the words of God and despised the counsel of the Most High.

verses.name: Psalms 107:12
verses.text: So he subjected them to bitter labor; they stumbled, and there was no one to help.

verses.name: Psalms 107:13
verses.text: Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them from their distress.

verses.name: Psalms 107:14
verses.text: He brought them out of darkness and the deepest gloom and broke away their chains.

verses.name: Psalms 107:15
verses.text: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for men,

verses.name: Psalms 107:16
verses.text: for he breaks down gates of bronze and cuts through bars of iron.

verses.name: Psalms 107:17
verses.text: Some became fools through their rebellious ways and suffered affliction because of their iniquities.

verses.name: Psalms 107:18
verses.text: They loathed all food and drew near the gates of death.

verses.name: Psalms 107:19
verses.text: Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them from their distress.

verses.name: Psalms 107:20
verses.text: He sent forth his word and healed them; he rescued them from the grave.

verses.name: Psalms 107:21
verses.text: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for men.

verses.name: Psalms 107:22
verses.text: Let them sacrifice thank offerings and tell of his works with songs of joy.

verses.name: Psalms 107:23
verses.text: Others went out on the sea in ships; they were merchants on the mighty waters.

verses.name: Psalms 107:24
verses.text: They saw the works of the LORD, his wonderful deeds in the deep.

verses.name: Psalms 107:25
verses.text: For he spoke and stirred up a tempest that lifted high the waves.

verses.name: Psalms 107:26
verses.text: They mounted up to the heavens and went down to the depths; in their peril their courage melted away.

verses.name: Psalms 107:27
verses.text: They reeled and staggered like drunken men; they were at their wits' end.

verses.name: Psalms 107:28
verses.text: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.

verses.name: Psalms 107:29
verses.text: He stilled the storm to a whisper; the waves of the sea were hushed.

verses.name: Psalms 107:30
verses.text: They were glad when it grew calm, and he guided them to their desired haven.

verses.name: Psalms 107:31
verses.text: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for men.

verses.name: Psalms 107:32
verses.text: Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people and praise him in the council of the elders.

verses.name: Psalms 107:33
verses.text: He turned rivers into a desert, flowing springs into thirsty ground,

verses.name: Psalms 107:34
verses.text: and fruitful land into a salt waste, because of the wickedness of those who lived there.

verses.name: Psalms 107:35
verses.text: He turned the desert into pools of water and the parched ground into flowing springs;

verses.name: Psalms 107:36
verses.text: there he brought the hungry to live, and they founded a city where they could settle.

verses.name: Psalms 107:37
verses.text: They sowed fields and planted vineyards that yielded a fruitful harvest;

verses.name: Psalms 107:38
verses.text: he blessed them, and their numbers greatly increased, and he did not let their herds diminish.

verses.name: Psalms 107:39
verses.text: Then their numbers decreased, and they were humbled by oppression, calamity and sorrow;

verses.name: Psalms 107:40
verses.text: he who pours contempt on nobles made them wander in a trackless waste.

verses.name: Psalms 107:41
verses.text: But he lifted the needy out of their affliction and increased their families like flocks.

verses.name: Psalms 107:42
verses.text: The upright see and rejoice, but all the wicked shut their mouths.

verses.name: Psalms 107:43
verses.text: Whoever is wise, let him heed these things and consider the great love of the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 108:1
verses.text: My heart is steadfast, O God; I will sing and make music with all my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 108:2
verses.text: Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.

verses.name: Psalms 108:3
verses.text: I will praise you, O LORD, among the nations; I will sing of you among the peoples.

verses.name: Psalms 108:4
verses.text: For great is your love, higher than the heavens; your faithfulness reaches to the skies.

verses.name: Psalms 108:5
verses.text: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens, and let your glory be over all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 108:6
verses.text: Save us and help us with your right hand, that those you love may be delivered.

verses.name: Psalms 108:7
verses.text: God has spoken from his sanctuary: "In triumph I will parcel out Shechem and measure off the Valley of Succoth.

verses.name: Psalms 108:8
verses.text: Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is my helmet, Judah my scepter.

verses.name: Psalms 108:9
verses.text: Moab is my washbasin, upon Edom I toss my sandal; over Philistia I shout in triumph."

verses.name: Psalms 108:10
verses.text: Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?

verses.name: Psalms 108:11
verses.text: Is it not you, O God, you who have rejected us and no longer go out with our armies?

verses.name: Psalms 108:12
verses.text: Give us aid against the enemy, for the help of man is worthless.

verses.name: Psalms 108:13
verses.text: With God we will gain the victory, and he will trample down our enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 109:1
verses.text: O God, whom I praise, do not remain silent,

verses.name: Psalms 109:2
verses.text: for wicked and deceitful men have opened their mouths against me; they have spoken against me with lying tongues.

verses.name: Psalms 109:3
verses.text: With words of hatred they surround me; they attack me without cause.

verses.name: Psalms 109:4
verses.text: In return for my friendship they accuse me, but I am a man of prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 109:5
verses.text: They repay me evil for good, and hatred for my friendship.

verses.name: Psalms 109:6
verses.text: Appoint an evil man to oppose him; let an accuser stand at his right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 109:7
verses.text: When he is tried, let him be found guilty, and may his prayers condemn him.

verses.name: Psalms 109:8
verses.text: May his days be few; may another take his place of leadership.

verses.name: Psalms 109:9
verses.text: May his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.

verses.name: Psalms 109:10
verses.text: May his children be wandering beggars; may they be driven from their ruined homes.

verses.name: Psalms 109:11
verses.text: May a creditor seize all he has; may strangers plunder the fruits of his labor.

verses.name: Psalms 109:12
verses.text: May no one extend kindness to him or take pity on his fatherless children.

verses.name: Psalms 109:13
verses.text: May his descendants be cut off, their names blotted out from the next generation.

verses.name: Psalms 109:14
verses.text: May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the LORD; may the sin of his mother never be blotted out.

verses.name: Psalms 109:15
verses.text: May their sins always remain before the LORD, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 109:16
verses.text: For he never thought of doing a kindness, but hounded to death the poor and the needy and the brokenhearted.

verses.name: Psalms 109:17
verses.text: He loved to pronounce a curse- may it come on him; he found no pleasure in blessing- may it be far from him.

verses.name: Psalms 109:18
verses.text: He wore cursing as his garment; it entered into his body like water, into his bones like oil.

verses.name: Psalms 109:19
verses.text: May it be like a cloak wrapped about him, like a belt tied forever around him.

verses.name: Psalms 109:20
verses.text: May this be the LORD's payment to my accusers, to those who speak evil of me.

verses.name: Psalms 109:21
verses.text: But you, O Sovereign LORD, deal well with me for your name's sake; out of the goodness of your love, deliver me.

verses.name: Psalms 109:22
verses.text: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.name: Psalms 109:23
verses.text: I fade away like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.

verses.name: Psalms 109:24
verses.text: My knees give way from fasting; my body is thin and gaunt.

verses.name: Psalms 109:25
verses.text: I am an object of scorn to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads.

verses.name: Psalms 109:26
verses.text: Help me, O LORD my God; save me in accordance with your love.

verses.name: Psalms 109:27
verses.text: Let them know that it is your hand, that you, O LORD, have done it.

verses.name: Psalms 109:28
verses.text: They may curse, but you will bless; when they attack they will be put to shame, but your servant will rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 109:29
verses.text: My accusers will be clothed with disgrace and wrapped in shame as in a cloak.

verses.name: Psalms 109:30
verses.text: With my mouth I will greatly extol the LORD; in the great throng I will praise him.

verses.name: Psalms 109:31
verses.text: For he stands at the right hand of the needy one, to save his life from those who condemn him.

verses.name: Psalms 110:1
verses.text: The LORD says to my Lord: "Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet."

verses.name: Psalms 110:2
verses.text: The LORD will extend your mighty scepter from Zion; you will rule in the midst of your enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 110:3
verses.text: Your troops will be willing on your day of battle. Arrayed in holy majesty, from the womb of the dawn you will receive the dew of your youth.

verses.name: Psalms 110:4
verses.text: The LORD has sworn and will not change his mind: "You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek."

verses.name: Psalms 110:5
verses.text: The Lord is at your right hand; he will crush kings on the day of his wrath.

verses.name: Psalms 110:6
verses.text: He will judge the nations, heaping up the dead and crushing the rulers of the whole earth.

verses.name: Psalms 110:7
verses.text: He will drink from a brook beside the way; therefore he will lift up his head.

verses.name: Psalms 111:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. I will extol the LORD with all my heart in the council of the upright and in the assembly.

verses.name: Psalms 111:2
verses.text: Great are the works of the LORD; they are pondered by all who delight in them.

verses.name: Psalms 111:3
verses.text: Glorious and majestic are his deeds, and his righteousness endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 111:4
verses.text: He has caused his wonders to be remembered; the LORD is gracious and compassionate.

verses.name: Psalms 111:5
verses.text: He provides food for those who fear him; he remembers his covenant forever.

verses.name: Psalms 111:6
verses.text: He has shown his people the power of his works, giving them the lands of other nations.

verses.name: Psalms 111:7
verses.text: The works of his hands are faithful and just; all his precepts are trustworthy.

verses.name: Psalms 111:8
verses.text: They are steadfast for ever and ever, done in faithfulness and uprightness.

verses.name: Psalms 111:9
verses.text: He provided redemption for his people; he ordained his covenant forever- holy and awesome is his name.

verses.name: Psalms 111:10
verses.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow his precepts have good understanding. To him belongs eternal praise.

verses.name: Psalms 112:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. Blessed is the man who fears the LORD, who finds great delight in his commands.

verses.name: Psalms 112:2
verses.text: His children will be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed.

verses.name: Psalms 112:3
verses.text: Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 112:4
verses.text: Even in darkness light dawns for the upright, for the gracious and compassionate and righteous man.

verses.name: Psalms 112:5
verses.text: Good will come to him who is generous and lends freely, who conducts his affairs with justice.

verses.name: Psalms 112:6
verses.text: Surely he will never be shaken; a righteous man will be remembered forever.

verses.name: Psalms 112:7
verses.text: He will have no fear of bad news; his heart is steadfast, trusting in the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 112:8
verses.text: His heart is secure, he will have no fear; in the end he will look in triumph on his foes.

verses.name: Psalms 112:9
verses.text: He has scattered abroad his gifts to the poor, his righteousness endures forever; his horn will be lifted high in honor.

verses.name: Psalms 112:10
verses.text: The wicked man will see and be vexed, he will gnash his teeth and waste away; the longings of the wicked will come to nothing.

verses.name: Psalms 113:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. Praise, O servants of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 113:2
verses.text: Let the name of the LORD be praised, both now and forevermore.

verses.name: Psalms 113:3
verses.text: From the rising of the sun to the place where it sets, the name of the LORD is to be praised.

verses.name: Psalms 113:4
verses.text: The LORD is exalted over all the nations, his glory above the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 113:5
verses.text: Who is like the LORD our God, the One who sits enthroned on high,

verses.name: Psalms 113:6
verses.text: who stoops down to look on the heavens and the earth?

verses.name: Psalms 113:7
verses.text: He raises the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the ash heap;

verses.name: Psalms 113:8
verses.text: he seats them with princes, with the princes of their people.

verses.name: Psalms 113:9
verses.text: He settles the barren woman in her home as a happy mother of children. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 114:1
verses.text: When Israel came out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of foreign tongue,

verses.name: Psalms 114:2
verses.text: Judah became God's sanctuary, Israel his dominion.

verses.name: Psalms 114:3
verses.text: The sea looked and fled, the Jordan turned back;

verses.name: Psalms 114:4
verses.text: the mountains skipped like rams, the hills like lambs.

verses.name: Psalms 114:5
verses.text: Why was it, O sea, that you fled, O Jordan, that you turned back,

verses.name: Psalms 114:6
verses.text: you mountains, that you skipped like rams, you hills, like lambs?

verses.name: Psalms 114:7
verses.text: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,

verses.name: Psalms 114:8
verses.text: who turned the rock into a pool, the hard rock into springs of water.

verses.name: Psalms 115:1
verses.text: Not to us, O LORD, not to us but to your name be the glory, because of your love and faithfulness.

verses.name: Psalms 115:2
verses.text: Why do the nations say, "Where is their God?"

verses.name: Psalms 115:3
verses.text: Our God is in heaven; he does whatever pleases him.

verses.name: Psalms 115:4
verses.text: But their idols are silver and gold, made by the hands of men.

verses.name: Psalms 115:5
verses.text: They have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes, but they cannot see;

verses.name: Psalms 115:6
verses.text: they have ears, but cannot hear, noses, but they cannot smell;

verses.name: Psalms 115:7
verses.text: they have hands, but cannot feel, feet, but they cannot walk; nor can they utter a sound with their throats.

verses.name: Psalms 115:8
verses.text: Those who make them will be like them, and so will all who trust in them.
