verses.name: Psalms 115:9
verses.text: O house of Israel, trust in the LORD - he is their help and shield.

verses.name: Psalms 115:10
verses.text: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD - he is their help and shield.

verses.name: Psalms 115:11
verses.text: You who fear him, trust in the LORD - he is their help and shield.

verses.name: Psalms 115:12
verses.text: The LORD remembers us and will bless us: He will bless the house of Israel, he will bless the house of Aaron,

verses.name: Psalms 115:13
verses.text: he will bless those who fear the LORD - small and great alike.

verses.name: Psalms 115:14
verses.text: May the LORD make you increase, both you and your children.

verses.name: Psalms 115:15
verses.text: May you be blessed by the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.

verses.name: Psalms 115:16
verses.text: The highest heavens belong to the LORD, but the earth he has given to man.

verses.name: Psalms 115:17
verses.text: It is not the dead who praise the LORD, those who go down to silence;

verses.name: Psalms 115:18
verses.text: it is we who extol the LORD, both now and forevermore. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 116:1
verses.text: I love the LORD, for he heard my voice; he heard my cry for mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 116:2
verses.text: Because he turned his ear to me, I will call on him as long as I live.

verses.name: Psalms 116:3
verses.text: The cords of death entangled me, the anguish of the grave came upon me; I was overcome by trouble and sorrow.

verses.name: Psalms 116:4
verses.text: Then I called on the name of the LORD: "O LORD, save me!"

verses.name: Psalms 116:5
verses.text: The LORD is gracious and righteous; our God is full of compassion.

verses.name: Psalms 116:6
verses.text: The LORD protects the simplehearted; when I was in great need, he saved me.

verses.name: Psalms 116:7
verses.text: Be at rest once more, O my soul, for the LORD has been good to you.

verses.name: Psalms 116:8
verses.text: For you, O LORD, have delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling,

verses.name: Psalms 116:9
verses.text: that I may walk before the LORD in the land of the living.

verses.name: Psalms 116:10
verses.text: I believed; therefore I said, "I am greatly afflicted."

verses.name: Psalms 116:11
verses.text: And in my dismay I said, "All men are liars."

verses.name: Psalms 116:12
verses.text: How can I repay the LORD for all his goodness to me?

verses.name: Psalms 116:13
verses.text: I will lift up the cup of salvation and call on the name of the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 116:14
verses.text: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all his people.

verses.name: Psalms 116:15
verses.text: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.

verses.name: Psalms 116:16
verses.text: O LORD, truly I am your servant; I am your servant, the son of your maidservant; you have freed me from my chains.

verses.name: Psalms 116:17
verses.text: I will sacrifice a thank offering to you and call on the name of the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 116:18
verses.text: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all his people,

verses.name: Psalms 116:19
verses.text: in the courts of the house of the LORD - in your midst, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 117:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD, all you nations; extol him, all you peoples.

verses.name: Psalms 117:2
verses.text: For great is his love toward us, and the faithfulness of the LORD endures forever. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 118:1
verses.text: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 118:2
verses.text: Let Israel say: "His love endures forever."

verses.name: Psalms 118:3
verses.text: Let the house of Aaron say: "His love endures forever."

verses.name: Psalms 118:4
verses.text: Let those who fear the LORD say: "His love endures forever."

verses.name: Psalms 118:5
verses.text: In my anguish I cried to the LORD, and he answered by setting me free.

verses.name: Psalms 118:6
verses.text: The LORD is with me; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?

verses.name: Psalms 118:7
verses.text: The LORD is with me; he is my helper. I will look in triumph on my enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 118:8
verses.text: It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in man.

verses.name: Psalms 118:9
verses.text: It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in princes.

verses.name: Psalms 118:10
verses.text: All the nations surrounded me, but in the name of the LORD I cut them off.

verses.name: Psalms 118:11
verses.text: They surrounded me on every side, but in the name of the LORD I cut them off.

verses.name: Psalms 118:12
verses.text: They swarmed around me like bees, but they died out as quickly as burning thorns; in the name of the LORD I cut them off.

verses.name: Psalms 118:13
verses.text: I was pushed back and about to fall, but the LORD helped me.

verses.name: Psalms 118:14
verses.text: The LORD is my strength and my song; he has become my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 118:15
verses.text: Shouts of joy and victory resound in the tents of the righteous: "The LORD's right hand has done mighty things!

verses.name: Psalms 118:16
verses.text: The LORD's right hand is lifted high; the LORD's right hand has done mighty things!"

verses.name: Psalms 118:17
verses.text: I will not die but live, and will proclaim what the LORD has done.

verses.name: Psalms 118:18
verses.text: The LORD has chastened me severely, but he has not given me over to death.

verses.name: Psalms 118:19
verses.text: Open for me the gates of righteousness; I will enter and give thanks to the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 118:20
verses.text: This is the gate of the LORD through which the righteous may enter.

verses.name: Psalms 118:21
verses.text: I will give you thanks, for you answered me; you have become my salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 118:22
verses.text: The stone the builders rejected has become the capstone;

verses.name: Psalms 118:23
verses.text: the LORD has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 118:24
verses.text: This is the day the LORD has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.name: Psalms 118:25
verses.text: O LORD, save us; O LORD, grant us success.

verses.name: Psalms 118:26
verses.text: Blessed is he who comes in the name of the LORD. From the house of the LORD we bless you.

verses.name: Psalms 118:27
verses.text: The LORD is God, and he has made his light shine upon us. With boughs in hand, join in the festal procession up to the horns of the altar.

verses.name: Psalms 118:28
verses.text: You are my God, and I will give you thanks; you are my God, and I will exalt you.

verses.name: Psalms 118:29
verses.text: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 119:1
verses.text: Blessed are they whose ways are blameless, who walk according to the law of the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 119:2
verses.text: Blessed are they who keep his statutes and seek him with all their heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:3
verses.text: They do nothing wrong; they walk in his ways.

verses.name: Psalms 119:4
verses.text: You have laid down precepts that are to be fully obeyed.

verses.name: Psalms 119:5
verses.text: Oh, that my ways were steadfast in obeying your decrees!

verses.name: Psalms 119:6
verses.text: Then I would not be put to shame when I consider all your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 119:7
verses.text: I will praise you with an upright heart as I learn your righteous laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:8
verses.text: I will obey your decrees; do not utterly forsake me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:9
verses.text: How can a young man keep his way pure? By living according to your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:10
verses.text: I seek you with all my heart; do not let me stray from your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 119:11
verses.text: I have hidden your word in my heart that I might not sin against you.

verses.name: Psalms 119:12
verses.text: Praise be to you, O LORD; teach me your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:13
verses.text: With my lips I recount all the laws that come from your mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 119:14
verses.text: I rejoice in following your statutes as one rejoices in great riches.

verses.name: Psalms 119:15
verses.text: I meditate on your precepts and consider your ways.

verses.name: Psalms 119:16
verses.text: I delight in your decrees; I will not neglect your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:17
verses.text: Do good to your servant, and I will live; I will obey your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:18
verses.text: Open my eyes that I may see wonderful things in your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:19
verses.text: I am a stranger on earth; do not hide your commands from me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:20
verses.text: My soul is consumed with longing for your laws at all times.

verses.name: Psalms 119:21
verses.text: You rebuke the arrogant, who are cursed and who stray from your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 119:22
verses.text: Remove from me scorn and contempt, for I keep your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:23
verses.text: Though rulers sit together and slander me, your servant will meditate on your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:24
verses.text: Your statutes are my delight; they are my counselors.

verses.name: Psalms 119:25
verses.text: I am laid low in the dust; preserve my life according to your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:26
verses.text: I recounted my ways and you answered me; teach me your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:27
verses.text: Let me understand the teaching of your precepts; then I will meditate on your wonders.

verses.name: Psalms 119:28
verses.text: My soul is weary with sorrow; strengthen me according to your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:29
verses.text: Keep me from deceitful ways; be gracious to me through your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:30
verses.text: I have chosen the way of truth; I have set my heart on your laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:31
verses.text: I hold fast to your statutes, O LORD; do not let me be put to shame.

verses.name: Psalms 119:32
verses.text: I run in the path of your commands, for you have set my heart free.

verses.name: Psalms 119:33
verses.text: Teach me, O LORD, to follow your decrees; then I will keep them to the end.

verses.name: Psalms 119:34
verses.text: Give me understanding, and I will keep your law and obey it with all my heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:35
verses.text: Direct me in the path of your commands, for there I find delight.

verses.name: Psalms 119:36
verses.text: Turn my heart toward your statutes and not toward selfish gain.

verses.name: Psalms 119:37
verses.text: Turn my eyes away from worthless things; preserve my life according to your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:38
verses.text: Fulfill your promise to your servant, so that you may be feared.

verses.name: Psalms 119:39
verses.text: Take away the disgrace I dread, for your laws are good.

verses.name: Psalms 119:40
verses.text: How I long for your precepts! Preserve my life in your righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 119:41
verses.text: May your unfailing love come to me, O LORD, your salvation according to your promise;

verses.name: Psalms 119:42
verses.text: then I will answer the one who taunts me, for I trust in your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:43
verses.text: Do not snatch the word of truth from my mouth, for I have put my hope in your laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:44
verses.text: I will always obey your law, for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 119:45
verses.text: I will walk about in freedom, for I have sought out your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:46
verses.text: I will speak of your statutes before kings and will not be put to shame,

verses.name: Psalms 119:47
verses.text: for I delight in your commands because I love them.

verses.name: Psalms 119:48
verses.text: I lift up my hands to your commands, which I love, and I meditate on your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:49
verses.text: Remember your word to your servant, for you have given me hope.

verses.name: Psalms 119:50
verses.text: My comfort in my suffering is this: Your promise preserves my life.

verses.name: Psalms 119:51
verses.text: The arrogant mock me without restraint, but I do not turn from your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:52
verses.text: I remember your ancient laws, O LORD, and I find comfort in them.

verses.name: Psalms 119:53
verses.text: Indignation grips me because of the wicked, who have forsaken your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:54
verses.text: Your decrees are the theme of my song wherever I lodge.

verses.name: Psalms 119:55
verses.text: In the night I remember your name, O LORD, and I will keep your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:56
verses.text: This has been my practice: I obey your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:57
verses.text: You are my portion, O LORD; I have promised to obey your words.

verses.name: Psalms 119:58
verses.text: I have sought your face with all my heart; be gracious to me according to your promise.

verses.name: Psalms 119:59
verses.text: I have considered my ways and have turned my steps to your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:60
verses.text: I will hasten and not delay to obey your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 119:61
verses.text: Though the wicked bind me with ropes, I will not forget your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:62
verses.text: At midnight I rise to give you thanks for your righteous laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:63
verses.text: I am a friend to all who fear you, to all who follow your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:64
verses.text: The earth is filled with your love, O LORD; teach me your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:65
verses.text: Do good to your servant according to your word, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 119:66
verses.text: Teach me knowledge and good judgment, for I believe in your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 119:67
verses.text: Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I obey your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:68
verses.text: You are good, and what you do is good; teach me your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:69
verses.text: Though the arrogant have smeared me with lies, I keep your precepts with all my heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:70
verses.text: Their hearts are callous and unfeeling, but I delight in your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:71
verses.text: It was good for me to be afflicted so that I might learn your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:72
verses.text: The law from your mouth is more precious to me than thousands of pieces of silver and gold.

verses.name: Psalms 119:73
verses.text: Your hands made me and formed me; give me understanding to learn your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 119:74
verses.text: May those who fear you rejoice when they see me, for I have put my hope in your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:75
verses.text: I know, O LORD, that your laws are righteous, and in faithfulness you have afflicted me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:76
verses.text: May your unfailing love be my comfort, according to your promise to your servant.

verses.name: Psalms 119:77
verses.text: Let your compassion come to me that I may live, for your law is my delight.

verses.name: Psalms 119:78
verses.text: May the arrogant be put to shame for wronging me without cause; but I will meditate on your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:79
verses.text: May those who fear you turn to me, those who understand your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:80
verses.text: May my heart be blameless toward your decrees, that I may not be put to shame.

verses.name: Psalms 119:81
verses.text: My soul faints with longing for your salvation, but I have put my hope in your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:82
verses.text: My eyes fail, looking for your promise; I say, "When will you comfort me?"

verses.name: Psalms 119:83
verses.text: Though I am like a wineskin in the smoke, I do not forget your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:84
verses.text: How long must your servant wait? When will you punish my persecutors?

verses.name: Psalms 119:85
verses.text: The arrogant dig pitfalls for me, contrary to your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:86
verses.text: All your commands are trustworthy; help me, for men persecute me without cause.

verses.name: Psalms 119:87
verses.text: They almost wiped me from the earth, but I have not forsaken your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:88
verses.text: Preserve my life according to your love, and I will obey the statutes of your mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 119:89
verses.text: Your word, O LORD, is eternal; it stands firm in the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 119:90
verses.text: Your faithfulness continues through all generations; you established the earth, and it endures.

verses.name: Psalms 119:91
verses.text: Your laws endure to this day, for all things serve you.

verses.name: Psalms 119:92
verses.text: If your law had not been my delight, I would have perished in my affliction.

verses.name: Psalms 119:93
verses.text: I will never forget your precepts, for by them you have preserved my life.

verses.name: Psalms 119:94
verses.text: Save me, for I am yours; I have sought out your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:95
verses.text: The wicked are waiting to destroy me, but I will ponder your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:96
verses.text: To all perfection I see a limit; but your commands are boundless.

verses.name: Psalms 119:97
verses.text: Oh, how I love your law! I meditate on it all day long.

verses.name: Psalms 119:98
verses.text: Your commands make me wiser than my enemies, for they are ever with me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:99
verses.text: I have more insight than all my teachers, for I meditate on your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:100
verses.text: I have more understanding than the elders, for I obey your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:101
verses.text: I have kept my feet from every evil path so that I might obey your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:102
verses.text: I have not departed from your laws, for you yourself have taught me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:103
verses.text: How sweet are your words to my taste, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

verses.name: Psalms 119:104
verses.text: I gain understanding from your precepts; therefore I hate every wrong path.

verses.name: Psalms 119:105
verses.text: Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path.

verses.name: Psalms 119:106
verses.text: I have taken an oath and confirmed it, that I will follow your righteous laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:107
verses.text: I have suffered much; preserve my life, O LORD, according to your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:108
verses.text: Accept, O LORD, the willing praise of my mouth, and teach me your laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:109
verses.text: Though I constantly take my life in my hands, I will not forget your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:110
verses.text: The wicked have set a snare for me, but I have not strayed from your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:111
verses.text: Your statutes are my heritage forever; they are the joy of my heart.

verses.name: Psalms 119:112
verses.text: My heart is set on keeping your decrees to the very end.

verses.name: Psalms 119:113
verses.text: I hate double-minded men, but I love your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:114
verses.text: You are my refuge and my shield; I have put my hope in your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:115
verses.text: Away from me, you evildoers, that I may keep the commands of my God!

verses.name: Psalms 119:116
verses.text: Sustain me according to your promise, and I will live; do not let my hopes be dashed.

verses.name: Psalms 119:117
verses.text: Uphold me, and I will be delivered; I will always have regard for your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:118
verses.text: You reject all who stray from your decrees, for their deceitfulness is in vain.

verses.name: Psalms 119:119
verses.text: All the wicked of the earth you discard like dross; therefore I love your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:120
verses.text: My flesh trembles in fear of you; I stand in awe of your laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:121
verses.text: I have done what is righteous and just; do not leave me to my oppressors.

verses.name: Psalms 119:122
verses.text: Ensure your servant's well-being; let not the arrogant oppress me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:123
verses.text: My eyes fail, looking for your salvation, looking for your righteous promise.

verses.name: Psalms 119:124
verses.text: Deal with your servant according to your love and teach me your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:125
verses.text: I am your servant; give me discernment that I may understand your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:126
verses.text: It is time for you to act, O LORD; your law is being broken.

verses.name: Psalms 119:127
verses.text: Because I love your commands more than gold, more than pure gold,

verses.name: Psalms 119:128
verses.text: and because I consider all your precepts right, I hate every wrong path.

verses.name: Psalms 119:129
verses.text: Your statutes are wonderful; therefore I obey them.

verses.name: Psalms 119:130
verses.text: The unfolding of your words gives light; it gives understanding to the simple.

verses.name: Psalms 119:131
verses.text: I open my mouth and pant, longing for your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 119:132
verses.text: Turn to me and have mercy on me, as you always do to those who love your name.

verses.name: Psalms 119:133
verses.text: Direct my footsteps according to your word; let no sin rule over me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:134
verses.text: Redeem me from the oppression of men, that I may obey your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:135
verses.text: Make your face shine upon your servant and teach me your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:136
verses.text: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, for your law is not obeyed.

verses.name: Psalms 119:137
verses.text: Righteous are you, O LORD, and your laws are right.

verses.name: Psalms 119:138
verses.text: The statutes you have laid down are righteous; they are fully trustworthy.

verses.name: Psalms 119:139
verses.text: My zeal wears me out, for my enemies ignore your words.

verses.name: Psalms 119:140
verses.text: Your promises have been thoroughly tested, and your servant loves them.

verses.name: Psalms 119:141
verses.text: Though I am lowly and despised, I do not forget your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:142
verses.text: Your righteousness is everlasting and your law is true.

verses.name: Psalms 119:143
verses.text: Trouble and distress have come upon me, but your commands are my delight.

verses.name: Psalms 119:144
verses.text: Your statutes are forever right; give me understanding that I may live.

verses.name: Psalms 119:145
verses.text: I call with all my heart; answer me, O LORD, and I will obey your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:146
verses.text: I call out to you; save me and I will keep your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:147
verses.text: I rise before dawn and cry for help; I have put my hope in your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:148
verses.text: My eyes stay open through the watches of the night, that I may meditate on your promises.

verses.name: Psalms 119:149
verses.text: Hear my voice in accordance with your love; preserve my life, O LORD, according to your laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:150
verses.text: Those who devise wicked schemes are near, but they are far from your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:151
verses.text: Yet you are near, O LORD, and all your commands are true.

verses.name: Psalms 119:152
verses.text: Long ago I learned from your statutes that you established them to last forever.

verses.name: Psalms 119:153
verses.text: Look upon my suffering and deliver me, for I have not forgotten your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:154
verses.text: Defend my cause and redeem me; preserve my life according to your promise.

verses.name: Psalms 119:155
verses.text: Salvation is far from the wicked, for they do not seek out your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:156
verses.text: Your compassion is great, O LORD; preserve my life according to your laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:157
verses.text: Many are the foes who persecute me, but I have not turned from your statutes.

verses.name: Psalms 119:158
verses.text: I look on the faithless with loathing, for they do not obey your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:159
verses.text: See how I love your precepts; preserve my life, O LORD, according to your love.

verses.name: Psalms 119:160
verses.text: All your words are true; all your righteous laws are eternal.

verses.name: Psalms 119:161
verses.text: Rulers persecute me without cause, but my heart trembles at your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:162
verses.text: I rejoice in your promise like one who finds great spoil.

verses.name: Psalms 119:163
verses.text: I hate and abhor falsehood but I love your law.

verses.name: Psalms 119:164
verses.text: Seven times a day I praise you for your righteous laws.

verses.name: Psalms 119:165
verses.text: Great peace have they who love your law, and nothing can make them stumble.

verses.name: Psalms 119:166
verses.text: I wait for your salvation, O LORD, and I follow your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 119:167
verses.text: I obey your statutes, for I love them greatly.

verses.name: Psalms 119:168
verses.text: I obey your precepts and your statutes, for all my ways are known to you.

verses.name: Psalms 119:169
verses.text: May my cry come before you, O LORD; give me understanding according to your word.

verses.name: Psalms 119:170
verses.text: May my supplication come before you; deliver me according to your promise.

verses.name: Psalms 119:171
verses.text: May my lips overflow with praise, for you teach me your decrees.

verses.name: Psalms 119:172
verses.text: May my tongue sing of your word, for all your commands are righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 119:173
verses.text: May your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen your precepts.

verses.name: Psalms 119:174
verses.text: I long for your salvation, O LORD, and your law is my delight.

verses.name: Psalms 119:175
verses.text: Let me live that I may praise you, and may your laws sustain me.

verses.name: Psalms 119:176
verses.text: I have strayed like a lost sheep. Seek your servant, for I have not forgotten your commands.

verses.name: Psalms 120:1
verses.text: I call on the LORD in my distress, and he answers me.

verses.name: Psalms 120:2
verses.text: Save me, O LORD, from lying lips and from deceitful tongues.

verses.name: Psalms 120:3
verses.text: What will he do to you, and what more besides, O deceitful tongue?

verses.name: Psalms 120:4
verses.text: He will punish you with a warrior's sharp arrows, with burning coals of the broom tree.

verses.name: Psalms 120:5
verses.text: Woe to me that I dwell in Meshech, that I live among the tents of Kedar!

verses.name: Psalms 120:6
verses.text: Too long have I lived among those who hate peace.

verses.name: Psalms 120:7
verses.text: I am a man of peace; but when I speak, they are for war.

verses.name: Psalms 121:1
verses.text: I lift up my eyes to the hills- where does my help come from?

verses.name: Psalms 121:2
verses.text: My help comes from the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.

verses.name: Psalms 121:3
verses.text: He will not let your foot slip- he who watches over you will not slumber;

verses.name: Psalms 121:4
verses.text: indeed, he who watches over Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.

verses.name: Psalms 121:5
verses.text: The LORD watches over you- the LORD is your shade at your right hand;

verses.name: Psalms 121:6
verses.text: the sun will not harm you by day, nor the moon by night.

verses.name: Psalms 121:7
verses.text: The LORD will keep you from all harm- he will watch over your life;

verses.name: Psalms 121:8
verses.text: the LORD will watch over your coming and going both now and forevermore.

verses.name: Psalms 122:1
verses.text: I rejoiced with those who said to me, "Let us go to the house of the LORD."

verses.name: Psalms 122:2
verses.text: Our feet are standing in your gates, O Jerusalem.

verses.name: Psalms 122:3
verses.text: Jerusalem is built like a city that is closely compacted together.

verses.name: Psalms 122:4
verses.text: That is where the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, to praise the name of the LORD according to the statute given to Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 122:5
verses.text: There the thrones for judgment stand, the thrones of the house of David.

verses.name: Psalms 122:6
verses.text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: "May those who love you be secure.

verses.name: Psalms 122:7
verses.text: May there be peace within your walls and security within your citadels."

verses.name: Psalms 122:8
verses.text: For the sake of my brothers and friends, I will say, "Peace be within you."

verses.name: Psalms 122:9
verses.text: For the sake of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek your prosperity.

verses.name: Psalms 123:1
verses.text: I lift up my eyes to you, to you whose throne is in heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 123:2
verses.text: As the eyes of slaves look to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a maid look to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes look to the LORD our God, till he shows us his mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 123:3
verses.text: Have mercy on us, O LORD, have mercy on us, for we have endured much contempt.

verses.name: Psalms 123:4
verses.text: We have endured much ridicule from the proud, much contempt from the arrogant.

verses.name: Psalms 124:1
verses.text: If the LORD had not been on our side- let Israel say-

verses.name: Psalms 124:2
verses.text: if the LORD had not been on our side when men attacked us,

verses.name: Psalms 124:3
verses.text: when their anger flared against us, they would have swallowed us alive;

verses.name: Psalms 124:4
verses.text: the flood would have engulfed us, the torrent would have swept over us,

verses.name: Psalms 124:5
verses.text: the raging waters would have swept us away.

verses.name: Psalms 124:6
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD, who has not let us be torn by their teeth.

verses.name: Psalms 124:7
verses.text: We have escaped like a bird out of the fowler's snare; the snare has been broken, and we have escaped.

verses.name: Psalms 124:8
verses.text: Our help is in the name of the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.

verses.name: Psalms 125:1
verses.text: Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion, which cannot be shaken but endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 125:2
verses.text: As the mountains surround Jerusalem, so the LORD surrounds his people both now and forevermore.

verses.name: Psalms 125:3
verses.text: The scepter of the wicked will not remain over the land allotted to the righteous, for then the righteous might use their hands to do evil.

verses.name: Psalms 125:4
verses.text: Do good, O LORD, to those who are good, to those who are upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 125:5
verses.text: But those who turn to crooked ways the LORD will banish with the evildoers. Peace be upon Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 126:1
verses.text: When the LORD brought back the captives to Zion, we were like men who dreamed.

verses.name: Psalms 126:2
verses.text: Our mouths were filled with laughter, our tongues with songs of joy. Then it was said among the nations, "The LORD has done great things for them."

verses.name: Psalms 126:3
verses.text: The LORD has done great things for us, and we are filled with joy.

verses.name: Psalms 126:4
verses.text: Restore our fortunes, O LORD, like streams in the Negev.

verses.name: Psalms 126:5
verses.text: Those who sow in tears will reap with songs of joy.

verses.name: Psalms 126:6
verses.text: He who goes out weeping, carrying seed to sow, will return with songs of joy, carrying sheaves with him.

verses.name: Psalms 127:1
verses.text: Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain. Unless the LORD watches over the city, the watchmen stand guard in vain.

verses.name: Psalms 127:2
verses.text: In vain you rise early and stay up late, toiling for food to eat- for he grants sleep to those he loves.

verses.name: Psalms 127:3
verses.text: Sons are a heritage from the LORD, children a reward from him.

verses.name: Psalms 127:4
verses.text: Like arrows in the hands of a warrior are sons born in one's youth.

verses.name: Psalms 127:5
verses.text: Blessed is the man whose quiver is full of them. They will not be put to shame when they contend with their enemies in the gate.

verses.name: Psalms 128:1
verses.text: Blessed are all who fear the LORD, who walk in his ways.

verses.name: Psalms 128:2
verses.text: You will eat the fruit of your labor; blessings and prosperity will be yours.

verses.name: Psalms 128:3
verses.text: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine within your house; your sons will be like olive shoots around your table.

verses.name: Psalms 128:4
verses.text: Thus is the man blessed who fears the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 128:5
verses.text: May the LORD bless you from Zion all the days of your life; may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem,

verses.name: Psalms 128:6
verses.text: and may you live to see your children's children. Peace be upon Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 129:1
verses.text: They have greatly oppressed me from my youth- let Israel say-

verses.name: Psalms 129:2
verses.text: they have greatly oppressed me from my youth, but they have not gained the victory over me.

verses.name: Psalms 129:3
verses.text: Plowmen have plowed my back and made their furrows long.

verses.name: Psalms 129:4
verses.text: But the LORD is righteous; he has cut me free from the cords of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 129:5
verses.text: May all who hate Zion be turned back in shame.

verses.name: Psalms 129:6
verses.text: May they be like grass on the roof, which withers before it can grow;

verses.name: Psalms 129:7
verses.text: with it the reaper cannot fill his hands, nor the one who gathers fill his arms.

verses.name: Psalms 129:8
verses.text: May those who pass by not say, "The blessing of the LORD be upon you; we bless you in the name of the LORD."

verses.name: Psalms 130:1
verses.text: Out of the depths I cry to you, O LORD;

verses.name: Psalms 130:2
verses.text: O Lord, hear my voice. Let your ears be attentive to my cry for mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 130:3
verses.text: If you, O LORD, kept a record of sins, O Lord, who could stand?

verses.name: Psalms 130:4
verses.text: But with you there is forgiveness; therefore you are feared.

verses.name: Psalms 130:5
verses.text: I wait for the LORD, my soul waits, and in his word I put my hope.

verses.name: Psalms 130:6
verses.text: My soul waits for the Lord more than watchmen wait for the morning, more than watchmen wait for the morning.

verses.name: Psalms 130:7
verses.text: O Israel, put your hope in the LORD, for with the LORD is unfailing love and with him is full redemption.

verses.name: Psalms 130:8
verses.text: He himself will redeem Israel from all their sins.

verses.name: Psalms 131:1
verses.text: My heart is not proud, O LORD, my eyes are not haughty; I do not concern myself with great matters or things too wonderful for me.

verses.name: Psalms 131:2
verses.text: But I have stilled and quieted my soul; like a weaned child with its mother, like a weaned child is my soul within me.

verses.name: Psalms 131:3
verses.text: O Israel, put your hope in the LORD both now and forevermore.

verses.name: Psalms 132:1
verses.text: O LORD, remember David and all the hardships he endured.

verses.name: Psalms 132:2
verses.text: He swore an oath to the LORD and made a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:

verses.name: Psalms 132:3
verses.text: "I will not enter my house or go to my bed-

verses.name: Psalms 132:4
verses.text: I will allow no sleep to my eyes, no slumber to my eyelids,

verses.name: Psalms 132:5
verses.text: till I find a place for the LORD, a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob."

verses.name: Psalms 132:6
verses.text: We heard it in Ephrathah, we came upon it in the fields of Jaar:

verses.name: Psalms 132:7
verses.text: "Let us go to his dwelling place; let us worship at his footstool-

verses.name: Psalms 132:8
verses.text: arise, O LORD, and come to your resting place, you and the ark of your might.

verses.name: Psalms 132:9
verses.text: May your priests be clothed with righteousness; may your saints sing for joy."

verses.name: Psalms 132:10
verses.text: For the sake of David your servant, do not reject your anointed one.

verses.name: Psalms 132:11
verses.text: The LORD swore an oath to David, a sure oath that he will not revoke: "One of your own descendants I will place on your throne-

verses.name: Psalms 132:12
verses.text: if your sons keep my covenant and the statutes I teach them, then their sons will sit on your throne for ever and ever."

verses.name: Psalms 132:13
verses.text: For the LORD has chosen Zion, he has desired it for his dwelling:

verses.name: Psalms 132:14
verses.text: "This is my resting place for ever and ever; here I will sit enthroned, for I have desired it-

verses.name: Psalms 132:15
verses.text: I will bless her with abundant provisions; her poor will I satisfy with food.

verses.name: Psalms 132:16
verses.text: I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints will ever sing for joy.

verses.name: Psalms 132:17
verses.text: "Here I will make a horn grow for David and set up a lamp for my anointed one.

verses.name: Psalms 132:18
verses.text: I will clothe his enemies with shame, but the crown on his head will be resplendent."

verses.name: Psalms 133:1
verses.text: How good and pleasant it is when brothers live together in unity!

verses.name: Psalms 133:2
verses.text: It is like precious oil poured on the head, running down on the beard, running down on Aaron's beard, down upon the collar of his robes.

verses.name: Psalms 133:3
verses.text: It is as if the dew of Hermon were falling on Mount Zion. For there the LORD bestows his blessing, even life forevermore.

verses.name: Psalms 134:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD, all you servants of the LORD who minister by night in the house of the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 134:2
verses.text: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary and praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 134:3
verses.text: May the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth, bless you from Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 135:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. Praise the name of the LORD; praise him, you servants of the LORD,

verses.name: Psalms 135:2
verses.text: you who minister in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.name: Psalms 135:3
verses.text: Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good; sing praise to his name, for that is pleasant.

verses.name: Psalms 135:4
verses.text: For the LORD has chosen Jacob to be his own, Israel to be his treasured possession.

verses.name: Psalms 135:5
verses.text: I know that the LORD is great, that our Lord is greater than all gods.

verses.name: Psalms 135:6
verses.text: The LORD does whatever pleases him, in the heavens and on the earth, in the seas and all their depths.

verses.name: Psalms 135:7
verses.text: He makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth; he sends lightning with the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses.

verses.name: Psalms 135:8
verses.text: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, the firstborn of men and animals.

verses.name: Psalms 135:9
verses.text: He sent his signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.

verses.name: Psalms 135:10
verses.text: He struck down many nations and killed mighty kings-

verses.name: Psalms 135:11
verses.text: Sihon king of the Amorites, Og king of Bashan and all the kings of Canaan-

verses.name: Psalms 135:12
verses.text: and he gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance to his people Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 135:13
verses.text: Your name, O LORD, endures forever, your renown, O LORD, through all generations.

verses.name: Psalms 135:14
verses.text: For the LORD will vindicate his people and have compassion on his servants.

verses.name: Psalms 135:15
verses.text: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, made by the hands of men.

verses.name: Psalms 135:16
verses.text: They have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes, but they cannot see;

verses.name: Psalms 135:17
verses.text: they have ears, but cannot hear, nor is there breath in their mouths.

verses.name: Psalms 135:18
verses.text: Those who make them will be like them, and so will all who trust in them.

verses.name: Psalms 135:19
verses.text: O house of Israel, praise the LORD; O house of Aaron, praise the LORD;

verses.name: Psalms 135:20
verses.text: O house of Levi, praise the LORD; you who fear him, praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 135:21
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD from Zion, to him who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 136:1
verses.text: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good. His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:2
verses.text: Give thanks to the God of gods. His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:3
verses.text: Give thanks to the Lord of lords: His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:4
verses.text: to him who alone does great wonders, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:5
verses.text: who by his understanding made the heavens, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:6
verses.text: who spread out the earth upon the waters, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:7
verses.text: who made the great lights- His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:8
verses.text: the sun to govern the day, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:9
verses.text: the moon and stars to govern the night; His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:10
verses.text: to him who struck down the firstborn of Egypt His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:11
verses.text: and brought Israel out from among them His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:12
verses.text: with a mighty hand and outstretched arm; His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:13
verses.text: to him who divided the Red Sea asunder His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:14
verses.text: and brought Israel through the midst of it, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:15
verses.text: but swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea; His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:16
verses.text: to him who led his people through the desert, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:17
verses.text: who struck down great kings, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:18
verses.text: and killed mighty kings- His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:19
verses.text: Sihon king of the Amorites His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:20
verses.text: and Og king of Bashan- His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:21
verses.text: and gave their land as an inheritance, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:22
verses.text: an inheritance to his servant Israel; His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:23
verses.text: to the One who remembered us in our low estate His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:24
verses.text: and freed us from our enemies, His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:25
verses.text: and who gives food to every creature. His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 136:26
verses.text: Give thanks to the God of heaven. His love endures forever.

verses.name: Psalms 137:1
verses.text: By the rivers of Babylon we sat and wept when we remembered Zion.

verses.name: Psalms 137:2
verses.text: There on the poplars we hung our harps,

verses.name: Psalms 137:3
verses.text: for there our captors asked us for songs, our tormentors demanded songs of joy; they said, "Sing us one of the songs of Zion!"

verses.name: Psalms 137:4
verses.text: How can we sing the songs of the LORD while in a foreign land?

verses.name: Psalms 137:5
verses.text: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, may my right hand forget its skill.

verses.name: Psalms 137:6
verses.text: May my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not consider Jerusalem my highest joy.

verses.name: Psalms 137:7
verses.text: Remember, O LORD, what the Edomites did on the day Jerusalem fell. "Tear it down," they cried, "tear it down to its foundations!"

verses.name: Psalms 137:8
verses.text: O Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction, happy is he who repays you for what you have done to us-

verses.name: Psalms 137:9
verses.text: he who seizes your infants and dashes them against the rocks.

verses.name: Psalms 138:1
verses.text: I will praise you, O LORD, with all my heart; before the "gods" I will sing your praise.

verses.name: Psalms 138:2
verses.text: I will bow down toward your holy temple and will praise your name for your love and your faithfulness, for you have exalted above all things your name and your word.

verses.name: Psalms 138:3
verses.text: When I called, you answered me; you made me bold and stouthearted.

verses.name: Psalms 138:4
verses.text: May all the kings of the earth praise you, O LORD, when they hear the words of your mouth.

verses.name: Psalms 138:5
verses.text: May they sing of the ways of the LORD, for the glory of the LORD is great.

verses.name: Psalms 138:6
verses.text: Though the LORD is on high, he looks upon the lowly, but the proud he knows from afar.

verses.name: Psalms 138:7
verses.text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, you preserve my life; you stretch out your hand against the anger of my foes, with your right hand you save me.

verses.name: Psalms 138:8
verses.text: The LORD will fulfill his purpose for me; your love, O LORD, endures forever- do not abandon the works of your hands.

verses.name: Psalms 139:1
verses.text: O LORD, you have searched me and you know me.

verses.name: Psalms 139:2
verses.text: You know when I sit and when I rise; you perceive my thoughts from afar.

verses.name: Psalms 139:3
verses.text: You discern my going out and my lying down; you are familiar with all my ways.

verses.name: Psalms 139:4
verses.text: Before a word is on my tongue you know it completely, O LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 139:5
verses.text: You hem me in-behind and before; you have laid your hand upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 139:6
verses.text: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, too lofty for me to attain.

verses.name: Psalms 139:7
verses.text: Where can I go from your Spirit? Where can I flee from your presence?

verses.name: Psalms 139:8
verses.text: If I go up to the heavens, you are there; if I make my bed in the depths, you are there.

verses.name: Psalms 139:9
verses.text: If I rise on the wings of the dawn, if I settle on the far side of the sea,

verses.name: Psalms 139:10
verses.text: even there your hand will guide me, your right hand will hold me fast.

verses.name: Psalms 139:11
verses.text: If I say, "Surely the darkness will hide me and the light become night around me,"

verses.name: Psalms 139:12
verses.text: even the darkness will not be dark to you; the night will shine like the day, for darkness is as light to you.

verses.name: Psalms 139:13
verses.text: For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother's womb.

verses.name: Psalms 139:14
verses.text: I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well.

verses.name: Psalms 139:15
verses.text: My frame was not hidden from you when I was made in the secret place. When I was woven together in the depths of the earth,

verses.name: Psalms 139:16
verses.text: your eyes saw my unformed body. All the days ordained for me were written in your book before one of them came to be.

verses.name: Psalms 139:17
verses.text: How precious to me are your thoughts, O God! How vast is the sum of them!

verses.name: Psalms 139:18
verses.text: Were I to count them, they would outnumber the grains of sand. When I awake, I am still with you.

verses.name: Psalms 139:19
verses.text: If only you would slay the wicked, O God! Away from me, you bloodthirsty men!

verses.name: Psalms 139:20
verses.text: They speak of you with evil intent; your adversaries misuse your name.

verses.name: Psalms 139:21
verses.text: Do I not hate those who hate you, O LORD, and abhor those who rise up against you?

verses.name: Psalms 139:22
verses.text: I have nothing but hatred for them; I count them my enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 139:23
verses.text: Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts.

verses.name: Psalms 139:24
verses.text: See if there is any offensive way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

verses.name: Psalms 140:1
verses.text: Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men; protect me from men of violence,

verses.name: Psalms 140:2
verses.text: who devise evil plans in their hearts and stir up war every day.

verses.name: Psalms 140:3
verses.text: They make their tongues as sharp as a serpent's; the poison of vipers is on their lips. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 140:4
verses.text: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; protect me from men of violence who plan to trip my feet.

verses.name: Psalms 140:5
verses.text: Proud men have hidden a snare for me; they have spread out the cords of their net and have set traps for me along my path. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 140:6
verses.text: O LORD, I say to you, "You are my God." Hear, O LORD, my cry for mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 140:7
verses.text: O Sovereign LORD, my strong deliverer, who shields my head in the day of battle-

verses.name: Psalms 140:8
verses.text: do not grant the wicked their desires, O LORD; do not let their plans succeed, or they will become proud. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 140:9
verses.text: Let the heads of those who surround me be covered with the trouble their lips have caused.

verses.name: Psalms 140:10
verses.text: Let burning coals fall upon them; may they be thrown into the fire, into miry pits, never to rise.

verses.name: Psalms 140:11
verses.text: Let slanderers not be established in the land; may disaster hunt down men of violence.

verses.name: Psalms 140:12
verses.text: I know that the LORD secures justice for the poor and upholds the cause of the needy.

verses.name: Psalms 140:13
verses.text: Surely the righteous will praise your name and the upright will live before you.

verses.name: Psalms 141:1
verses.text: O LORD, I call to you; come quickly to me. Hear my voice when I call to you.

verses.name: Psalms 141:2
verses.text: May my prayer be set before you like incense; may the lifting up of my hands be like the evening sacrifice.

verses.name: Psalms 141:3
verses.text: Set a guard over my mouth, O LORD; keep watch over the door of my lips.

verses.name: Psalms 141:4
verses.text: Let not my heart be drawn to what is evil, to take part in wicked deeds with men who are evildoers; let me not eat of their delicacies.

verses.name: Psalms 141:5
verses.text: Let a righteous man strike me-it is a kindness; let him rebuke me-it is oil on my head. My head will not refuse it. Yet my prayer is ever against the deeds of evildoers;

verses.name: Psalms 141:6
verses.text: their rulers will be thrown down from the cliffs, and the wicked will learn that my words were well spoken.

verses.name: Psalms 141:7
verses.text: They will say, "As one plows and breaks up the earth, so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of the grave. "

verses.name: Psalms 141:8
verses.text: But my eyes are fixed on you, O Sovereign LORD; in you I take refuge-do not give me over to death.

verses.name: Psalms 141:9
verses.text: Keep me from the snares they have laid for me, from the traps set by evildoers.

verses.name: Psalms 141:10
verses.text: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by in safety.

verses.name: Psalms 142:1
verses.text: I cry aloud to the LORD; I lift up my voice to the LORD for mercy.

verses.name: Psalms 142:2
verses.text: I pour out my complaint before him; before him I tell my trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 142:3
verses.text: When my spirit grows faint within me, it is you who know my way. In the path where I walk men have hidden a snare for me.

verses.name: Psalms 142:4
verses.text: Look to my right and see; no one is concerned for me. I have no refuge; no one cares for my life.

verses.name: Psalms 142:5
verses.text: I cry to you, O LORD; I say, "You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living."

verses.name: Psalms 142:6
verses.text: Listen to my cry, for I am in desperate need; rescue me from those who pursue me, for they are too strong for me.

verses.name: Psalms 142:7
verses.text: Set me free from my prison, that I may praise your name. Then the righteous will gather about me because of your goodness to me.

verses.name: Psalms 143:1
verses.text: O LORD, hear my prayer, listen to my cry for mercy; in your faithfulness and righteousness come to my relief.

verses.name: Psalms 143:2
verses.text: Do not bring your servant into judgment, for no one living is righteous before you.

verses.name: Psalms 143:3
verses.text: The enemy pursues me, he crushes me to the ground; he makes me dwell in darkness like those long dead.

verses.name: Psalms 143:4
verses.text: So my spirit grows faint within me; my heart within me is dismayed.

verses.name: Psalms 143:5
verses.text: I remember the days of long ago; I meditate on all your works and consider what your hands have done.

verses.name: Psalms 143:6
verses.text: I spread out my hands to you; my soul thirsts for you like a parched land. Selah

verses.name: Psalms 143:7
verses.text: Answer me quickly, O LORD; my spirit fails. Do not hide your face from me or I will be like those who go down to the pit.

verses.name: Psalms 143:8
verses.text: Let the morning bring me word of your unfailing love, for I have put my trust in you. Show me the way I should go, for to you I lift up my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 143:9
verses.text: Rescue me from my enemies, O LORD, for I hide myself in you.

verses.name: Psalms 143:10
verses.text: Teach me to do your will, for you are my God; may your good Spirit lead me on level ground.

verses.name: Psalms 143:11
verses.text: For your name's sake, O LORD, preserve my life; in your righteousness, bring me out of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 143:12
verses.text: In your unfailing love, silence my enemies; destroy all my foes, for I am your servant.

verses.name: Psalms 144:1
verses.text: Praise be to the LORD my Rock, who trains my hands for war, my fingers for battle.

verses.name: Psalms 144:2
verses.text: He is my loving God and my fortress, my stronghold and my deliverer, my shield, in whom I take refuge, who subdues peoples under me.

verses.name: Psalms 144:3
verses.text: O LORD, what is man that you care for him, the son of man that you think of him?

verses.name: Psalms 144:4
verses.text: Man is like a breath; his days are like a fleeting shadow.

verses.name: Psalms 144:5
verses.text: Part your heavens, O LORD, and come down; touch the mountains, so that they smoke.

verses.name: Psalms 144:6
verses.text: Send forth lightning and scatter {the enemies}; shoot your arrows and rout them.

verses.name: Psalms 144:7
verses.text: Reach down your hand from on high; deliver me and rescue me from the mighty waters, from the hands of foreigners

verses.name: Psalms 144:8
verses.text: whose mouths are full of lies, whose right hands are deceitful.

verses.name: Psalms 144:9
verses.text: I will sing a new song to you, O God; on the ten-stringed lyre I will make music to you,

verses.name: Psalms 144:10
verses.text: to the One who gives victory to kings, who delivers his servant David from the deadly sword.

verses.name: Psalms 144:11
verses.text: Deliver me and rescue me from the hands of foreigners whose mouths are full of lies, whose right hands are deceitful.

verses.name: Psalms 144:12
verses.text: Then our sons in their youth will be like well-nurtured plants, and our daughters will be like pillars carved to adorn a palace.

verses.name: Psalms 144:13
verses.text: Our barns will be filled with every kind of provision. Our sheep will increase by thousands, by tens of thousands in our fields;

verses.name: Psalms 144:14
verses.text: our oxen will draw heavy loads. There will be no breaching of walls, no going into captivity, no cry of distress in our streets.

verses.name: Psalms 144:15
verses.text: Blessed are the people of whom this is true; blessed are the people whose God is the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 145:1
verses.text: I will exalt you, my God the King; I will praise your name for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 145:2
verses.text: Every day I will praise you and extol your name for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 145:3
verses.text: Great is the LORD and most worthy of praise; his greatness no one can fathom.

verses.name: Psalms 145:4
verses.text: One generation will commend your works to another; they will tell of your mighty acts.

verses.name: Psalms 145:5
verses.text: They will speak of the glorious splendor of your majesty, and I will meditate on your wonderful works.

verses.name: Psalms 145:6
verses.text: They will tell of the power of your awesome works, and I will proclaim your great deeds.

verses.name: Psalms 145:7
verses.text: They will celebrate your abundant goodness and joyfully sing of your righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 145:8
verses.text: The LORD is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and rich in love.

verses.name: Psalms 145:9
verses.text: The LORD is good to all; he has compassion on all he has made.

verses.name: Psalms 145:10
verses.text: All you have made will praise you, O LORD; your saints will extol you.

verses.name: Psalms 145:11
verses.text: They will tell of the glory of your kingdom and speak of your might,

verses.name: Psalms 145:12
verses.text: so that all men may know of your mighty acts and the glorious splendor of your kingdom.

verses.name: Psalms 145:13
verses.text: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and your dominion endures through all generations. The LORD is faithful to all his promises and loving toward all he has made.

verses.name: Psalms 145:14
verses.text: The LORD upholds all those who fall and lifts up all who are bowed down.

verses.name: Psalms 145:15
verses.text: The eyes of all look to you, and you give them their food at the proper time.

verses.name: Psalms 145:16
verses.text: You open your hand and satisfy the desires of every living thing.

verses.name: Psalms 145:17
verses.text: The LORD is righteous in all his ways and loving toward all he has made.

verses.name: Psalms 145:18
verses.text: The LORD is near to all who call on him, to all who call on him in truth.

verses.name: Psalms 145:19
verses.text: He fulfills the desires of those who fear him; he hears their cry and saves them.

verses.name: Psalms 145:20
verses.text: The LORD watches over all who love him, but all the wicked he will destroy.

verses.name: Psalms 145:21
verses.text: My mouth will speak in praise of the LORD. Let every creature praise his holy name for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 146:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 146:2
verses.text: I will praise the LORD all my life; I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.

verses.name: Psalms 146:3
verses.text: Do not put your trust in princes, in mortal men, who cannot save.

verses.name: Psalms 146:4
verses.text: When their spirit departs, they return to the ground; on that very day their plans come to nothing.

verses.name: Psalms 146:5
verses.text: Blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in the LORD his God,

verses.name: Psalms 146:6
verses.text: the Maker of heaven and earth, the sea, and everything in them- the LORD, who remains faithful forever.

verses.name: Psalms 146:7
verses.text: He upholds the cause of the oppressed and gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets prisoners free,

verses.name: Psalms 146:8
verses.text: the LORD gives sight to the blind, the LORD lifts up those who are bowed down, the LORD loves the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 146:9
verses.text: The LORD watches over the alien and sustains the fatherless and the widow, but he frustrates the ways of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 146:10
verses.text: The LORD reigns forever, your God, O Zion, for all generations. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 147:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. How good it is to sing praises to our God, how pleasant and fitting to praise him!

verses.name: Psalms 147:2
verses.text: The LORD builds up Jerusalem; he gathers the exiles of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 147:3
verses.text: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

verses.name: Psalms 147:4
verses.text: He determines the number of the stars and calls them each by name.

verses.name: Psalms 147:5
verses.text: Great is our Lord and mighty in power; his understanding has no limit.

verses.name: Psalms 147:6
verses.text: The LORD sustains the humble but casts the wicked to the ground.

verses.name: Psalms 147:7
verses.text: Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; make music to our God on the harp.

verses.name: Psalms 147:8
verses.text: He covers the sky with clouds; he supplies the earth with rain and makes grass grow on the hills.

verses.name: Psalms 147:9
verses.text: He provides food for the cattle and for the young ravens when they call.

verses.name: Psalms 147:10
verses.text: His pleasure is not in the strength of the horse, nor his delight in the legs of a man;

verses.name: Psalms 147:11
verses.text: the LORD delights in those who fear him, who put their hope in his unfailing love.

verses.name: Psalms 147:12
verses.text: Extol the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise your God, O Zion,

verses.name: Psalms 147:13
verses.text: for he strengthens the bars of your gates and blesses your people within you.

verses.name: Psalms 147:14
verses.text: He grants peace to your borders and satisfies you with the finest of wheat.

verses.name: Psalms 147:15
verses.text: He sends his command to the earth; his word runs swiftly.

verses.name: Psalms 147:16
verses.text: He spreads the snow like wool and scatters the frost like ashes.

verses.name: Psalms 147:17
verses.text: He hurls down his hail like pebbles. Who can withstand his icy blast?

verses.name: Psalms 147:18
verses.text: He sends his word and melts them; he stirs up his breezes, and the waters flow.

verses.name: Psalms 147:19
verses.text: He has revealed his word to Jacob, his laws and decrees to Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 147:20
verses.text: He has done this for no other nation; they do not know his laws. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 148:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. Praise the LORD from the heavens, praise him in the heights above.

verses.name: Psalms 148:2
verses.text: Praise him, all his angels, praise him, all his heavenly hosts.

verses.name: Psalms 148:3
verses.text: Praise him, sun and moon, praise him, all you shining stars.

verses.name: Psalms 148:4
verses.text: Praise him, you highest heavens and you waters above the skies.

verses.name: Psalms 148:5
verses.text: Let them praise the name of the LORD, for he commanded and they were created.

verses.name: Psalms 148:6
verses.text: He set them in place for ever and ever; he gave a decree that will never pass away.

verses.name: Psalms 148:7
verses.text: Praise the LORD from the earth, you great sea creatures and all ocean depths,

verses.name: Psalms 148:8
verses.text: lightning and hail, snow and clouds, stormy winds that do his bidding,

verses.name: Psalms 148:9
verses.text: you mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars,

verses.name: Psalms 148:10
verses.text: wild animals and all cattle, small creatures and flying birds,

verses.name: Psalms 148:11
verses.text: kings of the earth and all nations, you princes and all rulers on earth,

verses.name: Psalms 148:12
verses.text: young men and maidens, old men and children.

verses.name: Psalms 148:13
verses.text: Let them praise the name of the LORD, for his name alone is exalted; his splendor is above the earth and the heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 148:14
verses.text: He has raised up for his people a horn, the praise of all his saints, of Israel, the people close to his heart. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 149:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. Sing to the LORD a new song, his praise in the assembly of the saints.

verses.name: Psalms 149:2
verses.text: Let Israel rejoice in their Maker; let the people of Zion be glad in their King.

verses.name: Psalms 149:3
verses.text: Let them praise his name with dancing and make music to him with tambourine and harp.

verses.name: Psalms 149:4
verses.text: For the LORD takes delight in his people; he crowns the humble with salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 149:5
verses.text: Let the saints rejoice in this honor and sing for joy on their beds.

verses.name: Psalms 149:6
verses.text: May the praise of God be in their mouths and a double-edged sword in their hands,

verses.name: Psalms 149:7
verses.text: to inflict vengeance on the nations and punishment on the peoples,

verses.name: Psalms 149:8
verses.text: to bind their kings with fetters, their nobles with shackles of iron,

verses.name: Psalms 149:9
verses.text: to carry out the sentence written against them. This is the glory of all his saints. Praise the LORD.

verses.name: Psalms 150:1
verses.text: Praise the LORD. Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in his mighty heavens.

verses.name: Psalms 150:2
verses.text: Praise him for his acts of power; praise him for his surpassing greatness.

verses.name: Psalms 150:3
verses.text: Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet, praise him with the harp and lyre,

verses.name: Psalms 150:4
verses.text: praise him with tambourine and dancing, praise him with the strings and flute,

verses.name: Psalms 150:5
verses.text: praise him with the clash of cymbals, praise him with resounding cymbals.

verses.name: Psalms 150:6
verses.text: Let everything that has breath praise the LORD. Praise the LORD.
